title: Category Manager
description:
**ABOUT US**

**PHINIA:** Advancing sustainability today, powering a cleaner tomorrow.

PHINIA is an independent, market-leading, premium solutions and components provider with over 100 years of manufacturing expertise and industry relationships, with a strong brand portfolio that includes DELPHI¬Æ, DELCO REMY¬Æ and HARTRIDGE‚Ñ¢. With over 12,500 employees across 43 locations in 20 countries, PHINIA is headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, USA.

At PHINIA, we Provide fuel systems, electrical systems, and aftermarket products and solutions of the highest quality ‚Äî developed and manufactured responsibly ‚Äî that are designed to enhance efficiency and reduce the environmental impact of vehicles, industrial machinery, and other applications. In doing so, we contribute to a cleaner tomorrow, treat our people and surrounding communities with respect, and hold ourselves accountable to robust ethical standards.

**Our Culture**

PHINIA promotes and cultivates an inclusive culture and diverse perspectives, strives to maintain its reputation for excellence, thrives on the power of collaboration, and fosters the development of our talented employees. We believe in making a positive impact through our business and actions, and we take our collective responsibility seriously.

**Career Opportunities**

We believe in building a brighter tomorrow for our employees as well as our customers and encourage you to learn about our long history, strong culture, new technologies, and future vision. We offer a strong local presence and interesting global opportunities. Join us on this shared journey toward a brighter tomorrow.

**JOB PURPOSE**

We are seeking a results-driven Category Manager to lead and grow our automotive aftermarket chassis and friction product lines in Asia Pacific.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **Product and Range**

  + Implement 2030 product strategy on chassis and friction product lines.
  + Yearly Fine-tune product strategy based on market and channel status
  + Define product line positioning together with local sales team.
  + Define new product programs together with Global Product Line Management team and implementation plan.
  + Define product specification. Liaise with Global Product Line Management and Technical teams regarding technical spec, feeding in requirement for market positioning.
  + Track new product development and sales status in AP, and PDP effectiveness alignment among related teams.
  + Set up or update product life cycle management policy and implement product policy for AP range.
  + Regular review of range; from gap analysis against vehicle parc and competitor comparisons to cleanliness of the range.

* **Communication**

  + Create sales argumentation and product advantages with support from Global Product Line Management and Engineering teams. Liaise with sales to train customers on features and benefits over our competitors. Create marcomms materials in support of B&C team support.
  + Undertake Key customer presentations in AP.
  + Feedback market requirements and modify product marketing offerings.

* **Price and Promotion**

  + Program annual price policy and promotion scheme by product line.
  + Manage product GM to achieve the set target by product line.
  + Monitor customer requirements and competitor moves, regular price benchmarking.
  + Monitor the key material movement liaising with Purchasing team.
  + Responsibility for Product Line Sales and Gross Margin target in AP.

* **Go to market activities and sales forecast management**

  + Support product launch for key customers.
  + Evaluate channel expansion plan with sales and operation team based on aligned channel strategy.
  + Monthly sale Forecast and inventory forecast based on sales analysis and market movement.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

We provide compensation and benefits programs intended to attract, motivate, reward, and retain an incredibly talented, globally diverse workforce at all levels within our organization. Our compensation programs are informed by market data and business needs, and we are committed to providing equitable and competitive compensation. We are committed to providing our team with quality and competitive benefit programs, including health and well-being resources, family-centric policies, and an agile workplace program, where not precluded by collective bargaining agreements or national statutory plans. Plans are benchmarked for competitiveness and value.

We provide formal development opportunities at all levels and stages of employee careers. These opportunities are delivered in a variety of formats to make our portfolio of solutions agile, sustainable, and scalable to support our employees in developing the skills needed to succeed.

**WHAT WE BELIEVE**

* Product Leadership - Innovation that brings value to our customers

* Humility - Seeking out diverse perspectives and working collaboratively

* Inclusivity - Recognizing our differences makes us stronger; we are bold and intentional

* Net-Zero - Committed to energy efficiency, waste reduction and beneficial reuse

* Integrity - Taking responsibility for our decisions and doing what is right

* Accountability - Taking ownership of our actions and driving results

**SAFETY**

You will consistently hear us say Safety First! We are committed to continually improving our strong safety performance supporting the health and wellness of our employees!

We also believe employee health and safety is everyone‚Äôs responsibility. We encourage safety learning and collaboration to help employees understand and follow applicable safety policies, standards, and procedures and identify opportunities to minimize or eliminate risk. Work is expected to be conducted in a manner that stresses the importance of preventing incidents and illnesses, including attending all required safety meetings and trainings. It is expected that all incidents, near misses, and unsafe conditions are immediately reported to the direct manager, Human Resources, or Safety Representative.

**EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY**

PHINIA is an equal employment opportunity employer such that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

**VISA SPONSORSHIP**

PHINIA does provide sponsorship for employment visa status based on business need. However, for this role, applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full-time basis, in the country where the position is currently based.

**NO UNAUTHORIZED REFERRALS FROM RECRUITERS & VENDORS**

Please note that PHINIA does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or offers from third party recruiters or staffing agencies associated with any published or unpublished employment opportunities. Any unsolicited information sent to PHINIA will be considered as unencumbered and free from any fee or charge whatsoever. Only members of our Human Resources Team have the authority to engage or authorize recruiting services, which must be agreed upon before the unsolicited resume or offer is received.

**GLOBAL TERMS OF USE AND PRIVACY STATEMENT**

**Carefully read the PHINIA Privacy Policy before using this website. Your ability to access and use this website and apply for a job at PHINIA are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

***Career Scam Disclaimer:***

*PHINIA makes no representations or guarantees regarding employment opportunities listed on any third-party website. To protect against career scams, job applicants should take the necessary precautions when interviewing for and accepting employment positions allegedly offered by PHINIA. Applicants should never provide their national ID numbers, birth dates, credit card numbers, bank account information or other private information when communicating with prospective employers or responding to employment opportunities online. Job applicants are invited to contact PHINIA through PHINIA‚Äôs website to verify the authenticity of any employment opportunities.*

Advancing sustainability today, powering a cleaner tomorrow. Join us on this shared journey to a brighter tomorrow. For more information about PHINIA, please visit www.phinia.com .

title: Senior Associate, Client Onboarding, SME Banking
description:
**Requisition Number:** 47734

**Job Location:** Singapore, SGP

**Work Type:** Office Working

**Employment Type:** Permanent

**Posting Start Date:** 28/01/2026

**Posting End Date:** 11/02/2026

**:**

**Responsibilities**

  

**Strategy**

The Client Onboarding reviewer works in partnership with RM to get the client file to required standards of SME Banking, will be responsible for assessing the risks of the client, provide assurance to the Business that the client file meets requirements and approve the file. Role comes with additional responsibilities to support the SME Banking network and international proposition.

  

**Business**

Business Enabling support to SME Banking Front Office for all Client Onboarding related matters. Main knowledge to support cross border account opening is critical.

  

**Processes**

* KYC/ CDD Account Opening
* Manage client approval end to end for the SME Banking files
* Review New Account Opening Documentation for completeness and validity
* Review accounts against all set internal standards for Client Due Diligence
* Check quality of the Source of Wealth if it meets set standards for On-boarding
* Conduct name screenings, adverse media findings, Sanctions links, Tax red flags
* Ensure complete and accurate record keeping of all relevant communications

* Ensure accuracy of data captured in SME system
* Advise frontline on SME CDD policy and procedures and applicable local regulations
* Escalate higher risk relationships and reputation risks arising from CDD to SME Compliance
* Consult with functional experts (i.e. Legal, Compliance, Tax) as needed
* Contribute to the implementation and controls for daily processes
* Comply to agreed Turn Around Times for assigned activities as detailed in the Document Operating Instructions and the Service Level Agreements
* Promote the spirit of continuous improvement by flagging any procedural issues that impact delivery of responsibilities with suggestions improvements and work around

  

**People & Talent**

* Solid knowledge and understanding of regulatory requirements relating to SME Banking CDD/AML
* Excellent verbal, presentation and written communication skills
* People and service oriented. A team player.
* High level of integrity and professionalism, with High attention to detail

**Risk Management**

Execution responsibility for identifying, assessing, monitoring, controlling, and mitigating financial crime risks, sanctions risks and reputational risks to the Group. Also, an awareness and understanding of the main risks facing the Group and the role the individual plays in managing them.

  

**Governance**

Group Procedures including Group CDD Standards, SME Banking Segment Addendum and Country Addendum as well as guidance and department operating instructions.

  

**Regulatory & Business Conduct**

* Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group‚Äôs Values and Code of Conduct.
* Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
* Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.

**Key Stakeholders**

* SME Market and Business Heads across the SME network
* SME Banking Relationship Managers, Team Leaders and Client Services Managers
* CFCC Advisory team
* COO, Onboarding, WRB & COO, SME Banking
* Head, Business Enablement & Strategic Initiatives, SME Banking

  

**Other Responsibilities**

* Do the right thing: Be brave, be the change; Think client; Live with integrity
* Never Settle: Continuously improve and innovate; Simplify; Learn from your successes and failures
* Better together: See more in others; How can I help? Build for the long term

  

**Our Ideal Candidate**

* Bachelors Degree
* ACAMS or ICA Certification would be preferred.
* 3+ years of experience in SME Banking

  

**Role Specific Technical Competencies**

* Manage Conduct
* Manage Risk
* Manage Stakeholders

**About Standard Chartered**

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.

Together we:

* **Do the right thing** and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
* **Never settle,** continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
* **Are better together,** we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

**What we offer**

**In line with our Fair Pay Charter,** we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.

* **Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance,** with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
* **Time-off** including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
* **Flexible working** options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
* **Proactive wellbeing support** through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
* **A continuous learning culture** to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
* **Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation,** one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

**Recruitment Assessments**

Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers
company_description: If you‚Äôre looking for a career with purpose and want to work for a bank making a difference, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

title: Integrated Social Lead, APAC + SG
company: WPP MEDIA ASIA PACIFIC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
description:
About¬†WPP Media¬†

WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet,¬†clients¬†and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.¬†

WPP Media is WPP‚Äôs global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com¬†

At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people.¬†It‚Äôs¬†what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media‚Äôs shared core values:¬†

  • Be¬†Extraordinary¬†by¬†Leading Collectively¬†to¬†Inspire transformational Creativity.¬†
  • Create an¬†Open¬†environment by¬†Balancing People and Client Experiences¬†by¬†Cultivating Trust.¬†
  • Lead¬†Optimistically¬†by¬†Championing Growth¬†and Development¬†to¬†Mobilize the Enterprise.¬†

Role Summary and Impact¬†

The Integrated Social Lead will define, champion, and evolve WPP Media's market-leading paid social media strategy and capabilities across the diverse markets of the Asia Pacific region. This role is tasked with building an industry-leading paid social practice that delivers media transformation¬†for clients by leveraging advanced tactics across¬†all¬†relevant platforms. The mission is to drive superior media performance, seamlessly integrate paid social with broader media planning and buying, set regional standards of excellence, and achieve measurable business outcomes.

The Integrated Social Lead, APAC, will be a visionary architect, shaping and leading WPP Media's paid social discipline across the dynamic and diverse markets of the APAC region, with particular attention to Singapore Local and¬†Regional Clients. This role demands a unique blend of strategic foresight, commercial acumen, creative innovation, and analytical prowess, with a deep understanding of how to optimize paid social strategies within holistic media plans across¬†all social platforms. This leader will define regional best practices for paid social, foster collaboration across WPP Media agencies and client teams, and drive cutting-edge solutions. They will mobilize the enterprise¬†to deliver unparalleled paid social expertise, leveraging WPP Media's proprietary technologies, industry-leading platform accreditations, and scaled partnerships to build better futures for our clients and communities in APAC + SG.

Skills and Experience¬†

1. Paid Social Strategy & Leadership

  • Define and lead WPP Media's overarching paid social media strategy for the APAC¬†region, aligning with media¬†transformation¬†and client success across¬†all social platforms¬†within the regional media context.
  • Champion a unified paid social practice framework, integrating planning and buying into holistic media strategies, while developing advanced first-party data strategies for enhanced targeting and measurement.
  • Identify, integrate, and operationalize emerging paid social trends, platform innovations, and strategic opportunities (e.g., AI in paid social, advanced programmatic buying, new media products).
  • Guide performance creative strategies, leveraging DCO and AI-driven creative, and utilize automation and machine learning for predictive campaign optimization and efficient activation across paid social channels.

2. Client Engagement & Thought Leadership

  • Act as a senior strategic advisor for WPP Media's¬†top-tier clients within the APAC region, positioning the organization as the authoritative voice in paid social strategy, execution, and media investment across¬†all social platforms.
  • Cultivate trust¬†and expand long-term relationships by providing visionary insights on cross-platform social media allocation, budgeting, and performance, driving new business and shaping regional market narratives.

3. Performance Measurement & Optimization¬†

  • Establish and drive advanced measurement methodologies, including incrementality testing, multi-touch attribution, and unified media measurement models, for paid social media effectiveness and ROI across various client portfolios.
  • Lead actionable analytics and A/B testing to continuously optimize paid social strategies and campaigns, enhancing engagement, audience growth, and demonstrable business outcomes across all regional markets.

4. Governance, Standards & Platform Alliances

  • Establish and uphold regional standards for paid social media excellence, compliance, and ethical engagement across WPP Media's network, considering local regulations and media buying guidelines.
  • Lead strategic alliances with¬†all top social platforms¬†and significant regional platforms, fostering innovation, competitive advantage, and access to beta features, particularly concerning¬†media products, data, and measurement capabilities.

5. Collaboration & Talent Development

  • Lead collectively¬†by fostering strong collaboration and knowledge sharing across WPP Media's diverse agencies and expert communities (creative, strategy, data, media buying) within APAC + SG for paid social initiatives.
  • Mentor, inspire, and develop high-performance paid social media professionals across the APAC + SG region, fostering continuous learning and growth with an emphasis on integrated social and media expertise.

Qualifications

  • Experience:¬†10-12+ years progressive experience in paid social media leadership within a large media agency network, global media buying entity, or media-focused global brand. Extensive experience leading paid social strategy, execution, and significant media planning/buying across multiple APAC markets, including Singapore, is essential.¬†Expertise in optimizing media spend across¬†all major social platforms.
  • Paid Social & Media Expertise:¬†In-depth expertise across¬†all aspects of paid social media: strategy, planning, activation, optimization, and measurement across comprehensive social platforms. Deep understanding of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, local APAC laws), first-party data strategies, and how paid social integrates with broader marketing and media channels, considering APAC + SG market characteristics.
  • Strategic & Analytical Acumen:¬†Exceptional ability to translate complex challenges into clear, compelling paid social strategies. Superior analytical skills for interpreting data, identifying trends, and driving measurable business outcomes across diverse regional markets and¬†integrated media campaigns.
  • Regional Leadership & Communication:¬†Outstanding leadership, communication (both written and oral), and interpersonal skills for leading a diverse, multi-market practice. Proven track record of leading high-performance, geographically dispersed teams, fostering innovation, and collaborating effectively across cross-functional partners.
  • Innovation & Future-Forward Mindset:¬†Highly forward-thinking with a relentless curiosity for emerging trends and technologies (GenAI in paid social/media, DCO, automation) relevant to APAC. Profound passion for brand building, digital content amplification, and leveraging creativity/media effectively, aligned with WPP Media's media¬†transformation¬†identity. Strong understanding of creative's interplay with paid media performance.
  • Technical & Platform Fluency:¬†Advanced proficiency in social media advertising platforms, bidding strategies, measurement tools, and analytics. Extensive experience with all major social advertising platforms and media buying tools prevalent in APAC.

Life at¬†WPP Media¬†& Benefits¬†

Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and¬†we‚Äôre¬†just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the¬†cutting edge¬†of marketing and advertising. We have a variety of employee resource groups and host frequent in-office events¬†showcasing¬†team wins, sharing thought leadership, and celebrating holidays and milestone events. Our benefits include competitive medical, group retirement plans, vision, and dental insurance, significant paid time off, preferential partner discounts, and employee mental health awareness days.¬†¬†¬†

WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to¬†particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.¬†

We believe the best work happens when¬†we're¬†together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection.¬†That's¬†why¬†we‚Äôve¬†adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you¬†require¬†accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.¬†

Please read our Privacy Notice (https://www.wppmedia.com/pages/privacy-policy)¬†for more information on how we process the information you provide.¬†

While we appreciate all applications received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.‚ÄØ¬†

title: Software Development Manager
description:
Job Requisition ID #

26WD94954

Position Overview

Join us as a Software Development Manager and help shape the future of the Reality Capture Product Line Group in Singapore. You‚Äôll be instrumental in leading and forming new Scrum teams focused on developing cutting-edge technologies that bridge the physical and digital worlds. Our team transforms real-world data‚Äîsuch as 3D laser scans, drone imagery, and photogrammetry‚Äîinto intelligent digital models that power workflows across architecture, engineering, construction, and infrastructure.

We specialize in large-scale point cloud processing, intelligent mesh generation, automated feature extraction, and seamless integration with industry-leading design tools like Revit, Civil 3D, and AutoCAD. By enabling customers to capture, analyze, and collaborate with real-world data, we drive efficiency, sustainability, and innovation in how projects are designed, built, and maintained.

As a Software Development Manager, you will play a pivotal role in how we design, build, and deliver products to millions of professionals worldwide. You‚Äôll manage a cross-functional team focused on developing and maintaining software across a range of products and components, including sustainability insights. We‚Äôre looking for an aspiring leader and strong communicator with a balanced skill set in people management, technical expertise, and project leadership. If you‚Äôve led agile teams in a scaled environment, know how to nurture talent, champion best practices, foster open collaboration, and guide high-performing teams toward delivering impactful solutions‚Äîthis is your opportunity to make a difference.

Responsibilities

* Collaborate with your team to understand requirements, evaluate new features, and drive technology roadmap decisions
* Engage proactively with customers and internal stakeholders to align on project goals and requirements
* Promote open/inner source development models to foster collaboration across Autodesk
* Partner with other teams to achieve cross-organizational objectives
* Lead hiring and onboarding efforts to build a strong engineering team
* Plan and manage successful software development releases
* Monitor team performance to ensure timely and high-quality project delivery
* Provide professional coaching, set clear goals, foster a feedback culture, and support the growth of talented engineers
* Inspire and motivate team members to maximize productivity and creativity.
* Champion Autodesk‚Äôs culture and values

Minimum Qualifications

* Master‚Äôs degree (preferred) or Bachelor‚Äôs degree (minimum) in Computer Science or a related technical field
* 3+ years of experience leading software engineering teams or serving in roles such as Scrum Master
* Proven experience across the full software development lifecycle‚Äîfrom requirements analysis to delivery
* Strong track record managing complex software projects with multiple dependencies
* Experience in enterprise-level product development, delivery, and agile methodologies
* Demonstrated success in hiring and onboarding engineering talent
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to set goals, provide feedback, and foster a positive team culture
* Business-level proficiency in English

Prefer Qualifications

* Strong architectural and technical design competence, with the ability to review and guide engineering decisions across services, applications, and systems
* Deep understanding of modern software engineering practices, including software design principles, coding standards, test methodologies, and quality assurance best practices
* Practical experience with SDLC methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban) and the ability to select and apply the right process based on team and project needs
* Demonstrated ability to lead teams through complex technical delivery‚Äîevaluating feasibility, identifying dependencies, and guiding risk mitigation and trade-off decisions
* Experience designing or reviewing system architectures that emphasize maintainability, scalability, security, and alignment with product and platform roadmaps
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps workflows, automation tooling, and modern development ecosystems to support high velocity, high quality engineering output
* Ability to provide informed leadership in technical discussions, mentor engineers in design and implementation, and collaborate effectively with architects and technical leads
* Experience working with cloud connected, distributed, or enterprise grade software systems
* Strong discipline around documentation of technical specifications, design artifacts, test plans, and release processes
* Capability to evaluate technologies, tools, and frameworks to inform strategic decisions for the team and product

#LI-PW1

Learn More

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Diversity & Belonging  
We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here:

https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

title: (Location:Singapore) Field Service Engineer 1
description:
**Powering transformation for a sustainable future**

At WinGD and across the shipping industry we face unprecedented change as we strive to bring greater sustainability into our global business. As marine engine designers our responsibility in this is significant. A career with WinGD has an impact on shaping a better world for tomorrow.  
As a leading developer of the two-stroke engines that power merchant shipping, our people drive innovative solutions for our customers on a global scale. Headquartered in Winterthur, Switzerland, since its inception in 1893, WinGD continues the legacy of the Sulzer Corporation through innovation in design.  
Our success in this ever evolving, competitive environment is based on the drive, innovation and collaboration of our diverse employee population, over 420 people worldwide, representing over 25 different nationalities. Come, be a part of this change.

WinGD is looking for

**Field Service Engineers**

**We are only considering applicants with Singaporean nationality or Singaporean employment pass.**

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Carry out trouble shooting, routine maintenance for the products delivered from WinGD. Perform on-board commissioning, sea trial & maiden voyage support for 2-stroke engine. Execute warranty work, modification tasks and design upgrades.
* Implement service orders from service partners and directly from customers, support the smooth new building engine process until delivery and operation under good cooperation with stakeholders.
* Support ship owners with technical solutions.
* Generate service report, trial reports and memos for all attended events and activities.
* Progress update, perform final test, handing over, collect timesheet and expenses, prepare Service Work Report
* Responsible for the team under his/her responsibilities during the work execution.
* Perform daily office activities as required.
* Responsible for HSE during the work execution.
* Provide internal and external reports and as built documentation.
* Collect and organize time and expense reports after completion of the respective works, report and inform the administrative personnel as required.
* Provide maintenance / commissioning / troubleshooting support activities as directed.
* Attending training course as trainer to train customers when requested.
* Convincing and initiative attitude to explain technical issues in an educative and coaching way.
* Maintain a good relationship with customers without compromising WinGD code of conduct policy and quality standards.

**Requirements:**

* Higher education degree (BsC Mech, and/or Elect. Engineering) with sound experience as a Service Engineer or Commissioning Engineer.
* Experience for 2-stroke engine service & operation including automation system & electronics. Preferably experience on vessels in service, main engine operation and maintenance & auxiliary equipment.
* 2-Stroke Diesel Engine Knowledge: feeling for performance, thermodynamics, vibrations, vibrations, materials and structures.
* PC user software handling and PC setup skills are necessary next to the RCS and electronics.
* Able to work self-driven and self-critical with the target of continuous improvement.
* Has a clear understanding of the key success factors in our business and job responsibility.
* Good communication skills
* Excellence English language, written and spoken
* Teamwork skills
* Customer oriented
* Ability to work under pressure
* Pro-active and self-driven way of working

**Our offer:**

* An opportunity to shape the sustainability and environmental impact of the shipping industry. WinGD is on the leading edge of the technology which is shaping the future of the shipping industry
* A dynamic working environment, blending a long history of technology expertise with industry leading innovation across a global network
* Award winning and extraordinary products
* Multi-cultural and interdisciplinary teams offering diverse perspectives and collaborative thinking
* Dynamic and interactive working conditions. WinGD offers a non-hierarchical, agile structure where input and ideas are welcome
* In-house technology training and professional development opportunities

title: Senior Analyst - Senior Principal Analyst (Projects & Partnerships /ECO)
description:
**[What the role is]**

The Energy Connections Office (ECO) is tasked to facilitate around 6GW of low-carbon electricity imports into Singapore by 2035, or about one-third of our energy demand then. You will join a dynamic and multi-disciplinary team tasked to facilitate imports into Singapore and regional grid interconnections.

**[What you will be working on]**

Specifically, you will join the Projects & Partnerships (PP) branch in ECO, where your key responsibilities will include:

* Negotiating with interested companies on their proposals and evaluating such proposals to meet our requirements for energy security, competitiveness and sustainability.
* Facilitating the development and ensuring the timely delivery of promising electricity imports projects.
* Engaging overseas government bodies to secure G2G support for cross-border electricity trading.

**[What we are looking for]**

Requirements

* Keen interest in energy transition issues and passion for the public service.
* Excited about learning new things, comfortable with navigating ambiguity, challenging the status quo, and willing to speak up and put forward new solutions.
* Strong interpersonal skills to engage and collaborate with stakeholders
* Excellent verbal communication, analytical and critical thinking skills, and prepared to deep-dive into relevant subject areas.
* Prior experience in electricity trading, industry engagement and project management is preferred
* Prepared to travel overseas for work frequently

title: Senior Manager, PLM & Transformation
description:
ResMed is embarking on a multi-year transformation across product development, PLM systems, digital workflows, and ways of working. This role will be a key leadership position driving that transformation across the Engineering organisation, enabling velocity, efficiency and certainty across the Product Development Lifecycle.

The **Senior Manager ‚Äì PLM & Transformation** will lead strategic initiatives to modernise and optimise our ecosystem (including Jama, Project/Portfolio tools, requirements management workflows, and change control), while also championing cross-functional process transformation across Engineering, V&V, Quality, Regulatory, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and PLE.

This leader will be both a strategist and an operator‚Äîable to create the transformation roadmap, partner across functions, and deliver tangible improvements that change how ResMed designs, delivers, and maintains world-class CPAP mask products.

**Key Responsibilities**
========================

**1. PLM Strategy & Leadership**
--------------------------------

* Own and define the long-term PLM strategy for the Masks business, ensuring alignment with global ResMed PLM and Digital Transformation programs.
* Lead the evolution of requirements management, change management, configuration control, and product data management practices.
* Drive adoption and optimization of PLM tools (e.g., PTC Windchill, Jira/Atlassian ecosystem, and internal portfolio tools).
* Partner with Engineering, Quality, and IT to ensure systems and processes are tightly integrated and scalable.
* Establish PLM KPIs, dashboards, and governance mechanisms.

**2. Business Process Transformation**
--------------------------------------

* Lead end-to-end transformation initiatives across the product lifecycle, from concept development through sustaining/PLE.
* Map, redesign, and streamline cross-functional processes that are currently fragmented, manual, or inconsistent.
* Drive simplification initiatives around requirements review workflows, traceability, verification planning, and regression analysis (e.g., reimagining Jama-based review processes).
* Champion digitization and automation opportunities across Engineering and adjacent functions.

**3. Stakeholder & Change Leadership**
--------------------------------------

* Work closely with senior leaders across R&D, PLE, Manufacturing, Regulatory and Quality to co-create transformation priorities.
* Build trust and alignment across globally distributed teams.
* Develop and execute change management plans to ensure adoption, behavioral change, and long-term sustainability.
* Communicate clearly at all levels‚Äîfrom executive steering groups to frontline engineering teams.

**4. Project Delivery & Governance**
------------------------------------

* Ensure on-time delivery and measurable improvements from the programme.
* Establish project governance, charters, and stage gates; ensure cross-functional accountability.
* Provide leadership, coaching, and direction to project teams (including indirect/matrix resources).
* Identify risks and drive proactive mitigation.

**5. Leadership & Team Development**
------------------------------------

* Act as a thought partner to the Engineering leadership on organizational design, operating models, and capability development.
* Coach and mentor engineers, project managers, and cross-functional partners in modern PLM and systems engineering practices.
* Foster a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, and experimentation.

**Key Skills & Experience**
===========================

**Required**
------------

* 10+ years of experience in Product Development, Systems Engineering, PLM, or Digital Transformation roles.
* Deep knowledge of PLM platforms (e.g., Windchill, Teamcenter, Agile), requirements management tools (e.g., Jama), and change control processes.
* Strong understanding of systems engineering principles, product development lifecycles, and configuration management.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams without direct authority.
* Excellent communication, senior stakeholder management, and influencing skills.
* Experience with process mapping and redesign (e.g., Lean, Six Sigma, BPMN).

**Preferred**
-------------

* Experience working with globally distributed teams across APAC and US.
* Experience integrating data flows between PLM, MES, ERP, and verification tools.
* Familiarity with CPAP/respiratory medical device development.

#LI-APAC

Joining us is more than saying ‚Äúyes‚Äù to making the world a healthier place. It‚Äôs discovering a career that‚Äôs challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Senior Product Manager-SG
description:
***\\*Hiring for a Payment Provider Company***

**About the role**

We are looking for a **Senior Product Manager, Lending & Liquidity** to own and scale one of our core capital products. This role sits at the intersection of financial product design, risk management, and platform scalability, enabling customers to unlock liquidity from their digital assets while ensuring the safety and sustainability of the system.

You will work closely with engineering, risk, compliance, operations, and commercial teams to design, launch, and iterate products that operate reliably in volatile market conditions. The role requires strong financial product intuition and comfort working with complex systems involving capital, exposure, and liquidity.

**What you will do**

* Own the end-to-end product strategy and roadmap for lending and liquidity-related products
* Design product mechanics involving collateral, LTVs, interest rates, fees, liquidation logic, and risk controls
* Translate complex financial and risk requirements into clear product requirements and execution plans
* Partner closely with risk, compliance, legal, and operations to ensure products are robust, compliant, and scalable
* Work with engineering to build resilient systems that perform under high volatility and peak demand
* Define, monitor, and iterate on key product and risk metrics (utilization, liquidation rates, exposure, revenue, etc.)
* Continuously improve customer experience while balancing capital efficiency, growth, and downside protection
* Support go-to-market activities and stakeholder communication for new launches and major enhancements

**What we are looking for**

* 5+ years of product management experience in fintech, crypto, trading, capital markets, or financial infrastructure
* Strong understanding of financial products involving balances, limits, pricing, yields, or exposure management
* Proven experience working with cross-functional teams across engineering, risk, compliance, legal, and operations
* Ability to reason clearly about trade-offs between growth, liquidity, risk, and user experience
* Comfortable operating in fast-moving, ambiguous environments
* Strong written and verbal communication skills

**Nice to have**

* Experience with lending, margin trading, derivatives, or treasury products
* Crypto and digital asset product experience
* Familiarity with DeFi protocols, on-chain mechanics, or Web3 financial primitives
* Experience building products across multiple jurisdictions or regulatory environments
* Background in systems requiring high reliability and capital safety

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: From $170,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Executive - Employee Benefits (Sales)
description:
A LEADING GLOBAL INDEPENDENT BROKER

Howden Insurance Brokers (HK) Limited is part of the London-headquartered Howden Broking Group, a leading independent, global broker with offices in over 55 countries worldwide. It is the world‚Äôs largest majority employee-owned insurance group. Its regional footprint covers Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore (regional headquarters), Thailand. Howden creates and services insurance programs across a diverse range of insurance and reinsurance specialisms on a global basis.

We are professional insurance brokers who act as intermediaries between clients and insurance companies, assisting our corporate clients in identifying the solution that best suits their needs in terms of risk management practices and financial controls, balancing premiums against a recommended level of cover.

YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Assist the sales team in preparing proposals, presentations and tender submissions.
* Support follow‚Äëup activities with prospects and clients to advance the sales cycle.
* Prepare sales reports, KPI dashboards, and analytics for management review.
* Assist in developing and maintaining marketing materials including brochures, sales decks and promotional content.
* Coordinate digital marketing activities such as website updates and social media posts (if required).
* Conduct market and competitor research to support sales strategies and targeted outreach.
* Assist with planning and execution of marketing initiatives to enhance brand awareness.
* Coordinate end‚Äëto‚Äëend logistics for client engagement and prospecting events, such as seminars, workshops, networking events and marketing activations.
* Handle pre‚Äëevent tasks; provide on‚Äësite support and assist with post‚Äëevent follow-ups.

OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE WILL BE:

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a business-related discipline (Business, Finance, Marketing, etc.) or other relevant equivalent qualifications.
* 1-3 years of experience in a B2B environment, business administration, preferably from a client servicing industry. Fresh graduate is also welcome.
* Proven ability to manage relationships with strong communication and stakeholder‚Äëengagement skills.
* Demonstrated initiative, curiosity, and interest in the insurance and health sector.
* Self‚Äëmotivated with a strong willingness to learn, explore new ideas, and proactively contribute to the team.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate, influence, and collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
* Fluency in Cantonese and English required; Mandarin proficiency is an advantage.

YOUR BENEFITS AND SALARY:

* Commensurate with qualification and experience
* Working in a collaborative and dynamic environment with development opportunities

Yes, we offer all the usual rewards and benefits ‚Äì including *hybrid working, free beverage in workplace, competitive compensation, birthday leave, employee stock options and more* ‚Äì but we know you expect all that.

What you might not expect is a job where everyone has a voice, where volunteering in the community is part of the day job, and where everyone is encouraged to play a part towards our sustainability goals. We want people who want to make a difference - not just in the workplace, but in the industry and in the wider community.

Howden starts with people ‚Äì a culture driving force in our work, pushing us to create a company we‚Äôre proud of. One that leverages the power of insurance to shape a better future, for our clients and our communities.

Our culture:

People first

We have seen time and again that when we give our teams the space to perform and the support to grow, our clients reap the rewards.

Diversity & Inclusion

We consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances.

Finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people to join Howden has been and will continue to be key. If you are interested in the above role, please send your Curriculum Vitae with full career details, availability, current and expected salary to us.

title: Commercial Project Manager
description:
**Location:**Singapore, SG, 348615

**Type of Employment:** Full-time

**Career Level:** Professional

**Job Family:**

**Date posted:** Jan 28, 2026

**Commercial Project Manager ‚Äì Project Execution and Bid Preparation**

**Uniting what‚Äôs next in traffic**

  

As a global leader for intelligent traffic solutions, we connect the dots of a new mobility revolution.

With digitalization and the use of disruptive technologies we enable cities, highway authorities, and (mobility) operators to create a new world of mobility with vehicles that are shared and connected, autonomous tunnel automation, smart tolling and adaptive traffic systems for simulation and prediction. All that allows for a totally new level of traffic management that is truly proactive.

This will transform our cities into places where people can live, work and move more freely with better quality of life, less accidents and with cleaner air. With our expertise and our solutions, we contribute to solving our climate crisis.

Urban mobility must and will change. And we will lead the way!

  

An exciting opportunity is available for a motivated commercial project professional to apply their strong commercial project delivery knowledge and Contract Management experience while also taking on responsibility in supporting the preparation and compilation of large tenders in Singapore from a commercial perspective. The **Commercial Project Manager ‚Äì Project Execution and Bid Preparation** to join our Yunex Team will be based in Singapore. The primary responsibility will be to commercially lead and execute projects in Singapore and providing support to the adjacent countries in South-east Asia, where necessary. Furthermore, the successful candidate will support the local Managing Director Finance in cost controlling, forecasting and budgeting activities including the compilation of contract claims and supporting documentation.

  

**Your key responsibilities will include:**

* Support major projects according to internal financial guidelines and external regulations, ensuring the compliance and accuracy for responsible project books on all commercial aspects.
* Support the Project Manager in managing financial results, targets, project gross profit and cash flow using assets and financing instruments.
* Provide contract management throughout the project delivery phase, including identifying, evaluating and assessing the associated risks and opportunities.
* Drive positive claim management on the project, including alignment on claim strategies with the Project Manager and compilation of claim supporting documentation.
* Actively communicating with customer's and subcontractors‚Äô commercial representatives while managing the resolution of commercial issues.
* Support the commercial aspects of bids and tenders in Singapore and other South-east Asian countries.
* Facilitate month end clearing as well as the forecast and budget process for the business including cost center controlling, budgeting, business case modelling and strategic considerations of future business opportunities.
* Interact, cooperate and collaborate with a diverse and multi-cultural project team and drive success across business units.

  

**The successful candidate demonstrates following experience & skills:**

* Degree qualified in Business, Commerce, Accounting or Economics, with sound understanding of Project Management methodologies, preferably with experience in construction contracts and/or government projects.
* A minimum of 3 years of commercial project execution experience.
* Experience in a project-based organisation is essential for this role, as well as capabilities in project accounting.
* Experience in Contract Management and commercial tendering activities.
* Experience in basic cost controlling and accounting including month end clearing, forecasting and budgeting processes.
* Certification in any accredited project management framework or commercial project certification can be considered for senior position.
* Strong communication skills, ability to build sound working relationships paired with your experience in executing contracts.
* Strong SAP and Excel skills are mandatory, further knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau or Power BI will be of advantage.

  

Yunex Traffic is a proud equal opportunity employer, creating a work environment of diversity and inclusion. Our diverse workforce cultivates Innovation and Excellence and in turn creates a workplace where our employees belong and prosper. Diversity and inclusion help us fully realise the potential of our people. As part of Yunex Traffic Ownership culture, Yunex Traffic also genuinely supports reasonable flexible working practices that empower our employees to best meet work and personal commitments.

title: CRM and Loyalty Specialist (12-months)
description:
**Ready to craft loyalty that sparkles? Come build unforgettable customer journeys with us!**

  

We are looking for an experienced **CRM** **and Loyalty** **Specialist**, based in **Singapore** **and fluent in Japanese**, to support the continued growth of our newly established **ASIA regional cluster**, with a primary focus on **Japan and Singapore** **in the first phase and Hong Kong, Taiwan and Macau in the next phase**.

  

**About the role**

  

In this role, you will take ownership of the e-mail channel for Japan and Singapore, driving planning, execution, and performance in close collaboration with global, regional, and local stakeholders. Working under the direction of the Owned and Paid Marketing Manager for the ASIA Cluster, you will play a key role in adapting global e-mail and CRM strategies to local market needs, ensuring strong alignment with broader cluster initiatives while maximizing local relevance and performance.

  

The foundation of the work will be quarterly global e-mail/CRM guidance, including centrally developed assets and e-mails built in Bloomreach. From this baseline, you will be responsible for developing and executing locally optimized e-mail plans, managing end-to-end campaign execution, and continuously improving channel performance across both markets.

  

You will foster an inclusive, engaging, and high-performing culture, embedding Pandora‚Äôs core values - **Dream, Dare, Care, and Deliver** - in everything we do.

  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and manage local e-mail/CRM channel plans for Japan and Singapore in alignment with global and ASIA cluster strategies
* Coordinate closely with local eCommerce and Merchandising teams to align e-mail activity with local initiatives, campaigns, and trading priorities
* Adapt global e-mail templates to suit local market needs, including incorporating local campaigns and sales events, and removing or replacing products that are not relevant locally
* Translate global e-mail content into Japanese and coordinate translations for Singapore where required
* Coordinate with the other Asia cluster markets to align e-mail activity with local initiatives, campaigns, and trading priorities with local team support with translation on Phase 2
* Set up and execute e-mail campaigns in the Bloomreach platform, including applying appropriate segmentation
* Monitor and analyse e-mail performance, providing clear reporting and insights to regional and global leadership
* Identify and implement local optimization opportunities to improve e-mail channel performance over time

  

**Required Experience & Skills**

* Minimally 3 years of working experience with solid understanding of e-mail and CRM best practices and hands-on experience executing e-mail campaigns
* Bachelors Degree
* Solid understanding of e-mail and CRM best practices, with hands-on experience executing e-mail campaigns
* Practical experience working with the Bloomreach platform
* Ability to work independently, take ownership of the e-mail channel, and proactively drive initiatives forward
* Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to actively engage and communicate with global partners in Copenhagen and cluster partners in the Singapore office
* Fluency in Japanese and English communication skills

  

**Why join Pandora in Asia?**

At Pandora, we‚Äôre committed to creating a workplace where people feel supported, trusted, and inspired to grow. Since 2021, we‚Äôve expanded our global workforce by 40% while reducing attrition by 25% ‚Äîprogress made possible by inclusive leadership, strong internal mobility, and a culture that values care, courage, and connection.

  

We offer a thoughtfully curated suite of benefits to support your wellbeing, growth, and lead the life you love. These include performance-based rewards and access to global leadership development programs. Our culture embraces creativity and individuality, and supports internal mobility.

  

As part of a company committed to sustainability, diversity, and craftsmanship, you‚Äôll have the platform to lead with purpose and shape the future of a globally recognised brand.

  

**Did we get your attention?**

  

Do you envision yourself in this role and are ready to shape the future of jewellery, we encourage you to apply. We review applications on a rolling basis and we recommend submitting yours as soon as possible.

  

Learn more about Pandora at www.pandoragroup.com

  

**The icing on the cake**

This role offers an opportunity in Singapore, a world-class city known for its innovation, sustainability efforts, and multicultural society ‚Äî making it the ideal location for Pandora‚Äôs regional team.

  

**About Pandora**  
Pandora is the world's largest jewellery brand, specialising in the design, crafting and marketing of accessible luxury jewellery made from high-quality materials. Each piece is created to inspire self-expression, allowing people to share their stories and passions through meaningful jewellery. Pandora jewellery is sold in more than 100 countries through 6,800 points of sale, including more than 2,700 concept stores.

  

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 37,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery using only recycled silver and gold. Pandora is committed to leadership in sustainability and has set out to halve greenhouse gas emissions across its value chain by 2030. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated revenue of DKK 31.7 billion (EUR 4.2 billion) in 2024.

  

Recognised by the Financial Times as one of Europe‚Äôs Best Workplaces and ranked #1 among Danish companies, Pandora is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We believe that reflecting the diversity of society in how we engage with our customers is essential to fulfilling our purpose: to give a voice to people‚Äôs loves. We are dedicated to nurturing a culture where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered to thrive.

  

#LI-FH1
company_description: Pandora is the world‚Äôs largest jewelry brand. The company designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewelry made from high-quality materials at affordable prices.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

title: Technical Operations Manager APAC, Hong Kong (HongKongSAR, HK)
description:
**Location:** Hong Kong, Hong Kong SAR, HK

**About the Role**

Swiss Re continues to enhance the CRES functions to better align with business needs in the region and global operating model. This regional role will be responsible for the execution of the technical facilities management and internal environment management (sustainability) workstreams.

A solid discipline of operational excellence is required for this regional facilities role. Implementation of workplace technical/engineering guidelines, standards and policy will be undertaken under the direction of the regional operations head and global process owners.

**Key Responsibilities:**

Technical Operations

Technical subject matter expertise

* ICT Facility MEP design and operation (power, cooling, safety security) to support IT production system
* Sustainability, health and well being knowledge to enhance the workplace experience and internal environmental quality.
* Design, build, commission, and maintenance track record of:
* Electrical Extra Low Voltage (ELV) system
* Mechanical systems (Chiller, AHU, PAC, FCU, etc)
* UPS/Inverter
* Lighting Control System (DALI, KNX, etc)
* Leak Detection system
* Fire alarm and intrusion system
* Plumbing
* Metering
* Access control system and CCTV
* Internet of Things (IoT)

Across areas of subject matter expertise be responsible for;

* Base Building Infrastructure and Facility Operation
* Asset Management
* Planned Maintenance (Preventive and Statutory)
* Critical Activities (Site power down, critical maintenance, IT changes)
* Incident Management
* Projects; office relocation, new site establishment, office downsizing/restack

**Internal Environment Management**

* Lead the environmental and energy management in the region in line with the environmental policy established in Swiss Re's environmental management system (ISO 14001)
* Drive continuous improvement initiative in all APAC offices according to the findings in the internal & external audits, review of EPI data trends, reflections obtained from management review.
* Secure timely reporting of Environmental Performance Indicators (EPI) and data quality.
* Conduct due diligence in the new site selection, leasing contract renewal, purchasing materials, office consumables and equipment.
* Establish and implement the carbon emission reduction pathways.
* Support the building labels certification (LEED certification or other local green building certification systems)

**Physical Security Operation**

* Coordinate with CF IT, Head Physical Security APAC and regional security system vendor for the troubleshooting and rectification of the CCTV and PACS issues.
* Remote support the testing and commissioning when there is a need of security system change.
* Review and maintain the access profiles jointly with Head Physical Security APAC.

**About You**

* Bachelor's degree, major in engineering related disciplines is a must
* ISO 14001 lead auditor certification is desired
* Minimum of 10 years‚Äô experience in engineering services operation and infra projects context.
* Corporate Real Estate experience is a must, financial services and banking industry is desired.
* Medium size (~200K sq ft) project MEP design and execution experience is a must
* Deep knowledge on Building Management System design, implementation and operation is a must
* ITIL based change & incident management knowledge and track record.
* Experience with ISO14001 standards is desired
* Solid understanding of large/complex corporations and corresponding premises needs is essential.
* Capability to provide umbrella operational function as well as detailed solutions for in-country needs.
* A refined interpersonal skill in a culturally and geographically diverse team is essential.
* Ability to meet demanding requirements and deadlines.
* Highly motivated with a strong business acumen and outstanding written/oral communication skills are essential.
* Excellent inter-personal, people management and business aligned skills, together with a strong desire to lead by example.
* Willing to travel within APAC for infra project, external ISO audit and workshops

The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process

**About Swiss Re**

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.  
  
Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.  
  
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

title: Manager/Assistant Director (FSO/FRSD)(2-Year Contract)
description:
**[What the role is]**

Purpose of Job:
  
  
You will play a crucial role in driving the strategic planning and development of innovative models to enhance Singapore‚Äôs food reserves management. Your work will contribute directly to ensuring the country‚Äôs food security by formulating and implementing strategies that enhance the resilience and sustainability of our food supply networks.

**[What you will be working on]**

**Duties:**

In this role, you will be responsible for shaping and driving strategic initiatives that ensure the effective management and development of Singapore‚Äôs food reserves. You will collaborate with internal divisions, external stakeholders, and government agencies to deliver impactful solutions that address key food security challenges.

**Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Develop strategic frameworks for effective and efficient management of food reserves, including contributing to the development of reports, presentations, and recommendations for senior management.
* Develop and review policies, reports, and proposals related to food reserves, ensuring alignment with national food security goals.
* Engage and explore industry partnerships for innovative and cost-effective solutions.
* Review existing food reserves management practices and provide actionable insights to improve service levels, reduce risks, and increase operational efficiency.
* Work closely with internal divisions and/or inter-agency to formulate and implement strategies for managing potential disruptions in food supply chains, ensuring continuous preparedness and resilience.
* Perform ad hoc duties as required by your supervisor.

**[What we are looking for]**

* Background in economics, procurement, contract management, logistics, or operations is advantageous.
* Proven ability to engage and manage relationships with key stakeholders, including government agencies, industry players, and academic institutions, to drive collaborative solutions.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess complex challenges and develop strategic recommendations.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and writing skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple strategic projects simultaneously.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.

SFA at JEM Office Tower

title: INVESTMENT ASSOCIATE / INVESTMENT MANAGER
description:
* Full-time
* Acquisitions
* Hong Kong

**ABOUT THE JOB**
-----------------

As Dash Living continues to redefine the "Living Sector" across Asia-Pacific, we are looking for a high-energy Investment Associate to Investment Manager to join our Regional Acquisitions team in Hong Kong. This is a high-visibility role at the heart of our HQ, responsible for driving our growth through strategic asset acquisitions, master leases, and management agreements.

You will be tasked with identifying and executing opportunities that scale our portfolio across diverse markets. You will bridge the gap between institutional capital and operational excellence, ensuring every acquisition aligns with our vision of providing sustainable, tech-enabled managed living solutions.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**
------------------

* End-to-End Execution: Lead the full acquisition lifecycle‚Äîfrom initial sourcing and proprietary deal flow generation to due diligence, structuring, and final closing.
* Regional Strategy: Evaluate investment opportunities across diverse markets (including HK, Singapore, and Japan), adapting underwriting assumptions to local market nuances and regulatory frameworks.
* Complex Financial Engineering: Develop, maintain, and audit sophisticated financial models (IRR, NPV, Waterfall structures) to evaluate various deal types, including asset-heavy acquisitions and asset-light management contracts.
* Stakeholder Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for institutional partners, REITs, family offices, and developers.
* Investment Committee Leadership: Prepare and present comprehensive Investment Committee (IC) memos, defending assumptions and providing strategic recommendations to senior leadership.
* Post-Acquisition Integration: Work closely with the Operations and Property Management teams to ensure a seamless transition from "deal closed" to "asset stabilized."
* Capital Raising Support: Assist in the preparation of marketing materials and data rooms for fundraising efforts at both the corporate and project levels.

  

**WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR**
--------------------------

* 2‚Äì5 years in Real Estate Private Equity, Investment Banking, or Real Estate Corporate Finance.
* Broad exposure to Asia-Pacific real estate markets; experience in "Living Sectors" (Co-living, Multifamily, or Hospitality) is highly preferred.
* Expert-level financial modeling skills and a deep understanding of deal structuring (legal, tax, and capital stacks).
* Ability to look beyond the spreadsheet to identify operational efficiencies and value-add opportunities.
* Refined presentation skills; ability to articulate complex investment theses to diverse stakeholders in English (additional languages like Cantonese or Mandarin are a plus).
* A "self-starter" mentality comfortable in a fast-paced, high-growth HQ environment.

  

**WHAT WE OFFER**
-----------------

* Opportunity to build Asia‚Äôs leading living sector brand in Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore and **beyond**.
* A dynamic startup environment with clear career progression
* Experience in working with overseas teams
* Great platform to perform and learn for the best
* Fringe benefits + extra leave entitlement.
