title: Associate Director, Paytech Product Management
description:
**Requisition Number:** 47674

**Job Location:** Singapore, SGP

**Work Type:** Hybrid Working

**Employment Type:** Permanent

**Posting Start Date:** 28/01/2026

**Posting End Date:** 11/02/2026

**:**

**JOB SUMMARY**

* We are seeking an enthusiastic product manager to be part of the team driving growth and innovation for our Paytech and Fintech propositions. Reporting to the Paytech Product lead, this will sit within our group product team and require active engagement with a variety of stakeholders.
* This role encompasses core product management responsibilities, assisting in commercialisation strategies with risk and governance oversight.
* A solution-orientated mindset who understands Paytech client personas and needs and can curate product as per the regulatory conditions and bank risk appetite.
* Ensure capability matrix and client facing collateral relating to Paytech and Fintech propositions are maintained and up to date.
* Work closely with group and country product, technology and operations to design and launch scalable solutions.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Strategy**  

* Assist to maintain a Current state position and Roadmap plan for Paytech solutions in collaboration with Frontline and Product management.
* Help to drive execution of the Paytech product roadmap in collaboration with different stakeholders.
* Stay tuned to the of market trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes to ensure the product suite remains innovative and relevant.

**Business**  

* Have a working knowledge of Paytech/Fintech client personas to understand needs, challenges and potential solutions.
* Contribute to the framework and guidelines on flows supported across markets.
* Collaborate with key country product managers to ensure product readiness before pilot / launch, including governance approvals, commercialization tool kits, product packs and training.
* Analyse product performance using data-driven approach, identifying areas for improvement.

**Processes**

* Work closely with Cash, FX and Digital Channels Product Management and Development, Technology, Operations and Compliance to ensure detailed business flows are documented.
* Look for opportunities to optimise the end-to-end product lifecycle, across processes and execute necessary steps.
* Contribute and communicate to the various working group and committees to ensure Product related aspects are fully understood and addressed.
* Ensure capability matrix and client facing collateral relating to Paytech are maintained and up to date.
* Assist in the respective PayTech Client governance and Cash Deal Reviews process.

**People & Talent**  

* Lead through client outcomes, collaboration and influence, to drive superior results.
* Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values.
* Set appropriate tone and expectations amongst colleagues and work in collaboration with risk and control partners.
* Ensure active communication of vision, priorities, and progress to the business to foster engagement, awareness and motivation.

**Risk Management**

* Work closely with Product Risk to create frameworks and documentation to clarify the Paytech product risk appetite, scope and out of scope.
* Maintain an active engagement model with FCC teams to ensure Paytech solutions are adequately understood, catered for, tested and approved.
* Willingness to ‚Äòspeak up‚Äô in the event of any realized or perceived breach of group conduct rules or laws by colleagues.

**Governance**

* Assist in the regulatory deliverables that Product needs to work on as part of the Group regulatory requirements.

**Regulatory & Business Conduct**

* Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group‚Äôs Values and Code of Conduct.
* Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
* Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.
* Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank‚Äôs Conduct Principles

**Key Stakeholders**  
**External**  

* Paytech and Fintech Clients
* Regulators
* Fintech and other related Industry Associations
* Competitors (for industry initiatives)

Internal

* Central and regional / local product management
* CCIB Coverage, TB Sales, respective country/region Heads
* Technology & Operations
* Digital Channels
* CFCC and Legal
* FCSO

**Our Ideal Candidate**

* Experience in cross-border and domestic payments.
* Knowledge of FX, virtual accounts, domestic payment clearing systems, IS020022
* On-behalf-of and nested payment flows
* 5 plus years experience in Banking (Payments) or a Fintech
* Regulatory environment within the Financial Services industry
* Technical appreciation on payment message formats, APIs, embedded solutions
* Good influencing and negotiation skills
* A self-starter with a proactive approach to problem solving and independently driving initiatives from concept to implementation.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple deliverables across various stakeholders.
* Displays flexibility and adaptability, with a willingness to take on new challenges and expand scope of responsibilities as business needs evolve.

**Role Specific Technical Competencies**

* Knowledge of FX
* Fintech
* Payments
* API

**About Standard Chartered**

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.

Together we:

* **Do the right thing** and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
* **Never settle,** continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
* **Are better together,** we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

**What we offer**

**In line with our Fair Pay Charter,** we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.

* **Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance,** with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
* **Time-off** including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
* **Flexible working** options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
* **Proactive wellbeing support** through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
* **A continuous learning culture** to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
* **Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation,** one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

**Recruitment Assessments**

Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

Visit our careers website www.sc.com/careers

description:

**Employment Type:** Permanent

**:**

**JOB SUMMARY**

CIB Operations supports Bank‚Äôs Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) business, delivering a wide range of client support activities across trade, payments, client onboarding and risk services across Bank‚Äôs global footprint. With presence in 50+ markets and deep process expertise, the function play a critical role in enabling seamless client delivery and operational excellence.

  

Standard Chartered is undergoing a bold transformation under the Fit for Growth (FFG) program, aimed at simplification, standardization and digitisation keeping client at the centre. This role is instrumental in shaping how CIB Operations delivers on its FFG commitments through effective partnering with FFG initiative owners and CIB Ops leadership team.

  

We are looking for a high-impact finance leader to partner with CIB Ops MT to lead end to end financial planning, forecasting, and cost analysis for CIB Operations, providing challenge and insight to deliver sustainable savings and enable business outcomes through the Fit for Growth journey for the function.

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

**Strategy**  

* Strengthen the finance partnership for CIB Operations & Drive delivery of agreed budgets and targets and ensure alignment with the strategic objectives of the CIB Operations & Contribute to build out a centre of expertise finance partnering delivery capability in the Business Performance Operations.

**Business**  

* Be the key finance partner to CIB Operations in steering the cost performance agenda for the function.
* Demonstrate a deep-rooted understanding of the CIB Operations. Partner with the CIB Operations to provide deep dive analytics on Performance to drive consistent and sustainable above and beyond business performance.
* Supporting the CIB Operations FFG agenda to deliver the efficiencies and growth opportunities by tracking and reviewing on a regular basis.
* Drive robust cost-challenge conversations and manage performance via agreed metrics.

  

**Processes**  

* Partnering with CIB Operations, business CFO and Regional teams, to drive insight into business and operations performance. Conceptualize and deliver high impact, executive-ready presentations to support the cost performance narrative for engagement across the Group and Business.
* Supporting the formulation and coordination budget, Strategic Plans, Forecasts, and reviews against actual performance with the Product, Group and Segment teams.
* Monitor and evaluate the implementation of key strategic business plans, deep dive and other requested analysis (e.g.cost savings initiatives) for Operations.
* Prepare and coordinate information for presentations to the Board, investor communications, and external presentations by the business heads, finance heads and Investor Relations teams
* Understanding key opportunities for simplifying, standardising, and digitising the Bank‚Äôs processes and overall capability
* Be predictive and proactive so we have performance management updates readily available.
* Drive a culture of process excellence permeating through all levels in the organization.
* Strive for innovation ‚Äì i.e., new ideas to be generated across the team. BAU team to tap their time and deliver Change.
* Ensure compliance with accounting standards, regulatory requirements and management reporting and policies

**People & Talent**

* Lead by example, develop and embed a high-performance culture with specific focus on capability, effectiveness, and productivity.
* Foster a culture of collaboration and a mindset of change and growth

  

**Risk Management**

* Ability to interpret the firm‚Äôs financial information, identify key issues based on this information and put in place appropriate controls and measures.
* Ensure compliance with Group Accounting

  

**Governance**

* Have an awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.

**Regulatory & Business Conduct**

* Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group‚Äôs Values and Code of Conduct.
* Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
* Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate, and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters

  

**Key Stakeholders**

* CIB Operations
* T&O Management
* T&O and Functions CFO
* Operations CFO
* Group FP&A team.
* Business CFOs

**Our Ideal Candidate**

* Chartered Accountant/CPA/CMA/MBA with 12+ years of finance experience in Finance Partnering, Financial Planning & Analysis, Performance management, quantitative analysis, and market share analysis and/or competitive analysis.
* Deep understanding and strong competence in managing costs and Operations units in the industry. Strong analytical and strategic mindset coupled with a thorough understanding of the Banking Industry.
* In-depth knowledge of the drivers of businesses performance and relevant key performance measures of Banking business
* Ability to understand and connect business drivers relevant to the Performance management processes.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure, multi-task, lead through ambiguities and influence, work with global teams.
* Effective communication skills, including presenting and influencing senior management.
* Make sound decisions/influence making sound decisions based on business priorities.
* Comfortable dealing with incomplete information, uncertainty, change and dealing with ambiguities.
* Excellent Excel & PowerPoint skills
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Relationship and stakeholder management skills is important.
* Initiative and proactive thinking

**Role Specific Technical Competencies**

* Strategy and Planning
* Data Analysis and Visualisation

title: Front Desk Manager (Duty Manager)
description:
**Additional Information**  
**Job Number**26009759  
**Job Category**Rooms & Guest Services Operations  
**Location**JW Marriott Hotel Singapore South Beach, 30 Beach Road, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore, 189763  
**Schedule**Full Time  
**Located Remotely?**N  
**Position Type** Non-Management  

**POSITION SUMMARY**

**Leading Guest Services Team**

* Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.
* Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
* Serves as a role model to demonstrate appropriate behaviors.
* Supervises and manages employees. Manages all day-to-day operations. Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence.
* Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with employees and ensures employees do the same within the team.
* Ensures recognition of employees is taking place across areas of responsibility.
* Communicates performance expectations in accordance with job descriptions for each position and monitors progress.
* Celebrates successes and publicly recognizes the contributions of team members.

**Maintaining Guest Services and Front Desk Goals**

* Achieves and exceeds goals including performance goals, budget goals, team goals, etc.
* Manages day-to-day operations, ensuring the quality, standards and meeting the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.
* Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.
* Keeps Front Office team focused on the critical components of operations to drive guest satisfaction and the desired financial results.
* Conducts department meetings and continually communicates a clear and consistent message regarding the Front Office goals to produce desired results.
* Reviews staffing levels to ensure that guest service, operational needs and financial objectives are met.
* Understands the impact of Front Office operations on the Rooms area and overall property financial goals.
* Manages department controllable expenses to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.

**Managing Projects and Policies**

* Ensures compliance with all Front Office policies, standards and procedures.
* Ensures property policies are administered fairly and consistently, disciplinary procedures and documentation are completed according to Standard and Local Operating Procedures (SOPs and LSOPs) and support the Peer Review Process.

**Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service**

* Provides services that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.
* Improves service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand guest needs, providing guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed.
* Supervises and managing employees. Managing all day-to-day operations. Understanding employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence.

title: Program Manager (Part-time)
description:
**Role Summary:**

Young Founders School (YFS) is a Hong Kong‚Äìregistered Section 88 non-profit organisation dedicated to empowering secondary school students through entrepreneurship education, workplace skills training, and internship experiences.

We are looking for a Programme Manager to lead the planning, execution, and student‚Äìcompany matching of our High School Internship Programme. The role focuses on supporting F.4‚ÄìF.6 students throughout their full internship journey, including progress tracking, coordination with company mentors, and student support.

This is a part-time, remote role, welcoming university students or fresh graduates who are passionate about youth development and real-world education programmes.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Support the daily operation of the High School Internship Programme
* Manage programme timelines, workflows, and matching criteria
* Serve as the main point of contact for company mentors, school partners, and internal stakeholders
* Oversee and execute student‚Äìcompany matching, ensuring alignment between students‚Äô interests, abilities, and company project needs
* Monitor F.4‚ÄìF.6 students‚Äô learning progress and follow up on task completion
* Review and refine programme materials, guidelines, and operational processes
* Communicate with company representatives to ensure the programme runs smoothly
* Oversee and coordinate meeting schedules between students and company mentors
* Oversee and manage programme-related email communications and follow-ups
* Lead post-programme evaluation, including feedback collection and impact review
* Support ad-hoc programme-related tasks as required

**Entry Requirements:**

* Currently studying or completed Bachelor‚Äôs Degree
* Able to commit to the work period from March to August
* Comfortable working remotely and managing tasks independently
* Relevant experience in programme coordination or project management is preferred.

**Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesÔºö**

* Advanced proficiency in English and Cantonese (spoken and written)
* Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Comfortable using online collaboration tools (e.g. Zoom, Google Workspace)
* Ability to work independently while coordinating with internal team members

**Personal AttributesÔºö**

* Passionate about youth engagement and education programmes
* Proactive, responsible, and detail-minded
* Able to work independently while collaborating with a small team
* Patient and supportive when working with F.4‚ÄìF.6 students
* Willing to take initiative and follow up on tasks without constant supervision

**Additional RequirementsÔºö**

* Contract period: March to August
* Work arrangement: Remote working (online meetings as required)
* Occasional online meetings with students and company mentors
* Prior experience working with students or education programmes is an advantage, but not required

Job Type: Part-time

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island

title: Sr Manager, Workforce Development
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.**

Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

The Senior Manager of Global Assembly & Test Central Workforce Development serves as the strategic leader for Workforce Development (WFD) across all Assembly & Test (AT) sites. As part of a central function, this role is responsible for establishing governance, harmonized standards, and best‚Äëpractice frameworks that elevate workforce capability, readiness, and learning excellence across the global AT network.

Acting as both a steward and enabler of the Global Workforce Development Standard, the Senior Manager leads a Center‚Äëof‚ÄëExcellence (CoE) that partners with site WFD teams, functional leaders, and Global Talent Management to deploy consistent processes, scalable initiatives, and enterprise-wide development programs.

This role ensures that AT‚Äôs workforce development processes remain future-ready, globally aligned, data-driven, and tightly integrated with corporate talent strategies - including onboarding, technical training, learning governance, skills frameworks & analytics, and capability-building initiatives.

**Key Responsibilities**

**1. Lead Global Workforce Development Strategy & Governance**

* Define and drive AT-wide WFD strategy aligned to global business, operations, and talent priorities.
* Govern adoption of the Global Workforce Development Standard, ensuring consistent processes for training, competency models, training documentation governance, LMS governance, audits, and compliance across all AT sites.

**2. Standardization, Best Practices & CoE Leadership**

* Lead best‚Äëpractice sharing, cross-site forums, and communities of practice to uplift WFD maturity, performance consistency, and innovation.
* Drive standardization for operator, technician, and engineer training frameworks across regions, including certification requirements and documentation control processes.
* Partners with sites WFD, SMEs and engineering leads to ensure technical content, SOPs, and process documentation remain accurate, standardized, and audit-ready.

**3. Partner with Global Talent Management and other functions on Enterprise Programs**

* Drive and support deployment of global learning initiatives as well as systems or process improvements across AT.
* Ensure that AT needs are understood and integrated into corporate program design.

**4. Workforce Analytics, Metrics & Reporting**

* Establish AT-wide metrics for training effectiveness, competency readiness, and compliance.
* Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to AT leadership and global stakeholders.

**5. Change Leadership & Capability Building**

* Lead organizational change related to new WFD standards, systems, and initiatives‚Äîsupporting communication, adoption, and sustainability.
* Build capability across site WFD teams through coaching, training, and leadership of global WFD councils.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in HR, Organizational Development, Engineering, Business, or related field or equivalent work experience.
* 8+ years of experience in Workforce Development, Learning & Development, or similar domains.
* Proven experience leading global or multi-site functions, with strong governance and standardization skills.
* Demonstrated success partnering with cross-functional and global stakeholders.
* Proven ability in workforce development project and program management.

**Preferred experience**

* Experience in semiconductor or advanced manufacturing environments.
* Strong understanding of competency modeling, training frameworks, or learning management systems.

**About Micron Technology, Inc.**

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life *for all*. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron¬Æ and Crucial¬Æ brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities ‚Äî from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.  
  
To learn more, please visit micron.com/careers  
  
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  
  
To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact hrsupport\\_sg@micron.com

Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.

Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

AI alert: Candidates are encouraged to use AI tools to enhance their resume and/or application materials. However, all information provided must be accurate and reflect the candidate's true skills and experiences. Misuse of AI to fabricate or misrepresent qualifications will result in immediate disqualification.

Fraud alert: Micron advises job seekers to be cautious of unsolicited job offers and to verify the authenticity of any communication claiming to be from Micron by checking the official Micron careers website in the About Micron Technology, Inc.

title: Vice President, Client Office APAC
description:
**Description de l‚Äôentreprise**
-------------------------------

  
Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking est une institution financi√®re mondiale de premier plan qui fournit des services de conseil, de banque d'investissement, de financement, de banque d'entreprise et de march√©s de capitaux aux entreprises, institutions financi√®res, sponsors financiers et organisations souveraines et supranationales du monde entier. Nos √©quipes d'experts dans plus de 30 pays conseillent nos clients sur leur d√©veloppement strat√©gique, les aident √† d√©velopper et √† transformer leurs activit√©s, et √† maximiser leur impact positif.  
  

Natixis CIB Asia Pacific propose aux entreprises et aux institutions financi√®res r√©gionales des solutions de financement et de march√©s de capitaux sur mesure ainsi qu'un acc√®s aux march√©s financiers mondiaux, tout en accompagnant le d√©veloppement des clients europ√©ens et internationaux de Natixis CIB en Asie-Pacifique.

  

**Poste et missions**
---------------------

The APAC CIB Client Office works across the Business Lines of Natixis CIB to define, develop and optimize the bank‚Äôs client franchise and improve commercial intensity and efficiency. The Client Office is positioned as an independent partner to the business ‚Äì amid a strong business development in Asia-Pacific.

The Client Office Vice-President (VP) leads strategic projects and run-mode activities, reporting directly to the Asia Chief Client Officer with 2 main mandates:

* **Client Strategy** ‚Äì Orchestrating a series of strategic and concrete client developments across activities (Global Markets, IB, Real Assets, Global Trade, Portfolio Management, GSH)

  

* **Client Experience** ‚Äì Driving client feedbacks, monitoring key actions with client-facing teams, and ensuring the complaints framework for improved client experience.

To perform those two mandates, you will be seconded by a team in APAC and have access to the global Client Office team for specific needs on data analysis and reports preparations. You will be working in close relation with the heads of business lines and Senior Country Managers of the region ‚Äì with a drive for anticipation and actions

**Main Responsibilities:**

**Client Strategy & Animation:**

* Co-Lead the preparation and deployment of APAC client-focused initiatives ‚Äì across Investment Banking, Real Assets and Global Trade (roadmaps, execution planning, delivery monitoring), with a focus on maximum value-add
* Support cross-business lines initiatives involving Banking and Global Markets, across APAC and in connection with other platforms; with a regular update to the Senior Management
* Bring an excellent communication across bankers, RMs to ensure effective plans deployment
* Co-lead the Client Intensity ‚Äì including Business Committees, Client Performance, commercial intensity
* Lead Market Intelligence initiatives to support the business development of the region
* Co-lead Client Reviews of the critical clients, challenging the commercial intensity, revenues, business pipeline and future ambitions with the Bankers
* Anticipate needs from Front teams and management, update regularly on client developments
* Orchestrate financial performance KPIs monitoring and trends reporting, for client portfolio improvements decisions and implementations
* Manage communication with Front teams and clients whenever required
* Support directly the business lines heads and the Chief Client Officer in ad-hoc requests

**Client Experience - Strategic Customer Relation Management (Strat CRM)**

* Co-lead the APAC client feedbacks on the overall relationship (senior management face-off, commercial services / needs, operational attention points), with key highlights and actions shared to global and regional heads of coverage and business lines
* Ensure an effective governance is in place for a high-quality service model deployment and client-centric culture at APAC level, with the support functions and business lines teams, for enhanced client experience
* Lead the Strategic CRM stream, including the monitoring of client complaints and actions to help resolve the issues ‚Äì in coordination with key departments in APAC and head office

**Required Skills:**

* Master's Degree in Finance, Economics or related field ‚Äì CFA a plus
* Minimum 5 years+ experience in CIB environment
* Very good project management experience and presentations quality for senior management
* Excellent data analysis and reporting ‚Äì strong ability to present data to pass on the right messages
* Past experience in supporting business lines teams or senior country manager, facilitating relations with support functions, front teams and clients
* Past experience in Strategy, Client Strategy, or Business Management is a plus
* Good understanding of banking activities, product suite and client typologies ‚Äì experience in business reviews or client reviews is a plus
* Knowledge of global/APAC Corporates, Financial Institutions and Private Equity firms is valuable - knowledge on Real Assets, IB and Global Trade activities, or Global Markets is also a plus
* Well versed in connecting and building consensus across departments ‚Äì exposure to client experience brings a strong advantage
* Strategic thinker and open minded, capacity to think out of the box to identify new approaches
* Good motivation skills, accountable, strong ownership
* Confirmed ability to work collaboratively with business lines and support functions executives, across functions and geographies
* Communicates clearly and effectively, both orally and in written form, with a capacity to adapt his / her communication to various audiences and levels in the organization
* Organizational and time management skills, with a proven ability to prioritize competing demands. Comfortable working in "project" mode
* Excellent interpersonal and listening skills, with capacity to lead projects effectively

title: Customer Service Ambassador
description:
**Requisition Number:** 44754

**Job Location:** Kwun Tong, HKG

**Work Type:** Office Working

**Employment Type:** Permanent

**Posting Start Date:** 28/01/2026

**Posting End Date:**

**:**

**Key Responsibilities**

**Strategy**  

* To provide quality services and to assist up-selling and cross selling financial products/services to customers transacting at branches.
* To assist the Senior Branch Operations & Service Manager to:

Achieve / exceed the business targets set.  
Control and administer the daily operations of the Branch / Priority Banking Centre.  
Ensure that efficient and high quality services are delivered to customer.  
**Business**  

* To generate business through cross selling banking products to customers transacting at counters.
* To ensure that the highest standard of service is provided to customers at all times.
* To maintain cordial relationship with existing and new customers.

**Processes**  

* To handle deposit/withdrawal transactions and provide other banking services at counters.
* To ensure that cash in the teller‚Äôs cash till is balanced to on-line cash book and all the customer transactions are correctly posted.
* To post all general ledger entries and ensure the books of the branch are balanced.
* To update customers record to computer system and assist in general filing of bank record at branch.
* To comply with all applicable money laundering prevention procedures and, in particular, report any suspicious activity to the Unit Money Laundering Prevention Officer and line manager.
* To bring to the attention of the Senior Branch Operations & Service Manager any problems encountered together with any recommended solutions.

**Governance**  

* Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group‚Äôs arrangements to deliver effective governance, oversight and controls in the business and, if necessary, oversee changes in these areas; Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role.

**Regulatory & Business Conduct**  

* Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group‚Äôs Values and Code of Conduct.
* Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct.
* Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.

**Key Stakeholders**  
**Internal Contacts**  

* All branch sales and service staff

**External Contacts**  

* Customers

**Skills and Experience**

* Teller Experience Preferred
* Anti-money Laundering Policies and Procedures
* Customer Interaction
* Understanding Customer Needs
* Teller Functions

**About Standard Chartered**

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.

Together we:

* **Do the right thing** and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
* **Never settle,** continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
* **Are better together,** we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

**What we offer**

**In line with our Fair Pay Charter,** we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.

* **Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance,** with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
* **Time-off** including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
* **Flexible working** options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
* **Proactive wellbeing support** through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills, global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
* **A continuous learning culture** to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
* **Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation,** one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

title: Assistant Manager (Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Service)
description:
The Hong Kong Red Cross was established in 1950. We belong to the World's largest humanitarian network and provide impartial and quality care to protect life and health, and to enhance the capacity of vulnerable people to live a safe and dignified life. Our services include disaster relief, special education, volunteer service, first aid and health training, and blood transfusion. http://www.redcross.org.hk
  
  
**Job Purpose:**  
The Assistant Manager supports the Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Service (MHPS) Service in-charge, psychologists and Manager to maintain implementation and execution of the mobile mental health services. She/he will be initiating and supporting outreach activities, while also taking charge of volunteer management and counselling clients management. Responsibilities include recruitment, scheduling, and providing training and psychosocial support to volunteers to ensure their well-being and retention. She/he will be supporting the emergency operations of the team if needed as well.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
Design and coordinate psychoeducation activities and workshops for the promotion of psychological well-being to the community, monitoring quality and effectiveness, and evaluating the outcome and impact of the programme.
  
  
Assist the Manager (Mental Health and Psychosocial Support Service) in the promotion and implementation of the mobile mental health services. Foster and maintain good working relationships with different partners and stakeholders.
  
  
Support the casework of mobile mental health services, including case arrangement and initial assessments.
  
  
Lead and maintain the team members and volunteers to execute the planned works for ensuring the quality of service by equipping them with required skills, knowledge, and attitude.
  
  
Support Emergency Psychological Support Service in times of emergencies.
  
  
Carry out ad hoc projects and tasks when assigned by the Supervisor(s).
  
  
**Requirements:**  
University Degree in Social Science, Education and Humanities, discipline in Social Work, Psychology or Counselling is preferred.
  
  
A minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience, preferably with project implementation and volunteer management experience. Experience in blended learning, online learning platform or multimedia resource development is an advantage. Candidate with less experience will be considered.
  
  
Good at programme and training administration and operation, service analysis and report writing. Excellent skills in community work and social networking.
  
  
Self-motivated, strong sense of responsibility, independent, able to work in a multi-disciplinary team and under pressure.
  
  
Good team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  
  
Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua).
  
  
Five-day work per week, may need to perform duties on weekends or evenings if required.
  
  
Good command of MS Office.
  
  
**Fringe Benefits:**  
Fringe benefits including generous annual leave, marriage leave, caring leave, volunteer leave, medical and dental benefits (including dependents), Employer MPF voluntary contribution, and a discretionary incentive payment (where applicable) will be offered to the right candidates.
  
  
**Contract Period:** 1 year
  
  
Interested candidates are invited to submit an online application, by clicking the "Apply" button on or before 1 March 2026 .
  
  
Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with Agency‚Äôs data protection policy for recruitment purposes only. Applicants not contacted within 4 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful and all related information will be kept on our files up to a period of 6 months.
  
  
Full-time,Contract

**Key Responsibilities:**  
Lead and execute the mobile mental health services, including managing and overseeing the overall implementation and execution of the service, with the support from Service In-charge and psychologists.
  
  
Manage and monitor the quality and operation of the team in conducting the mobile mental health services in adherence to the planned timelines, deliverables, and budgets, as well as evaluating the outcome and impact of the programme.
  
  
Lead and coordinate the mobile mental health services with our key community stakeholders and our internal counterparts, including volunteers and collaborating departments.
  
  
Establish and maintain effective relationship with stakeholders in various emergency mental health service, including internal service units, government departments, social service sector, aviation industry, transportation industry, and potential groups of service users to facilitate the service implementation and development.
  
  
Carry out ad hoc projects and tasks when assigned by the Supervisor(s).
  
  
**Requirements:**  
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in social science or related disciplines, preferably in Psychology and Social Work.
  
  
Minimum of 5 years post-graduation and related working experience, in which at least 3 years at Supervisory role in social service sector.
  
  
Sound experience in service and volunteer management, with excellent skills in community work and social networking.
  
  
Strong skills in proposal development, planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of projects.
  
  
Flexible, responsible, and proactive with a strong sense of initiative and commitment to improving service quality; quick to respond to emergencies and equipped with strong analytical thinking skills.
  
  
Proficient in both written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua).
  
  
**Contract Period:** 1 year
  
  
**Fringe Benefits:**  
Fringe benefits including generous annual leave, marriage leave, caring leave, volunteer leave, medical and dental benefits (including dependents), Employer MPF voluntary contribution, and a discretionary incentive payment (where applicable) will be offered to the right candidates.
  
  
Interested candidates are invited to submit an online application, by clicking the "Apply" button on or before 1 March 2026 .
  
  
Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with Agency‚Äôs data protection policy for recruitment purposes only. Applicants not contacted within 4 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful and all related information will be kept on our files up to a period of 6 months.
  
  
Full-time,Contract

title: Vice President, Client Office APAC
description:
**Description de l‚Äôentreprise**
-------------------------------

  
Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking est une institution financi√®re mondiale de premier plan qui fournit des services de conseil, de banque d'investissement, de financement, de banque d'entreprise et de march√©s de capitaux aux entreprises, institutions financi√®res, sponsors financiers et organisations souveraines et supranationales du monde entier. Nos √©quipes d'experts dans plus de 30 pays conseillent nos clients sur leur d√©veloppement strat√©gique, les aident √† d√©velopper et √† transformer leurs activit√©s, et √† maximiser leur impact positif.  
  

Natixis CIB Asia Pacific propose aux entreprises et aux institutions financi√®res r√©gionales des solutions de financement et de march√©s de capitaux sur mesure ainsi qu'un acc√®s aux march√©s financiers mondiaux, tout en accompagnant le d√©veloppement des clients europ√©ens et internationaux de Natixis CIB en Asie-Pacifique.

  

**Poste et missions**
---------------------

The APAC CIB Client Office works across the Business Lines of Natixis CIB to define, develop and optimize the bank‚Äôs client franchise and improve commercial intensity and efficiency. The Client Office is positioned as an independent partner to the business ‚Äì amid a strong business development in Asia-Pacific.

The Client Office Vice-President (VP) leads strategic projects and run-mode activities, reporting directly to the Asia Chief Client Officer with 2 main mandates:

* **Client Strategy** ‚Äì Orchestrating a series of strategic and concrete client developments across activities (Global Markets, IB, Real Assets, Global Trade, Portfolio Management, GSH)

  

* **Client Experience** ‚Äì Driving client feedbacks, monitoring key actions with client-facing teams, and ensuring the complaints framework for improved client experience.

To perform those two mandates, you will be seconded by a team in APAC and have access to the global Client Office team for specific needs on data analysis and reports preparations. You will be working in close relation with the heads of business lines and Senior Country Managers of the region ‚Äì with a drive for anticipation and actions

**Main Responsibilities:**

**Client Strategy & Animation:**

* Co-Lead the preparation and deployment of APAC client-focused initiatives ‚Äì across Investment Banking, Real Assets and Global Trade (roadmaps, execution planning, delivery monitoring), with a focus on maximum value-add
* Support cross-business lines initiatives involving Banking and Global Markets, across APAC and in connection with other platforms; with a regular update to the Senior Management
* Bring an excellent communication across bankers, RMs to ensure effective plans deployment
* Co-lead the Client Intensity ‚Äì including Business Committees, Client Performance, commercial intensity
* Lead Market Intelligence initiatives to support the business development of the region
* Co-lead Client Reviews of the critical clients, challenging the commercial intensity, revenues, business pipeline and future ambitions with the Bankers
* Anticipate needs from Front teams and management, update regularly on client developments
* Orchestrate financial performance KPIs monitoring and trends reporting, for client portfolio improvements decisions and implementations
* Manage communication with Front teams and clients whenever required
* Support directly the business lines heads and the Chief Client Officer in ad-hoc requests

**Client Experience - Strategic Customer Relation Management (Strat CRM)**

* Co-lead the APAC client feedbacks on the overall relationship (senior management face-off, commercial services / needs, operational attention points), with key highlights and actions shared to global and regional heads of coverage and business lines
* Ensure an effective governance is in place for a high-quality service model deployment and client-centric culture at APAC level, with the support functions and business lines teams, for enhanced client experience
* Lead the Strategic CRM stream, including the monitoring of client complaints and actions to help resolve the issues ‚Äì in coordination with key departments in APAC and head office

**Required Skills:**

* Master's Degree in Finance, Economics or related field ‚Äì CFA a plus
* Minimum 5 years+ experience in CIB environment
* Very good project management experience and presentations quality for senior management
* Excellent data analysis and reporting ‚Äì strong ability to present data to pass on the right messages
* Past experience in supporting business lines teams or senior country manager, facilitating relations with support functions, front teams and clients
* Past experience in Strategy, Client Strategy, or Business Management is a plus
* Good understanding of banking activities, product suite and client typologies ‚Äì experience in business reviews or client reviews is a plus
* Knowledge of global/APAC Corporates, Financial Institutions and Private Equity firms is valuable - knowledge on Real Assets, IB and Global Trade activities, or Global Markets is also a plus
* Well versed in connecting and building consensus across departments ‚Äì exposure to client experience brings a strong advantage
* Strategic thinker and open minded, capacity to think out of the box to identify new approaches
* Good motivation skills, accountable, strong ownership
* Confirmed ability to work collaboratively with business lines and support functions executives, across functions and geographies
* Communicates clearly and effectively, both orally and in written form, with a capacity to adapt his / her communication to various audiences and levels in the organization
* Organizational and time management skills, with a proven ability to prioritize competing demands. Comfortable working in "project" mode
* Excellent interpersonal and listening skills, with capacity to lead projects effectively
company_description: At Natixis, we create tailor-made solutions in Asset & Wealth Management and in Corporate and Investment Banking, with over 12,000 employees  in 35 countries.

title: Assistant Manager, Learning & Development - The Singapore EDITION
description:
**Additional Information**  
**Job Number**26009611  
**Job Category**Human Resources  
**Location**The Singapore EDITION, 38 Cuscaden Road, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore, 249731  
**Schedule**Full Time  
**Located Remotely?**N  
**Position Type** Management  

**JOB SUMMARY**

Assists with identifying and addressing employee and organizational development needs. The position is assist in ensuring effective training is in place to enable the achievement of desired business results. Training programs focus on a variety of topics, including product knowledge, company philosophy, and customer service and leadership skills. Assists in conducting needs assessments, designing and developing training programs and facilitating the delivery of both custom and corporate training programs. Measures the effectiveness of training to ensure a return on investment.

**CANDIDATE PROFILE**

**Education and Experience**

* 2-year degree from an accredited university in Human Resources, Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major; 1 year experience in the human resources or related professional area; certified trainer.

OR

* 4-year bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Hotel and Restaurant Management, Hospitality, Business Administration, or related major; certified trainer; no work experience required.

**CORE WORK ACTIVITIES**

**Assisting with Administering Employee Training Programs**

* Promotes and informs employees about all training programs.

* Displays leadership in guest hospitality, exemplifies excellent customer service and creates a positive atmosphere for guest relations.

* Helps employees identify specific behaviors that will contribute to service excellence.

* Ensures employees receive on-going training to understand guest expectations.

* Uses effective training methods to ensure employees have a good understanding of guest satisfaction and can demonstrate guest satisfaction skills.

* Meets with training cadre on a regular basis to support training efforts.

* Observes service behaviors of employees and provides feedback to individuals and/or managers.

**Assisting with Evaluating Training Programs Effectiveness**

* Monitors enrollment and attendance at training classes.

* Meets regularly with participants to assess progress and address concerns.

* Partners with operational leaders to assess if employees demonstrate effective technical and leadership skills.

* Reviews comment cards, guest satisfaction results and other data to identify areas of improvement.

* Measures transfer of learning from training courses to the operation.

* Ensures adult learning principles are incorporated into training programs.

**Assisting with Developing Training Program Plans and Budgets**

* Identifies performance gaps and works with managers to develop and implement appropriate training to improve performance.

* Assists with making any necessary adjustments to training methodology and/or re-trains as appropriate.

* Aligns current training and development programs to effectively impact key business indicators.

* Assists with establishing guidelines so employees understand expectations and parameters.

* Develops specific training to improve service performance.

* Drives brand values and philosophy in all training and development activities.

* Incorporates guest satisfaction as a component of departmental meetings with a focus on continuous improvement.

**Assisting with Managing Training Budgets**

* Assists with the development of the Training budget as required.

* Assists with managing budget in alignment with Human Resources and property financial goals.

* Assists with managing department controllable expenses to achieve or exceed budgeted goals.

* Utilizes P-card if appropriate to control and monitor departmental expenditures.

*At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.*

EDITION Hotels combine the visionary genius of boutique hotelier Ian Schrager, the service delivery of a world-class luxury hotel, and the global reach of Marriott International to create an entirely new experience in the world of hospitality. EDITION delivers the best of both worlds in a delicate balancing act ‚Äì polish with personality, perfectionism with individualism, and comfort with charisma and charm. The brand targets sophisticated, knowledgeable consumers who understand quality, originality, design, and service excellence, but who want it without limitations ‚Äì breaking the bounds of convention and demanding an attitude and a feeling wrapped in a package that showcases the exceptional.

But to create this magical experience, we need you. We are looking for outgoing, authentically amazing people who are looking for a place to work that inspires them, challenges them and makes them proud to come to work. A place where service comes from the heart, not from a handbook. A place that delivers a never-ending theatrical performance that continuously delights and enchants each and every one of our guests.

We invite you to join us today. In joining EDITION, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International. **Be** where you can do your best work, **begin** your purpose, **belong** to an amazing global team, and **become** the best version of you.

title: Growth Lead - Trading Product
description:
Binance is a leading global blockchain ecosystem behind the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume and registered users. We are trusted by over 280 million people in 100+ countries for our industry-leading security, user fund transparency, trading engine speed, deep liquidity, and an unmatched portfolio of digital-asset products. Binance offerings range from trading and finance to education, research, payments, institutional services, Web3 features, and more. We leverage the power of digital assets and blockchain to build an inclusive financial ecosystem to advance the freedom of money and improve financial access for people around the world.

We‚Äôre looking for a **Business Growth Lead** to own and execute the **growth strategy** for our **trading products**, working closely with Product, Marketing, Data, and Regional teams to drive acquisition, engagement, and retention. This **individual contributor role** offers immediate ownership with the potential to grow into leading the entire product business line.

### **Responsibilities**

* **Own growth strategy & targets**: Define KPIs and user/business growth goals for our trading product, **Convert**; build and execute the roadmap to hit them.
* **Drive performance through data**: Monitor core dashboards daily/weekly/monthly; identify opportunities, gaps, and risks; translate insights into action plans and measurable experiments.
* **Plan and run growth initiatives**: Design promotions, campaigns, and lifecycle programs to acquire and retain users; coordinate execution with Marketing and regional teams.
* **Partner on product optimization**: Work with Product Managers and engineers to improve existing flows and launch new features; use competitor research, user feedback, and data to prioritize impact.
* **Own day-to-day business operations**: Ensure smooth execution across stakeholders and maintain high-quality delivery from planning to post-launch review.
* **Customer-first mindset**: Stay highly focused on user satisfaction, retention, and long-term value.

### **Requirements**

* **3-6 years of experience** in growth, business operations, or growth marketing in retail-facing fintech, trading, or internet products (trading/brokerage experience is a strong plus).
* Strong understanding of financial products and trading basics; crypto/crypto exchange knowledge preferred.
* Highly data-driven: comfortable owning metrics and running structured experiments; proficient in Excel + SQL (and able to partner effectively with analysts).
* Strong product and business sense with the ability to influence priorities and drive cross-functional execution.
* Creative and hands-on in designing promotions, content/event initiatives, and new growth levers.
* Ownership mindset, excellent communication, and strong stakeholder management; prior product/business ownership is a bonus.

**Why Binance**

* Shape the future with the world‚Äôs leading blockchain ecosystem
* Collaborate with world-class talent in a user-centric global organization with a flat structure
* Tackle unique, fast-paced projects with autonomy in an innovative environment
* Thrive in a results-driven workplace with opportunities for career growth and continuous learning
* Competitive salary and company benefits
* Work-from-home arrangement (the arrangement may vary depending on the work nature of the business team)

Binance is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. We believe that having a diverse workforce is fundamental to our success.

*By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our* ***Candidate Privacy Notice****.*

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.
company_description: Today, Binance is the world‚Äôs leading blockchain ecosystem, with a product suite that includes the largest digital asset exchange.

title: Business Development, HNW Business, Consultant (Manager)
description:
At AIA we‚Äôve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

*It‚Äôs about finding new ways to not only better people's lives, but to better the communities and environments we live in. Encompassing our ambition of helping a billion people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030.*

*And as part of our marketing, distribution & partnership team, you‚Äôll play a vital part in advancing this movement. From inspiring meaningful connections with customers, partners and other stakeholders, to delivering purpose-led brand positioning and messaging, you'll be making a positive, healthy impact across all channels. You will have a unique and important part to play in helping more people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

So if you believe in inspiring a better future, read on.

About the Role

Support the execution of sales and business development strategies by managing key distribution partners, including Singapore based international brokers. Strengthen business relationships, drive sales growth, ensure high standards of service delivery, and maintain full compliance with cross border regulatory requirements.

Roles and Responsibilities:

* Assist the Team Leader / Head of Sales in implementing business plans and initiatives in accordance with sales KPIs.
* Identify the needs and demands of individual partners to drive sustainable sales performance.
* Support distribution partners and internal stakeholders in capturing new business opportunities.
* Strengthen and maintain strong business relationships with assigned partners to drive new initiatives.
* Handle day to day partner related matters to ensure a high level of service quality, responsiveness, and operational efficiency.
* Facilitate partners and TRs to ensure delivery of quality, compliant, and consistent business.
* Contribute new ideas and provide market and partner feedback to maintain AIA‚Äôs competitive proposition.
* Manage and develop strategic relationships with Singapore based international brokers, serving as the key point of contact to deepen collaboration and maximize business opportunities.
* Coordinate case enquiries, product positioning, quotation requirements, and pipeline follow up with Singapore brokers, ensuring timely, accurate, and professional responses.
* Monitor and ensure compliance with cross border sales standards, Singapore regulatory considerations, and AIA governance requirements.
* Organize and support joint business engagements, including meetings, virtual webinars, marketing activities, and product training tailored for Singapore broker needs.
* Gather market intelligence from Singapore broker channels and provide insights and recommendations to management for proposition enhancement and competitive benchmarking.

Requirements:

* University / College graduate with at least 5 years of relevant experience in sales support, distribution management, or partnership management.
* Strong organizing, coordination, and stakeholder management skills.
* Good insurance and investment product knowledge.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Good written and spoken English and Korean and Chinese / Mandarin .
* Proficient in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Experience working with international brokers or cross border distribution channels, preferably involving Singapore.
* Understanding of Singapore market dynamics, broker practices, and cross border compliance requirements is an advantage.
* Strong cultural awareness and ability to manage professional communication standards across markets.

Others:

* You are preferred to obtain the license of Insurance Authority (IA) (Paper 1, 2, 3 and 5)
* You are required to acquire the relevant license(s) if your job involves regulated activities

*Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

*You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.*
