title: Sales Manager
description:
**Company Description**

We‚Äôre Checkout.com ‚Äì you might not know our name, but companies like eBay, ASOS, Klarna, Uber Eats, and Sony do. That moment when you check out online? We make it happen.

Checkout.com is where the world checks out. Our global network powers billions of transactions every year, making money move without making a fuss. We spent years perfecting a service most people will never notice. Because when digital payments just work, businesses grow, customers stay, and no one stops to think about why.

With 19 offices spanning six continents, we feel at home everywhere ‚Äì but London is our HQ. Wherever our people work their magic, they‚Äôre fast-moving, performance-obsessed, and driven by being better every day. Ideal. Because a role here isn‚Äôt just another job; it‚Äôs a career-defining opportunity to build the future of fintech.

**Job Description**

Checkout.com is actively looking for an enthusiastic and talented Payments Sales Manager to join our Commercial Payments Team to drive rapid growth across various industries for our revolutionary online payment solution.

If you are a driven and focused salesperson with a proven track record of success selling direct payment solutions to enterprise companies, in a high-growth and competitive environment, this is the role for you. In return, on top of a tremendous working environment, we offer you an unrivaled uncapped recurring commissions plan, hybrid work model and competitive benefits package.

The Sales Manager will play a key role in growing Checkout.com‚Äôs payments footprint. They will be responsible for selling Checkout.com‚Äôs full payments technology stack to middle market and large enterprise organizations.

Along the way, you'll collaborate closely with various in-house talents across Technology and Business to position our capabilities, products, services and solutions effectively with prospects. Desire an independent, high-achieving individual that stands out in an entrepreneurial environment and has the grit and desire to outperform sales targets.

**How you‚Äôll make impact:**  

* Acting as a consultative Payments strategist able to advise companies on an optimal payments structure that pulls from a myriad of solutions Checkout.com provides
* Identify, qualify and close the most promising prospects and partners that will help Checkout.com grow a healthy pipeline across various verticals.
* Build prospect engagement strategies and partner with marketing, business development, product and other departments to build qualified that pipeline in cold and warm channels
* Pitch our next-generation payment solutions and value-added services
* Prepare high-quality presentations and proposals for C-suite stakeholders at prospective merchants, and implement winning negotiation strategies
* Become the expert on Checkout.com‚Äôs technology stack, help new merchants understand the value of Checkout.com to solve their pain points, and handle detailed questions about our product capabilities.
* Orchestrate the entire Sales process, drive urgency and work to mutual action plans, and act as the main point of contact for merchants and internal stakeholders.
* Maintain a solid, well-organized portfolio and nurture key accounts by having a deep understanding of their industry, pain points, and needs.
* Partner with other Payment Sales Managers to share best practices, key business insights and industry trends.
* Provide feedback on local trends including competitor insights, customer needs, sales, product and marketing information.

**Qualifications:**  

* 5+ years Enterprise Sales experience directly in the Payments industry
* Track record of high performance, and self sourcing leads
* Highly motivated and committed to growth and development with excellent communication skills
* Solid network of potential prospects and partners within the payments landscape
* Tech-savvy, with a passion for Fintech and Payments
* Strong commercial acumen, ability to effectively negotiate complex structures

* Fluent in Korean and English

**Bring all of you to work**

We create the conditions for high performers to thrive ‚Äì through real ownership, fewer blockers, and work that makes a difference from day one.

Here, you‚Äôll move fast, take on meaningful challenges, and be recognized for the impact you deliver. It‚Äôs a place where ambition gets met with opportunity ‚Äì and where your growth is in your hands.

We work as one team, and we back each other to succeed. So whatever your background or identity, if you‚Äôre ready to grow and make a difference, you‚Äôll be right at home here.

It‚Äôs important we set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable.

**Life at Checkout.com**

We understand that work is just one part of your life. Our hybrid working model offers flexibility, with three days per week in the office to support collaboration and connection.

Curious about what it‚Äôs like to be part of our team? Visit our Careers Page to learn more about our culture, open roles, and what drives us.

For a closer look at daily life at Checkout.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
company_description: Checkout.com is one of the most exciting and valuable fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy.

title: Regional Product Lead, Data Strengths, GCS Agency (English, Mandarin)
description:
Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.

  
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: **Shanghai, China; Beijing, China; Singapore**.

### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 4 years of experience in product management, marketing, management consulting, or project management in technology.
* Experience working with product management or engineering teams, executive leadership, and cross-functional stakeholders.
* Experience in developing business strategies or managing cross-functional initiatives.
* Ability to communicate in English and Mandarin fluently to support client relationship management in this region.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience working with Google Ads measurement solutions: (e.g., Google Tag Gateway, Enhanced Conversions for Leads, Ads Data Manager, GA4).
* Ability to work, collaborate and influence cross-functionally.
* Ability to set a goal and translate these into tactical quarterly and annual goals.
* Ability to travel within the APAC region in case of business priority.
* Excellent strategic thinking and problem solving skills, with the ability to develop and lead operational and strategic GTM initiatives.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills with executive management and product teams.

**About the job**
-----------------

Product and Sales Activation (PSA) is a collaborative group of individuals who work hard to deliver at-scale, customer focused priorities, transfer product knowledge to our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) Sellers, and influence product design for the GCS segment. By liaising with our partner teams (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Product/Engineering, Sales Finance, Education, Large Customer Sales), the PSA team works to equip GCS Sales with the information, training, collateral, and opportunities needed for future growth and to ensure that our customers needs are addressed and expressed to client/product teams and by architecting the global standard for how we support GCS customers.

In this role, you will help to scale the adoption of Data Strength solutions across the APAC region by directly working with GCS Agency team and their external partners. You will influence executive business stakeholders, work cross-functionally to direct the measurement activation strategy to meet the priorities of the business. You will influence cross-functional teams while building and delivering the best go-to-market (GTM) plan for Data Strength solutions.

Google Customer Solutions (GCS) sales teams are trusted advisors and competitive sellers who maintain a relentless focus on customer success by bringing the best Google has to offer to small- and medium-sized businesses (SMBs), which are the backbone of our communities. As a member of our team, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with company owners and make a real difference in their businesses by helping them grow. Together, we help shape the future of innovation for customers, partners, and sellers...and we have fun doing it.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Deliver on key drivers and metrics to reach quarterly and annual measurement solution adoption goals for the APAC region.
* Design and lead an effective GTM strategy that includes internal and external enablement to accelerate the measurement capability of regional agency teams.
* Co-pitch priority measurement solutions to strategic agency partners and customers alongside Agency SAMs to ensure high-impact results and long-term regional growth.
* Work cross-functionally in the region and globally to lead and deliver on foundational measurement business priorities for the APAC Agency group. Effectively work with Business Development teams to build the partner ecosystem for data strength within the APAC market. Shape the product roadmap by sharing feedback with Global Product Leads.
* Lead foundational measurement product training by developing scalable enablement levers to manage objections and minimize measurement knowledge gaps.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
company_description: Our mission is to organize the world‚Äôs information and make it universally accessible and useful.

title: Partner Business Manager
description:
**We help the world run better**  
At SAP, we keep it simple: you bring your best to us, and we'll bring out the best in you. We're builders touching over 20 industries and 80% of global commerce, and we need your unique talents to help shape what's next. The work is challenging ‚Äì but it matters. You'll find a place where you can be yourself, prioritize your wellbeing, and truly belong. What's in it for you? Constant learning, skill growth, great benefits, and a team that wants you to grow and succeed.

The Partner Business Manager (PBM) for Managed Service Provider is Individual Contributor that covers channel business for all SAP Cloud solutions (S/4 HANA RISE & S/4HANA Grow, HCM, FSM, BTP, SCM, AI, CX, etc.). The PBM is responsible for proactively developing the partner's SAP business by helping finalize their business plan, driving sales (to net new customers and to the partner's current customer base), demand generation, build on partner capabilities to grow SAP's cloud subscription revenue across the SAP solution portfolio in designated territories.

The PBM is the main point of contact for building the partner relationship with SAP. The PBM is the central advisor to the partner, owning the partner relationship end to end, and responsible for coordinating all SAP interactions (with executives, solutions teams, peers, etc.) to drive partner investments and growth in SAP's solutions portfolio. The PBM is responsible for appropriately managing/balancing the use of SAP assets (i.e. Pre-Sales, Training, PSA, etc.) without under- or over-utilizing those assets. He or She develops partners for long term engagements, maintaining health-of-business and transformation to new solutions, technologies and models. The Partner Business Manager supports partner enablement to drive partner self-sufficiency, from demand generation to closing deals. The PBM also supports partners in sales cycle via coaching, mentoring and shadowing in customer facing sales activities. Position is measured on the following metrics - revenue, year-over-year growth, market share growth, build on partner maturity, adoption and renewals of strategic solutions (i.e. RISE, Cloud) and Corporate segment impact including scaling Partner Led Territories business with partners.

**Key Responsibilities:**

  

* Develop and manage the MSP & Cloud BPO business in SEA MU.
* Partner and Customer Relationship Management, Sales and Software License and Cloud Subscription Revenue.
* Achieve / exceed quota targets by Quarter.
* Sales strategies - Develops effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and orchestrate engagements end to end with our Partners and Field Teams
* Maximize the contribution of our existing MSP partner portfolio in the SEA Market Units resulting in a larger share of wallet and increased revenue and order entry volumes for SAP.
* Engage with the SEA Market Unit Teams to selectively grow our MSP partner community including the Group SI‚Äôs
* Develop and share an effective internal and external network and effectively collaborate with other functions or units like, Line of Business Sales, SAP Field Sales, TEMs, other Partner Teams, Marketing, Solution Management to enable outsourcing partner business.
* Ensure compliance of all sales and partner efforts.
* Ensure efficient opportunity identification and qualification, pipeline integrity, actuality and forecasting accuracy to support reporting requirements and business reviews.
* Execute and maintain strategic joint business plans, Ensure alignment on all levels (global, regional, local, solution areas, industry areas, etc.) on both sides in order to fine-tune and finalize the annual business plan.
* Build review cadence and drive performance score carding with key stakeholders within the partner
* Understand partner strengths, economics, business imperatives and partner profitability.
* Achieve key stakeholder, including c-level, buy-in and investment at top partners to support SAP‚Äôs growth strategy in terms of license and services capacity growth
* Manage Partner Pipeline and collaborate with Corporate, PLT/TEM & Key/Enterprise opportunity owners
* Drive resolution of conflicts in order to maintain a long-standing and productive business relationship based on mutual trust.
* Leading and orchestrate a (Virtual) Account Team demonstrating leadership skills in the orchestration of internal and partner teams.
* Ensure account teams and Partners are well versed in each account‚Äôs strategy and well positioned for all customer touch points and events.
* Drive engagement with SAP Marketing resources to support partner demand generation and promote success

**Experience & Language Requirements:**

  

* 15+ years working experience in the software industry
* 5+ years in a partner facing role (ex. Sales, Consulting, Customer Service)
* Demonstrated partnering and sales leadership skills
* Relevant experience in developing and growing cloud business with partners / SAP Solution Portfolio
* Business development planning and execution experience in driving sales pipeline, demand gen, and enablement with partners
* Strong analytical competencies
* Effective communication and presentation skills an executive level
* High energy - brings innovative ideas to the team and champions best practices
* Proven capability to work in a team and collaborate, with independent accountability
* Local market knowledge with relevant working experience and understanding (software industry, trends, vertical market industries, etc.) and preferable across SEA

Location: Singapore

**Bring out your best**  
SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.
  
  
**We win with inclusion**  
SAP‚Äôs culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone ‚Äì regardless of background ‚Äì feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better world.  
  
SAP is committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provides accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.  
  
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.  
  
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability, in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local legal requirements.  
  
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

**AI Usage in the Recruitment Process**

For information on the responsible use of AI in our recruitment process, please refer to our Guidelines for Ethical Usage of AI in the Recruiting Process.

Please note that any violation of these guidelines may result in disqualification from the hiring process.

title: Corporate Development Manager (M&A)
description:
About the job

The M&A Team reports to the CFO of Danone Group. Following the refocus of Danone in 2007 on health with the redemption of Numico, the market leader of baby food and medial nutrition, and the sale of the biscuit business, Danone‚Äôs product portfolio has continued to change, both in terms of geographical expansion and sectors.  
Over the past years the Group has been very active on the M&A & portfolio management fronts with key transactions, such as:  

* the disposals of Vega in Canada, our Dairy businesses in Russia and Iran, or Michel & Augustin in France
* the acquisition of Kate Farms in the US, ProMedica in Poland, Akkermansia Company in Belgium.
* the unwinding of all of our partnerships with Mengniu in China

The M&A Team is split into 2 regional teams:  

* One team, based in Paris, covering Europe Middle East & Africa as well as the Americas
* One team, based in Singapore and Bangkok, covering Asia Pacific

**About the role:**

As a member of the M&A team covering APAC, you will actively participate in the inorganic growth strategy and execution of the Danone Group in the Region.

  

**Main Responsibilities:**

1) Strategy and Pipeline management

* Understand the industry with in-depth analysis with regards to Asia Pacific in our categories

* Liaise with the Investment banks to identify potential opportunities.

* Work closely with the Corporate and regional strategy teams to define adequate M&A targets aligned with strategy

2) Financial & Business analysis

* Lead or oversee valuation using multiple methods (DCF, Multiples, precedent transactions)

* Build financial models and scenario analyses

* Assess synergies (topline and bottomline)

* Assess impacts for the Group (ROIC, EPS)

3) Deal Execution

* Manage the end-to-end transaction process including Business case preparation, Deal structuring, negotiations, coordination with internal stakeholders and external advisors (bankers, auditors, consultants, lawyers)

* Co-Lead the Due Diligence process with the M&A Legal team (finance, tax, commercial, Legal, Operations, HR, ESG)

4) Cross-Functional Leadership

* Act as the co-coordinator of the different teams and workstream (Finance, Legal, Tax, Ops,IT, Commercial, HR,...)

* Translate complex information into clear recommendation for top management

5) Negotiating & Closing

* Support negotiations on Enterprise Value, Reps & Warranties, closing conditions, governance in Joint-Ventures

* Ensure the transaction is executed in compliance with internal governance and regulatory requirements

6) Post Merger Integration

* Preparation of integration plans to be handed over to the business teams

* Close cooperation with the business units to ensure operational success and delivery of the business case

About you

To be successful in this role, you will need‚Ä¶

**The following technical skills and experience:**  

* Master's degree in accounting, finance, economics, business or management from top tier schools
* CPA or CFA or similar professional qualification
* 5-10 years of solid M&A deal working experience in Asia with proven track record (Banks, Corporate M&A‚Ä¶) : acquisitions, disposals, JV
* Full investment cycle experience preferred
* Operational finance experience is a plus.
* Overseas working experiences or multinational corporation working experiences
* FMCG / CPG experience is a plus
* Solid technical skills in corporate finance and accounting,
* Strong knowledge in valuation and financial modelling
* Proven ability to communicate with the business units
* Proven ability to establish relations built on high level of trust
* Team leadership and people management
* Experience working collaboratively with all levels of internal staff, external advisors & government officials
* Fluency in English

* Fluency in Mandarin will be a plus

  

**These soft skills:**  

* Pragmatic with business sense, good investment judgment and strategic thinking
* Reliable, accurate, good process organizer
* Autonomous and self-motivated, with the ability to handle high workload
* Analytical and structured with strong problem-solving skills
* Strong negotiation & communication skills
* Sound business ethics
* Curious, Keen to learn.
* Open minded and good listener
* Interest in the F&B sector
* Willing to travel (Asia-Pacific and Europe)

About us

**Flexibility**

Do things your way. At Danone Singapore, we believe that our teams work best when they are empowered to work flexibly ‚Äì this is why our hybrid working policy allows you to agree the right balance of homeworking and office working, in line with yours and the team‚Äôs needs.

  

**Focus on development ‚Äì your way**

With a suite of learning opportunities and a strong focus on in-role development, your line manager will work closely with you to help unlock your career ambitions within Danone. Working here you will enjoy a fast-paced, complex environment, which is packed with opportunities for the entrepreneurial spirit. You‚Äôll work with some of the best-known brands in the world, such as evian, Dumex and Aptamil, and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself.

  

**Our values**

We live by our core ‚ÄòHOPE‚Äô values ‚Äì H is for Humanism, as people are at the heart of everything we do. O is for Openness, welcoming new ideas from the world we live in. P is for Proximity, as we believe that building close relationships leads to better understanding and trust. E is for Enthusiasm, for those who are as passionate as we are about bringing health through food to as many people as possible.

  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI)** is deeply embedded in Danone's DNA, representing our core values and beliefs. We embrace diversity as a driving force for positive change, nurturing an inclusive workplace where every individual is valued.

  

Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU. For more information about Danone, our divisions and culture, please visit careers.danone.com.

  

#LI-DPS

title: AVP, Risk Manager - Wealth Management
description:
Position Overview  

* The role is focused on establishing the Conduct & Control Department as a proactive business partner and a key contributor to the Bank‚Äôs business strategy.
* Acts as the first line of defense to ensure risk-based, sustainable, and efficient strategies are implemented to address Operational, Business, and Conduct risks in the APAC region.
* Works closely with the Wealth Management (WM) business in APAC to manage and mitigate risks.

  
Primary Role Responsibilities  

* The candidate will support the Head of Governance, Advisory & Surveillance, WM APAC Conduct and Control, in maintaining a robust risk framework for Operational and Business risks in collaboration with WM in APAC (Hong Kong and Singapore).
* The position is based in Singapore and operates within the first line of defense (1 LoD).

  
Key Responsibilities  
1. Incident Investigation and Analysis  

* Ensure timely lodging and escalation of incidents.
* Lead and coordinate in-depth investigations of operational risk incidents across Wealth Management in Singapore and Hong Kong.
* Conduct structured fact-finding and evidence analysis to determine root causes and contributing factors.
* Assess downstream and upstream impacts, ensuring proposed actions address immediate, past, and future issues.
* Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of remediation actions and preventive measures.
* Perform trend analysis to identify opportunities to strengthen the control framework.

  
2. Escalation and Governance  

* Ensure timely escalation of incidents to Senior Management in accordance with defined thresholds and governance requirements.
* Prepare clear and concise incident summaries, analyses, and reporting materials for management and governance committees (e.g., ICC, ORCC).

  
3. Stakeholder Coordination  

* Serve as a key coordination point between Front Office, Operations, Compliance, Legal, Finance, IT, and other stakeholders for incident matters.
* Liaise with Head Office and regional counterparts to ensure consistency in incident handling and alignment with Group expectations.
* Facilitate effective ownership and accountability for incident remediation.

  
4. Reporting and Continuous Improvement  

* Produce incident reports (e.g., quarterly reporting) and trend analyses for management.
* Contribute to the review and enhancement of incident-related procedures, escalation matrices, and governance frameworks.
* Support internal audits, inspections, and ad-hoc risk reviews related to operational incidents.
* Assist in various risk reporting requirements for different forums and to Head Office.

  
5. Risk Assessment and Reporting  

* Participate in the review and collation of annual Enterprise Risk Assessments, such as Risk Cartography Self-Assessment and Risk Identification.

  
6. Ad Hoc Projects  

* Undertake ad hoc projects as assigned by the Head of Conduct and Control ‚Äì Governance, Advisory and Surveillance.

  
Requirements  

* Strong understanding of risk control frameworks and operational risk management.
* Excellent stakeholder management and collaboration skills.
* Structured, detail-oriented, and methodical approach to work.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess and articulate risk impacts.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present investigation findings clearly and concisely to governance forums.
* At least 5 to 8 years (or more) of relevant experience in Operational Risk, Incident Management, Internal Control, Audit, or related risk functions, preferably within private banking or wealth management.
* Proven experience in operational incident investigation, including fact-finding, timeline reconstruction, root cause analysis, and remediation assessment.
* Sound understanding of Operational Risk Management frameworks, internal controls, and governance within the private banking sector.
* Strong data analysis skills, with the ability to work on various dashboard reporting for Management and investigative work.

title: Integrated Social Lead, APAC + SG
description:
About¬†WPP Media¬†

WPP is the creative transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet,¬†clients¬†and communities. For more information, visit wpp.com.¬†

WPP Media is WPP‚Äôs global media collective. In a world where media is everywhere and in everything, we bring the best platform, people, and partners together to create limitless opportunities for growth. For more information, visit wppmedia.com¬†

At WPP Media, we believe in the power of our culture and our people.¬†It‚Äôs¬†what elevates us to deliver exceptional experiences for both our clients and each other. In this role it will be critical to embrace WPP & WPP Media‚Äôs shared core values:¬†

  • Be¬†Extraordinary¬†by¬†Leading Collectively¬†to¬†Inspire transformational Creativity.¬†
  • Create an¬†Open¬†environment by¬†Balancing People and Client Experiences¬†by¬†Cultivating Trust.¬†
  • Lead¬†Optimistically¬†by¬†Championing Growth¬†and Development¬†to¬†Mobilize the Enterprise.¬†

Role Summary and Impact¬†

The Integrated Social Lead will define, champion, and evolve WPP Media's market-leading paid social media strategy and capabilities across the diverse markets of the Asia Pacific region. This role is tasked with building an industry-leading paid social practice that delivers media transformation¬†for clients by leveraging advanced tactics across¬†all¬†relevant platforms. The mission is to drive superior media performance, seamlessly integrate paid social with broader media planning and buying, set regional standards of excellence, and achieve measurable business outcomes.

The Integrated Social Lead, APAC, will be a visionary architect, shaping and leading WPP Media's paid social discipline across the dynamic and diverse markets of the APAC region, with particular attention to Singapore Local and¬†Regional Clients. This role demands a unique blend of strategic foresight, commercial acumen, creative innovation, and analytical prowess, with a deep understanding of how to optimize paid social strategies within holistic media plans across¬†all social platforms. This leader will define regional best practices for paid social, foster collaboration across WPP Media agencies and client teams, and drive cutting-edge solutions. They will mobilize the enterprise¬†to deliver unparalleled paid social expertise, leveraging WPP Media's proprietary technologies, industry-leading platform accreditations, and scaled partnerships to build better futures for our clients and communities in APAC + SG.

Skills and Experience¬†

1. Paid Social Strategy & Leadership

  • Define and lead WPP Media's overarching paid social media strategy for the APAC¬†region, aligning with media¬†transformation¬†and client success across¬†all social platforms¬†within the regional media context.
  • Champion a unified paid social practice framework, integrating planning and buying into holistic media strategies, while developing advanced first-party data strategies for enhanced targeting and measurement.
  • Identify, integrate, and operationalize emerging paid social trends, platform innovations, and strategic opportunities (e.g., AI in paid social, advanced programmatic buying, new media products).
  • Guide performance creative strategies, leveraging DCO and AI-driven creative, and utilize automation and machine learning for predictive campaign optimization and efficient activation across paid social channels.

2. Client Engagement & Thought Leadership

  • Act as a senior strategic advisor for WPP Media's¬†top-tier clients within the APAC region, positioning the organization as the authoritative voice in paid social strategy, execution, and media investment across¬†all social platforms.
  • Cultivate trust¬†and expand long-term relationships by providing visionary insights on cross-platform social media allocation, budgeting, and performance, driving new business and shaping regional market narratives.

3. Performance Measurement & Optimization¬†

  • Establish and drive advanced measurement methodologies, including incrementality testing, multi-touch attribution, and unified media measurement models, for paid social media effectiveness and ROI across various client portfolios.
  • Lead actionable analytics and A/B testing to continuously optimize paid social strategies and campaigns, enhancing engagement, audience growth, and demonstrable business outcomes across all regional markets.

4. Governance, Standards & Platform Alliances

  • Establish and uphold regional standards for paid social media excellence, compliance, and ethical engagement across WPP Media's network, considering local regulations and media buying guidelines.
  • Lead strategic alliances with¬†all top social platforms¬†and significant regional platforms, fostering innovation, competitive advantage, and access to beta features, particularly concerning¬†media products, data, and measurement capabilities.

5. Collaboration & Talent Development

  • Lead collectively¬†by fostering strong collaboration and knowledge sharing across WPP Media's diverse agencies and expert communities (creative, strategy, data, media buying) within APAC + SG for paid social initiatives.
  • Mentor, inspire, and develop high-performance paid social media professionals across the APAC + SG region, fostering continuous learning and growth with an emphasis on integrated social and media expertise.

Qualifications

  • Experience:¬†10-12+ years progressive experience in paid social media leadership within a large media agency network, global media buying entity, or media-focused global brand. Extensive experience leading paid social strategy, execution, and significant media planning/buying across multiple APAC markets, including Singapore, is essential.¬†Expertise in optimizing media spend across¬†all major social platforms.
  • Paid Social & Media Expertise:¬†In-depth expertise across¬†all aspects of paid social media: strategy, planning, activation, optimization, and measurement across comprehensive social platforms. Deep understanding of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, local APAC laws), first-party data strategies, and how paid social integrates with broader marketing and media channels, considering APAC + SG market characteristics.
  • Strategic & Analytical Acumen:¬†Exceptional ability to translate complex challenges into clear, compelling paid social strategies. Superior analytical skills for interpreting data, identifying trends, and driving measurable business outcomes across diverse regional markets and¬†integrated media campaigns.
  • Regional Leadership & Communication:¬†Outstanding leadership, communication (both written and oral), and interpersonal skills for leading a diverse, multi-market practice. Proven track record of leading high-performance, geographically dispersed teams, fostering innovation, and collaborating effectively across cross-functional partners.
  • Innovation & Future-Forward Mindset:¬†Highly forward-thinking with a relentless curiosity for emerging trends and technologies (GenAI in paid social/media, DCO, automation) relevant to APAC. Profound passion for brand building, digital content amplification, and leveraging creativity/media effectively, aligned with WPP Media's media¬†transformation¬†identity. Strong understanding of creative's interplay with paid media performance.
  • Technical & Platform Fluency:¬†Advanced proficiency in social media advertising platforms, bidding strategies, measurement tools, and analytics. Extensive experience with all major social advertising platforms and media buying tools prevalent in APAC.

Life at¬†WPP Media¬†& Benefits¬†

Our passion for shaping the next era of media includes investing in our employees to help them do their best work, and¬†we‚Äôre¬†just as committed to employee growth as we are to responsible media investment. WPP Media employees can tap into the global WPP Media & WPP networks to pursue their passions, grow their networks, and learn at the¬†cutting edge¬†of marketing and advertising. We have a variety of employee resource groups and host frequent in-office events¬†showcasing¬†team wins, sharing thought leadership, and celebrating holidays and milestone events. Our benefits include competitive medical, group retirement plans, vision, and dental insurance, significant paid time off, preferential partner discounts, and employee mental health awareness days.¬†¬†¬†

WPP Media is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to¬†particular characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.¬†

We believe the best work happens when¬†we're¬†together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection.¬†That's¬†why¬†we‚Äôve¬†adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office around four days a week. If you¬†require¬†accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.¬†

Please read our Privacy Notice (https://www.wppmedia.com/pages/privacy-policy)¬†for more information on how we process the information you provide.¬†

While we appreciate all applications received, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.‚ÄØ¬†

title: Line Producer, Morning Studio
description:
**About the Team:**
-------------------

Morning Studio is the award-winning brand studio of the South China Morning Post. We bridge the gap between journalism and advertising, creating high-impact branded content that resonates with a global audience.

Working under the Executive Video Producer, our video team is a fast-moving hub of in-house producers and external specialists. We are seeking a Line Producer who acts as the operational backbone of the studio‚Äîthe person who turns ambitious creative concepts into organized, on-budget, and logistically seamless productions.

**In this role you will:**
--------------------------

* Budgeting & Financial Management: Own the video production budget for each campaign from initial pitch to final wrap. You will create detailed line-item budgets, track costs, and ensure healthy margins across all branded projects.
* Logistics & Scheduling: Mastermind the production calendar. You will coordinate shoot dates, travel logistics, and equipment rentals, ensuring that our in-house producers and freelance assistants are utilized efficiently.
* Vendor & Talent Management: Source, negotiate with, and contract external vendors, including production houses, colorists, animators, and sound engineers. You will also oversee talent casting and manage all freelancer payroll and invoicing.
* Compliance & Risk: Ensure every shoot is legally sound. This includes securing location permits, managing production insurance, and overseeing all talent/music releases and intellectual property rights.
* Operational Oversight: Act as the bridge between the Executive Video Producer and the "on-the-ground" crew. You will oversee the workflow of in-house and freelance production staff to ensure milestones are met on time.
* Post-Production Traffic: Manage the delivery pipeline. You will coordinate the hand-off of assets between editors, animators, and colorists to ensure the final output meets Morning Studio‚Äôs premium standards.

**Skills and Experience that will lead to success:**
----------------------------------------------------

* The Track Record: 5+ years of experience in line producing or production management within a commercial agency, branded content studio, or high-end production house.
* Financial Rigor: Expert-level proficiency in budgeting. You have a proven ability to manage six-figure budgets with precision.
* Local Expertise: A deep understanding of the Hong Kong production landscape, including union regulations, permit requirements, and an extensive "black book" of local crew and vendors.
* Problem Solving: You are a strategic thinker who can anticipate logistical bottlenecks before they happen and provide solutions that keep the cameras rolling.
* The Toolkit: Proficient in project management software and a solid understanding of the technical requirements for modern video formats (4K workflows, social-first aspect ratios, etc.).
* Soft Skills: A calm, authoritative presence. You can manage high-pressure situations with diplomacy and communicate effectively with both high-level executives and technical crew. Exceptional negotiation skills and the ability to speak "creative" and "finance" fluently. Fluency in English is required; Cantonese or Mandarin is a significant advantage.

**Why Join Us?**
----------------

* Impactful Work: Lead the operations for campaigns that reach millions of readers globally on the SCMP platform.
* Creative Autonomy: Partner with the Executive Video Producer to build a best-in-class production workflow from the ground up.
* Dynamic Environment: Work at the intersection of traditional journalism and cutting-edge brand storytelling.

Work location will be at the Causeway Bay office.

Our Privacy Notice aims to comply with all relevant data privacy and protection laws. You should read the Privacy Notice in full at corp.scmp.com/privacy-policy.

title: Temp IRB Analyst
description:
Family Group: Administration

The Lead / IRB Analyst needs to ensure that the NHG Office of Human Research Protection Programme (OHRPP) provides the highest level of administrative support services for ethics, thereby ensuring the sustainability of a robust and effective research ethics review process.

The Lead / IRB Analyst will assist the Manager to manage the operations of the Domain Specific Review Board (DSRB) to ensure that they meet their primary responsibilities of protecting the rights and welfare of human research subjects.

1. Ethics Policy Management

1.1 Assists the Manager in regular review and update of research ethical guidelines, policies and standard operating procedures.

1.2 Perform secretariat duties to the NHG REC.

2. Ethics Review and Approval Process and Procedures

2.1 Monitoring of Quality of Review

* Ensures that research protocols submitted to functional teams are reviewed efficiently and consistent with the applicable regulations, guidelines and policy

* Ensures that the Review Board‚Äôs reviewing processes are properly conducted, including meeting agendas, ensuring quorum, and document minutes of the meetings and follow up actions including correspondence to Investigators/ Sponsors.

* Ensures that meeting minutes are in sufficient details to document Review Boards‚Äô deliberations.

2.2 Monitoring of Timeliness of Review

Screens and audits applications and correspondence received by the review boards in functional team and assist to oversee the accurate and timely processing, of submissions to and actions by the review boards.

2.3 Participate in Quality Improvement

Improve ethics approval process and effectiveness of review, as part of continuous improvement project

2.4 Serve as resource for Investigators and Researchers regarding the adaptation and implementation of DSRB policies, procedures and forms.

2.5 Effectively communicate and document all communications with Sponsors, Investigators, Review Board Members and regulatory authorities.

3. DSRB Database Management

* Assists in preparing DSRB-related reports on ethics and other topics

* Maintains an accurate, comprehensive and up-to-date database of all applications.

4. Operational Matters of Administrative Support Office

* Performs operational matters in the absence of the IRB Manager/Assistant Manager

* Performs any other ad-hoc job-related duties as assigned.

* Serve as the Main Secretariat of Ethics conferences/programs.

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

**Education/Training/Experience**

* Degree, preferably in Science / Life Sciences / Nursing / Pharmacy / Health Sciences
* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience, preferably in an IRB setting. Experience in healthcare, clinical research and related training would be an advantage.
* Displayed a good understanding of research ethics policies and local regulations
* Professional accreditation preferred e.g. CIP
* Demonstrate basic knowledge and skills in quality and process improvement approaches
* Possess good organization, project management and preferably with data analytical and good writing skills

**Personal Attributes**

* Demonstrated good inter-personnel and influencing skills in working with different groups of stakeholders
* Team-player, demonstrates excellent team spirit and skills in supporting teams and managers
* Ability to influence and motivate people
* Ability to handle and manage stressful situations and work independently under pressure

title: Sponsorship Sales Manager (Sustainability)
description:
**Sponsorship Sales Manager (Sustainability)**  
**Singapore Office (2 - 3 days/week in the office)**  
 **SALARY: SGD $86,000 plus commission**

Times Higher Education is the data provider underpinning university excellence in every continent across the world. As the company behind the world‚Äôs most influential university ranking, and with almost five decades of experience as a source of analysis and insight on higher education, we have unparalleled expertise on the trends underpinning university performance globally. Our data and benchmarking tools are used by many of the world‚Äôs most prestigious universities to help them achieve their strategic goals and our events series act as the home of higher education thought leadership around the world.

**About the Role**

We are looking for a Sponsorship Sales Manager to join Times Higher Education‚Äôs corporate team, with a clear focus on selling event sponsorship and exhibition packages, primarily for the Asia Pacific Sustainable Business Summit, part of the Global Sustainable Development Congress series (GSDC).

This role is about commercial sales. You will sell tailored sponsorship and exhibition opportunities that align with the strategic priorities of corporate partners. You will tap into THE‚Äôs wider global events portfolio where relevant, but your main focus will be on the Asia Pacific Sustainable Business Summit.

The Asia Pacific Sustainable Business Summit brings together leaders from business, academia, government, and civil society to drive action on sustainability in the region. It is a core part of GSDC‚Äôs international footprint and a key platform for corporate visibility and partnership.

You will report to the Commercial Director, with a dotted line to the Asia Pacific Summit leadership. You will work closely with marketing, content, and event teams who will support lead generation and delivery. Your role is to convert opportunities into revenue and build strong commercial relationships.

This role requires domestic and international travel to attend events, client meetings, and industry conferences.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Focus on sponsorship and exhibition sales for the Asia Pacific Sustainable Business Summit
* Achieve and exceed individual revenue targets
* Build and manage a pipeline of corporate sponsors and exhibitors
* Prospect, engage, and close new commercial partners
* Develop and present sponsorship options that match client objectives within the event framework
* Maintain strong ongoing relationships with sponsors to support renewal and growth
* Work with marketing to align sales campaigns with promotional activity
* Coordinate with events teams to ensure sponsor commitments are delivered
* Keep CRM up to date with activity, pipeline and forecasts
* Monitor competitor events and sponsorship trends in the sustainability space
* Represent THE at relevant events to build networks and generate leads

**Experience and Skills Required**

* Proven track record in event sponsorship sales or exhibition sales
* Strong experience selling into corporate clients, ideally in sustainability or related sectors
* Experience managing a full sales cycle from lead generation to close
* Comfortable presenting to senior leaders in business and government
* Highly organised with strong pipeline management skills
* Commercial focus and track record of meeting targets
* Able to work independently while collaborating with internal teams
* Clear communication skills, both written and oral
* Good working knowledge of MS Office and CRM systems
* Willingness to travel internationally as required

  

***You do You***  
***You do You. With colleagues located around the world, we know that our individuality and diversity of experiences are our greatest strengths. That‚Äôs why we want THE to be a place where you are welcome to be who you want to be at work; where you can share whatever part of your life or self-identity you want, without obligation or facing discrimination; and where all abilities and perspectives are recognised and accommodated.***

title: Procurement Category Mgr. , Data Center Sourcing and Procurement (DCSP)
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we‚Äôre the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain ‚Äî and we‚Äôre looking for talented people who want to help.  
  
You‚Äôll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You‚Äôll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you‚Äôll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.  
  
The Infrastructure team provides AWS and Amazon.com with the compute, network and datacenter capacity that are the foundations of the retail and cloud business. We are seeking a Procurement professional to support the APAC data center procurement space in India.  
  
As a Sr. Procurement Category Manager, you will create and implement regional (APAC) sourcing strategies for multiple complex categories within construction domain and collaborate with internal business partners and suppliers to reduce risks and costs for Amazon. You will develop mechanisms and metrics to hold suppliers accountable for performance and delivery. Additionally, you will drive results through methods that include competitive bidding, negotiating, and analyzing data and market trends for your category. You will also create global Procurement processes and tools to drive innovation across teams.  
  
Key job responsibilities  
Own supply chain sustainability and de-carbonization strategy and delivery for construction projects for APAC  
  
Lead Construction material supply chain sourcing and program management to drive cost saving and risk mitigation  
  
Drive regional initiatives and programs across the construction procurement team  
  
Analyze category data and metrics to establish and implement procurement category strategies  
  
Understand trends in customers‚Äô needs and concerns across categories and regions to influence customers‚Äô priorities  
  
Provide in-depth knowledge about the supply market and supplier capabilities, technically and geographically, to the business.  
  
Develop mechanisms and metrics to track supplier performance related to delivery, quality, and cost  
Lead business reviews to discuss best practices and issues and to ultimately improve supplier
  
performance and strengthen business partnerships  
  
Innovate within the procurement space, automating and/or improving tools or processes to better support the Procurement Lifecycle  
  
Some travel may be required, up to 25%.  
  
About the team  
Diverse Experiences  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.  
  
Why AWS?  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  
  
Inclusive Team Culture  
Here at AWS, it‚Äôs in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  
  
Mentorship & Career Growth  
We‚Äôre continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth‚Äôs Best Employer. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional  
  
Work/Life Balance  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there‚Äôs nothing we can‚Äôt achieve in the cloud.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* 5+ years of procurement, supply chain, inventory management, contract management, lease administration or operations experience
* 5+ years of relevant strategic sourcing including vendor negotiations, global contract management, process improvement, operational and financial analysis experience
* Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business, Engineering, Finance, or a related technical field
* Experience in procurement, supply chain, inventory management, contract management, lease administration or operations
* Experience in strategic sourcing including vendor negotiations, global contract management, process improvement, operational and financial analysis
* Experience with data analysis tools such as Advanced Excel, SQL, Tableau, Python
* Experience in global supply chain management, managing cross-functional teams in a fast-paced consumer electronics product company

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* 4+ years of program, project, product management, or leading a product implementation process experience
* Master's degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
* Experience in program, project, product management, or leading a product implementation process
* Experience in data centers, infrastructure service providers, or related technology companies

  
Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Manager, Enabling Skills for Life (ESLP) ‚Äì Living Skills ‚Äì Disability Sector
description:
Singapore

The Manager plans, develops and reviews the services and operations of the Enabling Skills for Life (ESLP) ‚Äì Living Skills, formerly Day Activity Centre. He / she also drives the post-18 service continuum, and co-lead or develop initiatives within the adult service landscape or for SPD, to meet emerging needs of the clients and caregivers, or for SPD strategic development.

#### **Responsibilities**

**Administration**

* Responsible for all matters pertaining to administration, operations and control of the living skill and care programmes.
* Recommend policies and practices for the efficient and effective operation and management of services under your purview as well as implementing those policies and practices.

**Operations**

* Drive outreach activities to enrol persons with disabilities (PwDs) and caregivers.
* Develop and implement a slew of independent living skills, social engagement and care programmes to engage PwDs and caregivers.
* Supervise a multidisciplinary team including social workers, therapists, support and administrative staff, and work with various government as well as community-based organisations to offer services to adults with disabilities.
* Lead the team in developing the service model / review, setting service guidelines/standards and monitoring service delivery of programmes.
* Responsible for achieving key performance indicators, providing progress reports and assisting in data analysis for planning and reporting purposes.
* Keep abreast of latest development in service delivery of related areas to ensure that service delivery for our clients are updated.
* Submit indicators to all relevant funding agencies such as MSF and SG Enable etc. Coordinate the claims for submission to funding agencies.
* Prepare annual budget for the center, and relevant papers where required.

**Service Development & Sustainability**

* Engage in organizational planning i.e. strategic planning, programme planning and services review of the programmes
* Ensure the sustainability of the programmes, including funding exploration and renewals.
* Keep current with the funding rates (norm costs) and requirements for the programme.
* Prepare annual budget for the center.

**Networking**

* Responsible for outreach to referral agencies, community organizations and hospitals for client referrals to ESH
* Participate in events organized or supported by SPD and develop strong networks with other Social Service Agencies (SSAs), community organizations and funding bodies like MSF, NCSS and SG Enable, towards active collaborations.

#### **Requirements**

* Master or Bachelor degree in any discipline related to health science from a good University.
* At least 5 years of relevant working experience in managing programmes for persons with disabilities.
* Excellent management and leadership skills with demonstrated ability to lead a multi-disciplinary team.
* Business planning and marketing experience preferred.
* Communicative, persuasive and able to encourage and motivate the team.
* A good understanding and knowledge of the sector and dynamics is an advantage.

title: Senior Game Producer - Unpublished R&D Product
description:
Riot Games was established in 2006 by entrepreneurial gamers who believe that player-focused development leads to exceptional games. In 2009, Riot released its debut title *League of Legends* to critical and player acclaim. Since then, Riot has expanded its portfolio and studios globally, continuing to create games that inspire and connect players around the world.

That's where you come in.

As a Producer at Riot, you'll support passionate, cross-functional teams in creating exciting content and experiences for our players around the world. You will encourage teams to communicate, guide development, remove roadblocks, and ultimately help drive our games into players' hands, while making sure that our teams and workflows are healthy and sustainable.

As a Sr. Producer for an Unpublished R&D product team, you will help steer and orchestrate cosmetic content development, and coordinate production best practices with our production and gameplay teams to help deliver the best possible products to our players. You will partner closely with artists, producers, product owners, designers and engineers to guide content from concept through implementation - maintaining quality, managing timelines, and ensuring creative alignment. You will help shape the pipelines and workflows that enable artists to do their best work, at scale, in a live service environment. You will use your experience of content production, strong project management fundamentals, and broad knowledge of the game development process to support the product's holistic vision. You will report to an Operations Lead on the project.

**Responsibilities:**
---------------------

* Lead delivery of content features in a cross-team and cross-discipline manner
* Partner with discipline leads to ensure that all content meets fidelity, consistency, and style standards
* Drive development and maintenance of sustainable creative pipelines, including support for external vendors and outsourcing workflows
* Drive creation, alignment, and delivery of content goals
* Transition a team from a largely exploratory space to a high functioning delivery model
* Prioritization of requests from multiple partner teams, planned and emergent
* Long range planning of resource allocation to deliver against project priorities
* Establish and own an effective development framework by leading content team meetings, driving iterative process improvements, and ensuring needed communication
* Own long term sustainability of the team including improving capabilities, creating and maintaining effective work systems, and team health
* Ensure effective execution of risk management, velocity tracking, product review, and quality validation
* Identify and resolve roadblocks and distractions to unlock developers and help them achieve established goals
* Maintain stakeholder relationships and keep them informed of progress, risks, and pivots
* Communicate team staffing needs as they arise

**Required Qualifications:**
----------------------------

* 8+ years of experience in a Production role (i.e. - experience as a producer, product manager, project manager, or similar).
* 4+ years of experience delivering content for a live service game
* 2+ years of experience guiding a R&D project through the different phases of development from Pre-production to Production to Live.
* Experience working with game developers to create or manage scalable pipelines for art-driven content; deep familiarity with modern 2D and 3D art pipelines in games.
* Experience collaborating with creatives to scope, prioritize, and deliver high-quality visual assets.
* Experience shipping multiple games with production responsibility on important features and content
* Experience working with both internal and external vendors to deliver content for a live service game
* Experience with project management software such as Jira or MS Project

**Desired Qualifications:**
---------------------------

* A passion for solving operational and logistical problems
* Experience managing art content teams and processes
* Experience with Unreal workflows

**Our Perks**
-------------

* Full relocation support
* Full health insurance for you, your spouse and children
* Open paid time off
* Retirement benefits with company matching
* Life insurance, parental leave, plus short-term and long-term disability
* Play Fund so you can broaden and deepen your knowledge of our players and community through games
* We will double down on your donations of time and money to non-profits

title: Workplace Environment, Health & Safety Officer
description:
Job ID: 20653

Location:
Aero - 8 Changi North Way, SG

Description:

**ST Engineering** is a global technology, defence and engineering group with a diverse portfolio of businesses across the aerospace, smart city, defence and public security segments. The Group harnesses technology and innovation to solve real-world problems, enabling a more secure and sustainable world. Headquartered in Singapore, it has operations spanning Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the U.S., serving customers in more than 100 countries. ST Engineering reported a revenue of over $10 billion in 2023 and ranks among the largest companies listed on the Singapore Exchange. It is a component stock of MSCI Singapore, FTSE Straits Times Index and Dow Jones Sustainability Asia Pacific Index.

  

**About Commercial Aerospace business**

ST Engineering‚Äôs Commercial Aerospace business is a world-class Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) and Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul (MRO) service provider with proven solutions for practically every stage of an aircraft life cycle. With nearly 50 years of reputable track record in aviation, backed by a highly experienced team of engineers and technicians across facilities in Asia Pacific, the U.S. and Europe, we know what it takes to keep the world flying safely.

  

**Job Description for EHS Officer**

* Serve as the appointed Workplace Safety & Health Officer (WSHO) and Fire Safety Manager (FSM) to ensure compliance with the Workplace Safety and Health Act, Fire Safety Act and all relevant regulations.
* Conduct regular risk assessments, safety inspections, and audits to identify hazards and ensure that corrective actions are taken.
* Assist in developing and monitoring Environmental, Health & Safety (EHS) programme and policies.
* Ensure all work activities comply with local WSH regulations, including managing safety training and certification for all personnel.
* Coordinate and oversee external vendor / contractor management to ensure products and services provided complies to internal and regulatory safety requirements.
* Investigate workplace accidents, incidents and near misses. Compile reports and recommend effective and sustainable preventive measures to avoid recurrence.
* Plan and conduct internal and external audits as per statutory requirements (i.e. ISO 14001 and ISO 45001)
* Monitoring and implementation of EHS work plan to achieve the intended objectives.
* Plan and coordinate Industrial Health Monitoring reports.
* Review and update of EHS documents (i.e. EHS SOPs, Risk Registers, Safe Work Procedures, Lifting Plan etc.)
* Coordinate and conduct EHS Safety Committee meeting.
* Coordinate and support EHS Team Lead on EHS Management Review meeting
* Ensure all relevant EHS documentations are maintained and updated for retrieval as and when required.
* Promote and drive safety awareness programs to foster a strong safety culture within the organization.
* All other ad-hoc duties as inform by Management.

  

**Job Description for Fire Safety Manager**

* Develop, maintain, and implement fire emergency response plans, including conducting regular fire drills and inspections.
* Conduct fire risk assessments and ensure that fire safety systems (such as alarms, extinguishers, and sprinkler systems) are properly maintained and operational.
* Liaise with relevant authorities on fire safety inspections, audits, and certifications, and ensure all fire safety equipment and systems are compliant with local regulations.
* Provide regular fire safety training to all personnel and ensure emergency evacuation procedures are up to date and practiced.
* Manage appointment and competency of safety roles (CERT, First Aiders etc.) are adequate to meet operational needs.
* Liaise with internal departments, subcontractors, and customers to address safety concerns and improve maintenance practices.
* Compile, analyze, and report on fire safety performance data, ensuring continuous improvement in fire safety practices.

  

**Job Requirements**

* Minimum a Diploma in an engineering or equivalent field.
* Must be a registered Workplace Safety and Health Officer with Ministry of Manpower (MOM)
* Must be a registered Fire Safety Manager with Singapore Civil Defence Force (SCDF)
* Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, ideally in an aviation environment.
* Strong knowledge of ISO 9001, 14001, and 45001 Management Systems and local WSH and Fire Safety regulations
* Knowledge on manufacturing processes will be an advantage.
* Ability to use relevant Microsoft applications for report writing, documents updates, analysis and develop EHS related contents.
* Ability to consult and influence stakeholders, collaborate with others, and value their contribution.
* Be dynamic, self-motivated, proactive, results-orientated & organized in time management.
* Excellent team spirit, strong technical competence, good negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
* Candidates with Noise Control Officer (NCO) Qualification will be an added advantage.
* Candidates with Environmental Control Officer (ECO) Qualification will be an added advantage.

title: Group Risk Consultant - Asset Management
description:
Who are we?

Howden is a global insurance group with employee ownership at its heart. Together, we have pushed the boundaries of insurance. We are united by a shared passion and no-limits mindset, and our strength lies in our ability to collaborate as a powerful international team comprised of 23,000 employees spanning over 56 countries.

People join Howden for many different reasons, but they stay for the same one: our culture. It‚Äôs what sets us apart, and the reason our employees have been turning down headhunters for years. Whatever your priorities ‚Äì work / life balance, career progression, sustainability, volunteering ‚Äì you‚Äôll find like-minded people driving change at Howden.

The job holder is responsible for advising clients within the Asset Management industry sector on their employee benefits programs, with a preferred specialist knowledge of Group Risk. This opportunity is to join a dynamic division within Howden Employee Benefits, servicing over 400 clients in the sector.

You will be expected to manage client relationships and manage policies in Group Risk, as well as develop new opportunities across the broad spectrum of Employee Benefits. Managing a portfolio of clients and the responsibility to deliver a personal account development new business budget. You will partner with specialist consultants in Healthcare and Pensions and have the support of our Client Services team to work collaboratively to deliver a market leading service proposition to clients in this specific market

Role Responsibilities:

* Be the first point of contact for clients. Understand the sector and benefits offered. Be prepared to respond quickly and accurately to client queries.
* Builds a robust system for ensuring appropriate management of consultancy (and oversee day to day administration) tasks including proactive follow up with clients and insurers, keeping appropriate colleagues appraised at all times.
* Build and lead the relationship with a portfolio of Asset Management clients whilst providing advice on specifically on Group Risk and associated insurance products and services.
* Work closely with the Client Services team to ensure all renewal, reviews, claims and medical underwriting are completed in a timely manner to meet clients‚Äô needs.
* Hold a broad knowledge of insurers‚Äô propositions and differences to provide the most appropriate advice for clients.
* Collaborate with Howden colleagues across Health & Benefits and the wider group to encourage client referrals and deliver new business proposals. This is a cross-referral process and we equally encourage you to develop opportunities for referral into our colleagues globally and in the general insurance markets.
* Service is the bedrock of the Asset Management Employee Benefits proposition, and you will have exceptional customer service skills to deliver this at all times to all clients.
* You will work closely with the Client Services team to ensure that the clients‚Äô group policies are proactively managed and needs met out in accordance with relevant policies. The job holder may also be required to provide support to their line manager in relation to nominated business projects.
* You build strong internal, client and provider relationships based on respect that develops and builds loyalty, retention and increased client benefit spend.

Role Requirements:

* Demonstrable experience advising clients in Group Risk and advising on wider Employee Benefits would be beneficial.
* Detailed knowledge and understanding of group risk policies is preferred, primarily death in service, income protection, critical illness and other employee benefits.
* Experience in consultancy or administration. You can create, write and manipulate template reports.
* You take ownership of your portfolio and proactively manage the associated workload, flagging client risks and opportunities.
* CII GR1 qualified, preferred

What do we offer in return?

A career that you define. At Howden, we value diversity ‚Äì there is no one Howden type. Instead, we‚Äôre looking for individuals who share the same values as us:

* Our successes have all come from someone brave enough to try something new
* We support each other in the small everyday moments and the bigger challenges
* We are determined to make a positive difference at work and beyond

Reasonable adjustments

We're committed to providing reasonable accommodations at Howden to ensure that our positions align well with your needs. Besides the usual adjustments such as software, IT, and office setups, we can also accommodate other changes such as flexible hours\\* or hybrid working\\*.

If you're excited by this role but have some doubts about whether it‚Äôs the right fit for you, send us your application ‚Äì if your profile fits the role‚Äôs criteria, we will be in touch to assist in helping to get you set up with any reasonable adjustments you may require.

* Not all positions can accommodate changes to working hours or locations. Reach out to your Recruitment Partner if you want to know more.

Permanent

title: Feid Engineer (loT)
description:
**Job Description**

We are seeking a motivated individual who is passionate about reducing carbon emissions within the built environment through intelligent energy management solutions. This role leverages the ENX‚Ñ¢ Sustainability AI platform, which seamlessly integrates IoT sensors with smart control technologies to:

* Conduct energy measurement and consumption analysis
* Improve the efficiency of ACMV systems, lighting, and plug loads
* Regulate indoor air quality, occupancy, and water systems
* Oversee data centre systems and operational performance
* Generate real-time sustainability KPI dashboards and analytical reports

Designed with a modular framework, the ENX‚Ñ¢ Sustainability AI platform can be deployed as a cloud-enabled Building Management System (BMS) for new construction projects or as an Energy Management System (EMS) for offices and warehouses, enabling smooth compatibility with existing BMS environments. Our customers have achieved energy reductions of up to 40% through the use of our solution.

**ResponsibilitiesOn-Site Project Implementation**

* Study and interpret technical drawings, Bills of Materials (BOM), and Scopes of Work (SOW) developed by the Design Engineering team.
* Organise, coordinate, and execute on-site project activities, including site assessments, subcontractor supervision, and system/device installation and configuration.
* Document project status, findings, and improvement suggestions to support continuous enhancement.
* Conduct technical briefings and hands-on training for clients and end-users on system operation and maintenance.

**Data Analysis & Technical Field Support**

* Analyse and assess data collected from platforms and devices such as Building Management Systems, power meters, BTU meters, Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) sensors, PLCs, and associated equipment.
* Provide on-site troubleshooting, technical support, and maintenance for deployed systems.
* Work closely with the Helpdesk team to identify, investigate, and resolve site-specific technical issues.

**Job Requirements**

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree or above in Building, Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, or Computer Engineering; Computer Science; Electronics; or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience in Engineering or IT, preferably within Building Services or Industrial Automation, with strong hands-on knowledge of automation platforms, PLCs, SCADA, BMS, M&E systems, RTUs, and network infrastructure.
* Strong verbal and interpersonal communication abilities; keen interest in technology; self-directed; well-structured; and detail-focused.
* Willingness to travel to client sites across Singapore and Johor, Malaysia.

**Job Types:**  Full-time, Permanent.
