title: Asset Management - Sustainable Investing and Stewardship, Investment Stewardship Specialist - Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The J.P. Morgan Asset Management (JPMAM) Global Sustainable Investing and Stewardship team is recruiting for an Investment Stewardship Specialist, covering the Asia Pacific ex-Japan region.

As an Associate in the Sustainable Investing and Stewardship Team, you will support the delivery of the annual priorities and long-term objectives of the JPMAM Global Investment Stewardship team by leading and driving regional efforts in corporate engagement, proxy voting and reporting. You will be in a front office environment and will involve regular interaction with our research analysts and portfolio managers across Equities and Fixed Income to coordinate and align engagement activities and voting proxies, as well as engaging with representatives of the companies in which we invest on their sustainability policies and practices.

You will possess a passion for creative and critical thinking about financial markets, and a desire to be part of a fast-growing team. You will report to the Asia Pacific ex-Japan Head of Investment Stewardship.

Job responsibilities:

* Conduct proxy voting and governance research of investee companies, ensuring proper execution of JP Morgan Asset Management‚Äôs Global Proxy Voting Guidelines. Collaborate with investment teams and other stewardship specialists to exercise and document proxy voting, and support voting-related audit programs and compliance reporting.
* Contribute to the firm‚Äôs initiative of enhancing the firm‚Äôs proxy voting process to empower decision-making for investors and investment stewardship teams. Responsibilities include collaborating with internal partners, such as the technology teams; providing expertise on relevant company general meeting research and historical data; ensuring alignment with the firm‚Äôs proxy voting guidelines; and supporting robust reporting capabilities. The initiative also includes enhancing the voting policy screening, enabling investors and stewardship teams to efficiently triage proposals and focus on ballots requiring in-depth analysis and targeted evaluation.
* Compile proxy voting committee and engagement working group presentation materials and minutes, and assist in the preparation of regulatory filings and surveys on stewardship activities.
* Assist client reporting on stewardship activities, including engagement and voting, in collaboration with the wider SI&S teams and JPMAM‚Äôs client servicing teams to ensure client reporting and client presentations meet expectations, and that client queries on our stewardship activities are responded to promptly and to the satisfaction of the client.
* Support corporate engagement (research of investee companies, materials preparation, and coordination with other internal stakeholders), and document engagement meetings.
* Contribute to the ongoing maintenance and development of the firm's stewardship policies, priorities, and the strategies for implementing them each year.
* Build key working relationships across internal constituents from investment teams, business teams, and corporate teams.
* Support the writing and production of our annual investment stewardship report and occasional thought leadership pieces on investment stewardship topics.

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree (finance, economics, law, accounting, public policy, or related field)
* Strong English language skills (written and spoken);
* 3+ years of financial services experience or a background in a relevant specialist organization such as research, consultancy or NGO, best in Asset Management with previous exposure to investment stewardship and financial investment activities; or; high level specialist knowledge of sustainability-related issues
* Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills with an ability to apply sound judgement
* Proven presentation, communication, and influencing skills; strong report writing skills
* Ability to work and drive change effectively in a high volume, rapid pace, deadline-oriented global investment environment
* Team player with strong self-motivation and analytical skills
* Ability and willingness to work with key internal groups ‚Äì portfolio managers, analysts, product specialists, RFP teams, corporate actions teams

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

* Additional language such as Mandarin, Cantonese a plus

**ABOUT US**  
  
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world‚Äôs most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.  

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

  
  
**ABOUT THE TEAM**

J.P. Morgan Asset & Wealth Management delivers industry-leading investment management and private banking solutions. Asset Management provides individuals, advisors and institutions with strategies and expertise that span the full spectrum of asset classes through our global network of investment professionals. Wealth Management helps individuals, families and foundations take a more intentional approach to their wealth or finances to better define, focus and realize their goals.

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**FourTwoThree | Financial & Climate Technology**
-------------------------------------------------

Backed by three of the world‚Äôs largest banks, FourTwoThree is quietly building resilience for an uncertain future.

We connect lenders, large corporates, suppliers and the bedrock of the global economy ‚Äî small and medium-sized businesses ‚Äî through a data-driven platform, strengthened by modern AI, that turns complex financial, operational and climate data into commercially actionable insight at both individual business and portfolio level.

Our work sits at the intersection of financial institutions, enterprise customers, climate and resilience, unlocking new, data-qualified products, services and financing pathways across Asia-Pacific and beyond.

**The Company**
---------------

FourTwoThree is a financial and climate technology company building a platform designed for bank-grade, enterprise-scale use.

We partner closely with financial institutions and large corporates to:

* Improve visibility of risk, resilience and transition exposure across portfolios and supply chains
* Engage SMEs through incentives and commercially aligned, personalised actions
* Enable new classes of institutional products and services grounded in high-quality operational data

Our platform operates in highly complex environments ‚Äî integrating with bank systems, enterprise workflows and external data providers, while navigating evolving regulatory, reporting and climate standards. In this context we use AI to accelerate ingestion and classification, while keeping outputs explainable and audit-ready for institutional use.

We are already working with leading institutions and co-creation partners, and are led by founders with deep experience across banking, enterprise technology and sustainability, operating across global markets.

**The Role**
------------

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Product Manager with strong commercial instincts and deep product craft, who is comfortable operating with large institutional customers and still wants to stay close to the work.

This role is ideal for someone who:

* Has deep hands-on product experience but also spent a good part of their career in commercial/ client facing responsibilities
* Able to easily build relationships with banks, large corporates and senior stakeholders
* Can manage complex integrations and delivery programmes
* Still wants to be on the tools shaping the product, writing stories, working daily with engineers and designers

You will own significant product domains and integration pathways, working directly with institutional customers to translate commercial objectives, operational realities and regulatory constraints into scalable product solutions including helping to shape how we apply AI to reduce manual mapping, improve data quality, and unlock more accurate insights and action pathways for customers.

**What You‚Äôll Be Doing**
------------------------

* Own and drive complex product initiatives from discovery through to delivery and post-launch iteration
* Act as the primary product interface for large institutional customers during integration and rollout
* Translate commercial agreements, customer requirements and regulatory considerations into clear product direction
* Work hands-on with engineering and design to define epics, stories, acceptance criteria and delivery plans
* Lead product thinking across bank integrations, data flows, APIs, AI and broader platform capabilities
* Navigate trade-offs between customer-specific needs and scalable platform design
* Support scalable onboarding of new frameworks, actions and attributes by designing systems where AI accelerates structuring, while product rules ensure consistency and auditability.
* Partner closely with sales and institutional delivery teams to ensure successful customer outcomes
* Use data, feedback and commercial signals to guide prioritisation and roadmap decisions
* Contribute to product strategy, particularly where customer demand, commercial opportunity and platform capability intersect

**What We‚Äôre Looking For**
--------------------------

* 6-10+ years of experience across commercial, customer-facing or delivery roles, with significant time in product management
* Proven experience working with banks, financial institutions or large enterprise customers
* Strong product fundamentals in discovery, problem framing, prioritisation, execution and iteration
* Deep comfort with integration-heavy products (APIs, data pipelines, system constraints, security considerations)
* Ability to reason from first principles, especially in ambiguous, multi-stakeholder environments
* Commercially astute - you understand how product decisions affect revenue, risk and customer relationships
* Confident operating with senior stakeholders while remaining deeply engaged in delivery detail
* Pragmatic, outcome-focused and able to balance speed with institutional-grade quality
* Comfortable working across regions, cultures and time zones

**Bonus Points If You Have**
----------------------------

* Experience in fintech, climate tech, enterprise SaaS or regulated platforms
* Background in banking, consulting, customer delivery or enterprise implementations
* Exposure to climate, ESG, risk, compliance or reporting frameworks
* Experience launching products across APAC or global markets
* Familiarity with complex B2B commercial and partnership models

**Why Join Us**
---------------

* Competitive compensation and meaningful equity
* A senior role with real ownership and a variety of work while playing a significant part in scaling the company overtime
* Direct exposure to major global financial institutions and enterprise customers
* The credibility and backing of large banks, with the autonomy and pace of a focused, high-calibre team
* The opportunity to build products that sit at the centre of finance, climate transition, resilience and real economic impact

If you‚Äôre interested in joining our small and growing team, we'd love to hear from you.

title: TECHNOLOGIST - CHEMLAB
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.**

Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

**Job Description:**

* Work in a clean-room Fab facility and Chemical Laboratory environment
* Follow the Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) to analyze routine samples and report to internal customer
* Use analytical techniques and instrumentation such as chromatography, spectroscopy, titration, particle sizing, volume measurement and weight measurement
* Perform standard and reagent preparation of samples such as vapor phase deposition (VPD), extraction, digestion and series dilution
* Responsible for monitoring and sustaining equipment
* Perform preventative maintenance on assigned tools
* Collaborate with area Chemists to troubleshoot analytical issues and equipment issues
* Participate in Total Preventive Maintenance (TPM) activities, including 6S audit, housekeeping, maintaining stock of reagents, standards, spare parts and consumables
* Keep the Chemistry Laboratory Manager updated on tool and area issues

**Qualifications / Requirements:**

* Diploma in Chemical Engineering/Applied Chemistry/Pharmaceutical Science, Materials Science, Life or Biomedical Science and/or equivalent experience
* Basic knowledge of analytical equipment is preferred, such as Inductively Coupled Plasma/Mass Spectrometer (ICP-MS), Inductively Coupled Plasma/Optical Emission Spectroscopy (ICP-OES)/Titrators/Gas-Liquid Mass Spectroscopy
* Basic to intermediate knowledge of analytical techniques
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
* Ability to troubleshoot basic problems and address root causes
* Possess good teamwork skills and strong multi-tasking capability
* Accept flexible job responsibilities and take initiative to assume added responsibilities
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Must be flexible to work 12 hour shift and rotate day/night shifts as needed
* Software skills including Tableau, Excel VBA, Microsoft Automate tools and/or Python will be preferred.

**About Micron Technology, Inc.**

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions transforming how the world uses information to enrich life *for all*. With a relentless focus on our customers, technology leadership, and manufacturing and operational excellence, Micron delivers a rich portfolio of high-performance DRAM, NAND, and NOR memory and storage products through our Micron¬Æ and Crucial¬Æ brands. Every day, the innovations that our people create fuel the data economy, enabling advances in artificial intelligence and 5G applications that unleash opportunities ‚Äî from the data center to the intelligent edge and across the client and mobile user experience.  
  
To learn more, please visit micron.com/careers  
  
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  
  
To request assistance with the application process and/or for reasonable accommodations, please contact hrsupport\\_sg@micron.com

Micron Prohibits the use of child labor and complies with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and other international and industry labor standards.

Micron does not charge candidates any recruitment fees or unlawfully collect any other payment from candidates as consideration for their employment with Micron.

AI alert: Candidates are encouraged to use AI tools to enhance their resume and/or application materials. However, all information provided must be accurate and reflect the candidate's true skills and experiences. Misuse of AI to fabricate or misrepresent qualifications will result in immediate disqualification.

Fraud alert: Micron advises job seekers to be cautious of unsolicited job offers and to verify the authenticity of any communication claiming to be from Micron by checking the official Micron careers website in the About Micron Technology, Inc.

title: Staff Engineer GFAC South Asia - Chemical
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all.**

Join an inclusive team passionate about one thing: using their expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. The solutions we build help make everything from virtual reality experiences to breakthroughs in neural networks possible. We do it all while committing to integrity, sustainability, and giving back to our communities. Because doing so can fuel the very innovation we are pursuing.

As the Facilities regional chemical engineer, you will be responsible for leading chemical system design for construction projects, providing technical support, expertise, and lead business process alignment on operational and maintenance programs for the facility chemical systems at all front and back end sites. As a global team member residing in your current site/geography, you will represent all regional facility O&M alignment initiatives. You will also lead the design for construction team and incorporate critical operational and maintenance into design for construction projects. You will work with central team on critical metrics, include eliminating production events that minimize lost moves and scrap.

Responsibilities and tasks:

* Expert understanding of each sites bulk and specialty chemical systems operational and maintenance capabilities in order to provide critical support.
* Leading chemical system design for construction projects
* In addition to your global chemical engineering role you will also provide site/regional support for global facility initiatives at your location.
* Technically lead a global cross functional team focused on operational excellence with the site chemical systems engineers.
* Provide support to all sites including on site presence for critical failures.
* Actively involved in TPM implementation and alignment along with ongoing support for chemical systems.
* Drive improvement in the quality of our utilities through variation reduction (SPC).
* Drive the alignment for common methodologies including SPC, conformance, SIPP‚Äôs, MOC and 8D problem solving throughout the network.
* Identify and deploy cost reduction efforts while optimizing and reducing energy usage for Gas systems throughout the network.
* Assess and insure effective and consistent PM and predictive maintenance programs, procedures and checklists across the network.
* Regular communication with the site engineering and O&M teams on status and performance.
* Analyze and benchmark equipment performance.
* Identify and develop training and certification programs that support global and site efforts
* Develop appropriate metrics to drive improvement (On time PM‚Äôs, MTTF, MTTR etc.).
* Send out regular updates with key items of focus and initiatives.  
  You will review FIPA/METS events and provide recommendations to drive the reduction of critical chemical impact events.
* Collaborate with the construction / engineering team to insure alignment on projects.
* Review site sustaining capital requests in collaboration with construction/engineering.
* Support the network effort to implement, monitor and drive continuous improvement for success of Micron‚Äôs Sustainability programs in alignment with the long-term Sustainability strategy.
* Benchmark system performance and drive Best-In-Class approach (BICs) across network.
* Provide technical advice and support to overcome challenges and roadblocks in project planning & execution.
* Support sustainability projects achievement data acquisition and validation in central tracking depository.

Requirements:

* Excellent analytical and good decision making skills.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to communicate effectively at all levels within the organization.
* Excellent teamwork and collaboration with other groups, internally and externally.
* Proven ability to solve problems across multi-functional and multi-cultural groups within and outside facilities.
* Proven ability to multi-task and lead team to meet challenging deadlines and goals.
* Proven ability to continuously improve systems and processes.
* Ability to foster strong relationships from cross-functional and multi-cultural groups.
* Exceptional customer focus.

Education Required

* Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Chemical Engineering or equivalent work experience

Experience required

* 8 years of Facilities Gas system engineering experience with minimum 4 years in semiconductor industry

Experience Desired

* Lead or actively involved in global facility engineering efforts

title: AVP/VP, Relationship Manager - Shipping, Aviation, Logistics & Transport, Institutional Banking Group
description:
Business Function
  
Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards.?
  
Responsibilities
  
  

* Support in driving franchise and industry income and contribute to the team's P&L performance by managing the loan portfolio and account management requirements of SALT clients in Singapore and across DBS geographies.
* Grow portfolio earnings and enhance portfolio ROE through cross-sell of Cash, Trade, Treasury & Markets and Investment Banking (including Equity Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets and Strategic Advisory) products and solutions as follows: (1) Development and execution of strategic account plans for existing client portfolio with product partners, with at least semi-annual reviews, and a focus on: a)
* The Digital agenda - To acquire new cash management mandates & supply chain mandates, working closely with product partners to ensure proper execution of such mandates; and b) The Sustainability agenda - To capture sustainability advisory, loans and capital markets opportunities working closely with Sustainability Team,(2) Identify New-To-Bank client targets and develop/implement acquisition plans.
* To develop and cultivate relationships with accounts that are in the maritime, and shipping related industry
* To build deep industry knowledge and understanding of the changes in the macro and industry trends
* Responsible for driving loan origination and execution while being cognizant of inherent credit issues and related risk mitigations.
* Understand clients‚Äô requirements and risk assessment before proposing viable financing solutions
* Responsible for credit risk monitoring and credit application

Requirements
  
  

* Minimum of 7-10 years relevant corporate banking/credit experience.
* Degree holder in Finance, Economics, or related discipline.
* Good knowledge of financial modelling, cashflow analysis along with strong credit analytical skills.
* Good understanding of the bank‚Äôs suite of products and services.
* Results-oriented, resourceful with good business networking in identifying and developing business opportunities.

Apply Now
  
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

title: CS Strategy and Portfolio Management, Consultant
description:
At AIA we‚Äôve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

*It‚Äôs about finding new ways to not only better people's lives, but to better the communities and environments we live in. We need great Actuaries who want to be part of something bigger than finance alone. Because the better we can nurture our financial wellbeing as an organisation, the better we can support and make a difference for our customers when they need us most. By ensuring our products are well designed and priced, analysing business performance and ensuring proper management of insurance policies in-force, you‚Äôre not just safeguarding AIA‚Äôs financial wellbeing. You‚Äôre securing a better future for the people and communities we serve - today, tomorrow and for generations to come.*

If that interests you, read on.

About the Role

Perform case underwriting and provide actuarial support to Corporate Solutions business with the objective of achieving business VONB and OPAT targets.

Responsibilities:

Actuarial solutions

* Provide portfolio analysis on profitability and pricing retention for management.
* Perform experience studies to support pricing assumptions, VONB assumptions, manual rate review, costing in special terms.
* Perform in-depth claim analysis for jumbo cases for more accurate pricing.

Case Underwriting

* Underwrites group Life, Medical, PA and Credit life cases by analyzing benefits, claim experience, terms & conditions and reinsurance arrangement to ensure sufficient margin has been catered for projected claims, medical trend, variables, expenses and profit margin while maintaining competitiveness of product.
* Reviews benefit scope, terms and conditions of group cases with reference to internal and external rules and guidelines to ensure risk underwriting compliance as well as legal compliance.
* Recommends benefit changes and cost-containment proposals for corporate clients by analyzing benefit coverage, scheme terms & conditions, claims pattern, medical trends, portfolio data, industry data as well as employee benefit design trends.
* Works with Sales team to identify employee benefit gaps and develop benefit solutions for corporate clients. Provides explanation of rationale by preparation of tailor-made claim analysis reports in order to support Sales team‚Äôs communication and presentation to corporate clients
* Works with Operations, IT and Network team to develop customer-centric benefit solutions which are operational viable.
* Gathers claim data, prepares benefit analysis and works out group cases premium projections and terms recommendations for cases exceeding local authority for higher authority review and approval.

Projects & Reports

* Participates in projects relating to actuarial solutions.
* Identify improvement areas to gain efficiency in underwriting while maintaining the professional standard.
* Prepares regular and ad hoc underwriting reports as required.

Reinsurance arrangement

* Contacts with reinsurers for facultative reinsurance arrangement to support special quotes with non-standard benefits and terms.
* Recommends enhancement of benefits and terms for corporate clients and works with reinsurer on benefit enhancements.
* Preparation of reinsurance documents such as Reinsurance Contract, Pricing Form and Wording form.
* Maintenance of reinsurance contracts, endorsements & cover notes.

Requirements:

* University / College graduate of Actuarial Science (or equivalent) plus over 6 years related working experience.
* Communication & interpersonal skills.
* Commitment to teamwork.
* Attention to details.
* You are required to obtain relevant license if your job involves in regulated activities

*Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

*You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.*

title: Associate Director, Channel Proposition & Product Strategy
description:
At AIA we‚Äôve started an exciting movement to create a healthier, more sustainable future for everyone.

*It‚Äôs about finding new ways to not only better people's lives, but to better the communities and environments we live in. Encompassing our ambition of helping a billion people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives by 2030.*

*And as part of our marketing, distribution & partnership team, you‚Äôll play a vital part in advancing this movement. From inspiring meaningful connections with customers, partners and other stakeholders, to delivering purpose-led brand positioning and messaging, you'll be making a positive, healthy impact across all channels. You will have a unique and important part to play in helping more people live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

So if you believe in inspiring a better future, read on.

About the Role

Lead and formulate the overall PD customer and proposition strategy with both internal teams and external partners, while driving channel-based product strategy and managing segment proposition initiatives to deepen business penetration in bank and broker channels.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Channel & Segment Proposition

* Develop channel proposition strategy and oversee implementation of product, segment and marketing campaigns to enable business growth
* Maximize data analytics to identify target customer segments and business potentials
* Develop segment strategies and propositions initiatives p across channels to drive business goals
* Provide ad hoc support in projects and initiatives as assigned

Product Strategy & Development

* Drive product ideation, design, launch, and optimization of products to meet business needs
* Monitor and analyze the product performance so as to provide strategic product recommendation for business growth and improvement
* Drive internal functions (Pricing, Proposition, Actuarial, Customer, Operations, Marketing, IT etc.) to ensure effective product design and development
* Design and lead implementation of an effective product compensation scheme for various channels to drive desired sales behaviours
* Manage development of effective customer campaigns with performance monitoring and analysis
* Collaborate closely with Business Channels and Proposition for up-to-date market offering analysis to facilitate necessary business actions and strategic planning
* Ensure the sales teams have the necessary product knowledge and training tools to engage customers effectively

Minimum Job Requirements:

* Degree holder, preferably major in Business Management / Marketing / Finance / Economics / related field
* Minimum 10 years on business development, product development and sales management in insurance or banking industry, experience in Partnership Distribution model is an added advantage
* Good understanding of insurance product knowledge
* Strong business acumen, good problem-solving and project management skills
* Strong influencing and stakeholder management skill
* Team management experience with good leadership skills is preferred
* Effective time management, negotiation and influencing skills
* Good analytical skills and attentive to details
* Good written and spoken English and Chinese
* Self-motivated and able to work under pressure
* Literacy in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint

Others:

* You are required to obtain the relevant license(s) if your job involves regulated activities

*Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live Healthier, Longer, Better Lives.*

*You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.*

title: Investment Product Specialist, Equities & Multi-Asset
description:
‚ÄúI can be myself at work.‚Äù

You are more than a job title. We want you to feel comfortable doing great work and bringing your best, authentic self to everything you do. We value your talents, traditions, and uniqueness‚Äîand we‚Äôre committed to fostering a strong sense of belonging in a respectful workplace.

We intentionally seek diverse perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds, investing in a culture designed to celebrate differences. We believe that belonging leads to better outcomes and a stronger community of associates united by our mission. At Capital, we live our core values every day: Integrity, Client Focus, Diverse Perspectives, Long-Term Thinking, and Community.

‚ÄúI can influence my income.‚Äù

You want to feel recognized at work. Your performance will be reviewed annually, and your compensation will be designed to motivate and reward the value that you provide. You‚Äôll receive a competitive salary, bonuses and benefits. Your company-funded retirement contribution will factor in salary and variable pay, including bonuses.

‚ÄúI can lead a full life.‚Äù

You bring unique goals and interests to your job and your life. Whether you‚Äôre raising a family, you‚Äôre passionate about where you volunteer, or you want to explore different career paths, we‚Äôll give you the resources that can set you up for success.

* Enjoy generous time-away and health benefits from day one, with the opportunity for flexible work options
* Receive 2-for-1 matching gifts for your charitable contributions and the opportunity to secure annual grants for the organizations you love
* Access on-demand professional development resources that allow you to hone existing skills and learn new ones

‚ÄúI can succeed as an Investment Product Specialist at Capital Group‚Äù

Overview

The Investment Product Specialist (IPS) team is part of the Asset Class Services (ACS) team within Capital Group‚Äôs (CG) Europe and Asia business. IPS partners with the team of Investment Directors (ID) to deliver deep expertise on CG‚Äôs investment strategies both internally and externally. Collectively they are the voice of CG‚Äôs investment strategies. The IPS and ID teams are two sides of the same coin: the ID is focused on being the external voice; and the IPS is focused on internal partners and stakeholders. The IPS also plays an important role in thinking strategically about the growth and evolution of their product coverage, partnering closely with Client and Marketing teams to unlock additional growth opportunities.

The individual will play a significant role in representing our range of global Equities & Multi-Asset (EQMA) products and investment teams. The individual will need to be able to quickly develop a deep understanding of Capital Group‚Äôs EQMA range, investment approach, and an ability to synthesise information to enable CG associates to speak credibly to its strengths. In addition, they will partner with the ID team on strategy positioning and to generate investment insights to drive the business and support client engagement.

Primary Responsibilities

* Partners closely with the EQMA ID and investment teams to support EQMA product coverage. Develops deep expertise in investment ideas, strategy and portfolio positioning, with a strong capability in Multi-Asset product coverage.
* Drives investment content and narrative to support client engagement and the ID team in delivering portfolio and market insights as well as subject matter expertise at client meetings, conferences and other external engagements.
* Partners closely with and provide local support to EQMA IPS lead, to drive broader strategic work as well as deliver high-quality reports for senior management to inform decision-making and enhance business outcomes.
* Develops key messages to position and differentiate Capital Group‚Äôs EQMA capabilities and solutions, supporting client engagement while tailoring for regional and segment-specific needs as appropriate.
* Engages with sales teams to address client queries promptly, collaborating and coordinating with internal distribution and operations teams to ensure accurate and timely responses.
* Contributes to the analysis of market trends and competitive dynamics to understand investor requirements and how it impacts Capital Group‚Äôs EQMA offerings.
* Partners with IDs, sales, marketing, and other stakeholders to align on sales strategy, marketing approach, and client requirements.
* Be a strong advocate for Capital Group‚Äôs equity offerings, shaping overall product strategy, including new product development and rollout initiatives. Assist in driving product business planning and supporting broader strategic initiatives for the asset class.
* Builds collaborative relationships with key internal stakeholders across Europe, Asia, and North America by understanding their priorities and demonstrating the value of partnership to achieve shared goals.
* Contributes to broader thought leadership to drive more proactive external engagement across Europe & Asia Client Group (EACG), maintaining asset class alignment and positioning Capital Group as a trusted partner and industry thought leader.

‚ÄúI am the person Capital Group is looking for‚Äù

* Ideally at least 4 ‚Äì 7 years within the asset management industry, with exposure to an investment team environment and/or as a markets/product specialist delivering portfolio and investment insights
* You have a robust understanding of equity and fixed income markets and a range of equity & multi-asset strategies.
* You are self-motivated and proactive, and demonstrate strong intellectual curiosity, analytical and problem-solving skills.
* You bring a strong commercial mindset to craft positioning messages tailored to target audiences, with a proven ability to drive impactful results.
* You demonstrate strong communication and stakeholder management skills, to engage with a variety of internal and external audiences
* You are organised and detail-orientated, committed to delivering accurate investment insights and content in a responsive and timely manner
* You are highly collaborative and are comfortable partnering with multiple teams across time zones to deliver outcomes
* You have experience in interacting with and extracting information from markets data tools and platforms, such as Refinitiv or Bloomberg as well as Morningstar

‚ÄúI can apply in less than 4 minutes.‚Äù

You‚Äôve reviewed this job posting and you‚Äôre ready to start the candidate journey with us. Apply now to move to the next step in our recruiting process. If this role isn‚Äôt what you‚Äôre looking for, check out our other opportunities and join our talent community.

‚ÄúI can learn more about Capital Group.‚Äù

At Capital Group, the success of the people who invest with us depends on the people in whom we invest. That‚Äôs why we offer a culture, compensation and opportunities that empower our associates to build successful and prosperous careers. Through nine decades, our goal has been to improve people‚Äôs lives through successful investing. We know that our history is a testament to the strength of the people we hire. More than 9,000 associates in 30+ offices around the world help our clients and each other grow and thrive every day. Find us on LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube and Glassdoor.

*In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital‚Äôs annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.*

*You can learn more about our compensation and benefits* 

*here*

*.*

* *Temporary positions in the United States are excluded from the above mentioned compensation and benefit plans.*

*We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.*

title: Technical Manager, Ropeway
description:
Responsibilities

The incumbent will be the operations duty-in-charge of the cable car. He/she is accountable for taking up the duties and responsibilities to ensure safe operations of the system. He/she will plan resources/budget allocation, devise maintenance plan to ensure maintenance worked are carried out in the order of priority and within allocated budget. He/she will manage and supervise the cable car maintenance staff and assisted them to have required skill sets, knowledge, training and tools to handle urgent system issues and operate all emergency backup systems. He/ she will manage the cable car workshop to ensure day-to-day routines and activities are carried out smoothly and legitimately, manage cable car spare parts store to ensure sufficient amounts of parts are kept to support the equipment repair and maintenance activities and coordinate with other departments and/or outside contractors for cable car related projects to ensure the work completes on-time and within budget without affecting normal cable car operations. Besides, he/she will act as duty-in-charge of cable car vertical rescue drill and implement proper executive of the exercise and to prepare reports on electrical inspection set out by EMSD.

Requirements

* Degree in Engineering or higher diploma with substantial experience
* At least 10 years relevant working experience in which 5 years in supervisory level
* Competent person of Cable Car
* Holder of certificate of registration of Electrical Worker (Grad B0 or above)
* Conversant with good engineering practice and maintenance of cable car system
* Good command of both spoken and written English and Chinese
* Knowledge of PLC with fibre control network would be an advantage.
* People with less experience & qualification will be consider as Assistant Ropeway Manager

title: Graduate Sustainability Consultant (2026)
description:
Sustainability

Asia Pacific Region

HON0003I7

**See it differently**  
You see the world through a unique lens and that‚Äôs exactly what we need. We embrace how you see things differently ‚Äì it‚Äôs essential for creating a sustainable future.

Arup is a global consultancy with advisory and technical expertise across more than 150 disciplines. We guide, plan and design the future of the built environment. Globally, each year we recruit hundreds of graduates to help us see things differently and solve the most complex challenges facing our clients, climate and communities.

**The Opportunity**  
A career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world.

Independently owned and independently minded, Arup is the creative force at the heart of many of the world's most prominent projects in the built environment. When you join Arup, you immediately become part of our global community working on some of the world's most recognised projects.

Our graduate experience offers you:

* Purpose-driven work: Join an employee-owned team tackling climate, biodiversity, and social challenges, aligned with the UN‚Äôs Sustainable Development Goals.
* Create remarkable outcomes: We trust you to explore challenges, drive change, and create lasting outcomes for our clients, climate and communities.
* Inclusive culture: Your unique perspective matters. We celebrate diversity and foster a supportive, social environment where everyone belongs.
* Career growth: Grow your skills through innovative projects, training, and mentoring in a supportive environment. We invest in your future.
* Work-life balance: Our hybrid model offers flexibility to balance work with your life. We balance your needs with our clients and communities.

**Is this role right for you?**  
We‚Äôre looking for:

**Changemakers**: A passion for sustainable development and creating a better world is key.  
**Innovative minds**: We‚Äôre looking for critical thinkers who embrace new ideas and challenge the status quo.  
**Growth seekers**: You have a growth mindset, always eager to learn and explore new ways of working.  
**Adaptable adventurers**: You‚Äôre ready to take on any challenge that comes your way.

**Eligibility:**  
To be considered for a 2026 Graduate opportunity your application must include a copy of your academic transcript, be submitted in English and meet the following criteria:

* Full working rights in the country of application
* No more than 12 months of full-time experience in a comparable role
* Recently graduated, or on track to graduate, from your most recent degree before employment starts

Please note, in the event of high applicant volume, this role may be closed ahead of the advertised closing date. Early application is recommended.

**What we offer you**  
Guided by our values, we provide a fair and equitable total reward package and offer a career in which all our members can belong, grow and thrive through benefits that support health and wellbeing, a wide range of learning opportunities and many possibilities to have an impact through the work they do.

Additionally, you'll have the opportunity to utilise your technical expertise to do meaningful work that strengthens the resilience of communities and places to improve lives through Arup's community engagement programme.

**Different people, shared values**  
At Arup we are an equal opportunity employer, and we accept people for who they are ‚Äì we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds regardless of age, gender identity and expression, marital status, disability, neurodiversity and mental health, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation, socioeconomic background, and whether you‚Äôre pregnant or on family leave. Your difference belongs here. We are an open environment that embraces diverse experiences, perspectives, and ideas ‚Äì this drives our excellence.

Guided by our values and alignment with the UN Sustainable Development Goals, we create and contribute to equitable spaces and systems, while cultivating a sense of belonging for all. Our internal employee networks support our inclusive culture ‚Äì we aim to create a space for you to express yourself and make a positive difference. Discover more about life at Arup at www.arup.com/careers/your-life-at-arup.

At Arup, we are committed to making all stages of our recruitment process accessible to all candidates. Please contact *APACEarlyCareers@arup.com* to let us know if you need any assistance or reasonable adjustments throughout your application and we will do everything we possibly can to support you.

*Arup does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.*

title: Project Intern, Sustainability Strategy (Policy and Research) - Jul to Dec 2026
description:
Temasek is a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, with a net portfolio value of S$434 billion (US$324 billion, ‚Ç¨299 billion, ¬£250 billion, and RMB2.35 trillion) as at 31 March 2025. Marking our unlisted assets to market would provide S$35 billion of value uplift and bring our mark to market net portfolio value to S$469 billion.

  

Our Purpose ‚ÄúSo Every Generation Prospers‚Äù guides us to make a difference for today‚Äôs and future generations.

  

Operating on commercial principles, we seek to deliver sustainable returns over the long term.

  

We have 13 offices in 9 countries around the world: Beijing, Hanoi, Mumbai, Shanghai, Shenzhen, and Singapore in Asia; and Brussels, London, Mexico City, New York, Paris, San Francisco, and Washington, DC outside Asia.

  

For more information on Temasek, please visit www.temasek.com.sg.  
For Temasek Review 2025, please visit www.temasekreview.com.sg.  
For Sustainability Report 2025, please visit https://www.temasek.com.sg/content/dam/temasek-corporate/sustainability/2025/Temasek-Sustainability-Report-2025.pdf.

###### **SUSTAINABILITY GROUP**

At Temasek, sustainability is at the core of everything we do ‚Äì from our mandate to deliver sustainable value over the long term, to our strategy of how we operate as an institution, shape over portfolio, and engage our portfolio companies to build sustainable businesses.

In partnership with various teams across Temasek and our broader ecosystem, the Sustainability Group initiates, develops and implements strategies to build a climate-resilient, net zero portfolio to enable nature positive and inclusive growth; catalyses new business opportunities and solutions that contribute to sustainable development; advances thought leadership and engagement on sustainability topics; and supports our growth as a sustainable organisation to create shared value aligned with our mandate of generating sustainable returns over the long term.

The Sustainability Group comprises of the following sub-teams and partners with the investment group and functional teams to strengthen our sustainability capabilities and ecosystem.

* Sustainability Strategy: advance our strategy and policy towards net zero, nature positive, and inclusive growth and drive institutional and community-related sustainability initiatives.
* Sustainable Solutions: drive decarbonisation in portfolio companies and unlock new investment opportunities in Sustainable Living trends by identifying emerging thematics and catalysing innovative solutions
* ESG Investment Management: advance ESG integration across our investment process including portfolio engagement to help strengthen long-term portfolio resiliency and value creation
* Ecosperity: accelerate systems-change by harnessing our Ecosperity platform to drive year-round engagements, thought leadership, and advocacy

**SUSTAINABILITY STRATEGY**
---------------------------

Within the Sustainability Group, the Sustainability Strategy team is responsible for setting Temasek‚Äôs strategy in driving total impact across the institution, portfolio and ecosystem. This involves:

* Advancing strategy and policy towards net zero, nature positive and inclusive growth;

* Understanding and keeping abreast with the broader sustainability context, evolving regulatory and market expectations, as well as resulting implications for Temasek as an investor;

* Partnering internal functional teams to advance our sustainability practices as a firm, and raising awareness of sustainability issues through our staff engagement activities; and

* Engaging our portfolio companies on top-of-mind sustainability topics to build capacity and resiliency.

**Roles and Responsibilities**
------------------------------

* Support horizon scanning, research and analysis of global sustainability policies, regulations, frameworks, and market trends, including assisting in peer benchmarking to identify cross-thematic risks, opportunities, and implications. These will contribute towards materials that inform institutional and portfolio‚Äëlevel sustainability strategy discussions.
* Assist in developing and maintaining policy foresight tools such as AI tools and dashboards
* Support the preparation of executive-ready briefing materials, e.g., slide decks and short notes, to inform strategic reviews and decision-making.
* Support Temasek‚Äôs participation in selected global networks and coalitions through background research, preparation of meeting briefs and note‚Äëtaking.
* Support project leads in internal capability building programmes, integrating policy insights into management training, board insights, and advisory panel programmes.
* Help curate case studies, examples and reference materials that bring policy insights to life for internal stakeholders.

###### **Qualifications / Requirements**

* Pursuing a degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, Public Policy, or a related discipline preferred.
* Genuine passion for sustainability, environmental and social issues, demonstrated through coursework, internships, projects or volunteer experiences
* Critical thinking and strong analytical skills
* Ability to work with sustainability data and metrics
* Familiarity and comfort with using GenAI tools
* Good communicator in both written and oral communication, with an eye for detail
* Adaptability and eagerness to learn and thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment

###### **Application Requirements**

* Interested candidates must submit both a cover letter and resume/CV
* 1-page cover letter should indicate clearly motivation in applying, how past experience applies, as well as candidate‚Äôs availability (start and end date)
* Resume/CV submitted may be no longer than 2 pages. 1 page is preferred.
* Where required, candidates will be given a short case study to complete as part of the application process.

title: Project Intern, ESG Investment Management (Jul to Dec 2026)
description:
Temasek is a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, with a net portfolio value of S$434 billion (US$324 billion, ‚Ç¨299 billion, ¬£250 billion, and RMB2.35 trillion) as at 31 March 2025. Marking our unlisted assets to market would provide S$35 billion of value uplift and bring our mark to market net portfolio value to S$469 billion.

  

Our Purpose ‚ÄúSo Every Generation Prospers‚Äù guides us to make a difference for today‚Äôs and future generations.

  

Operating on commercial principles, we seek to deliver sustainable returns over the long term.

  

We have 13 offices in 9 countries around the world: Beijing, Hanoi, Mumbai, Shanghai, Shenzhen, and Singapore in Asia; and Brussels, London, Mexico City, New York, Paris, San Francisco, and Washington, DC outside Asia.

  

For more information on Temasek, please visit www.temasek.com.sg.  
For Temasek Review 2025, please visit www.temasekreview.com.sg.  
For Sustainability Report 2025, please visit https://www.temasek.com.sg/content/dam/temasek-corporate/sustainability/2025/Temasek-Sustainability-Report-2025.pdf.

###### **SUSTAINABILITY GROUP**

At Temasek, sustainability is at the core of everything we do ‚Äì from our mandate to deliver sustainable value over the long term, to our strategy of how we operate as an institution, shape over portfolio, and engage our portfolio companies to build sustainable businesses.

In partnership with various teams across Temasek and our broader ecosystem, the Sustainability Group initiates, develops and implements strategies to build a climate-resilient, net zero portfolio to enable nature positive and inclusive growth; catalyses new business opportunities and solutions that contribute to sustainable development; advances thought leadership and engagement on sustainability topics; and supports our growth as a sustainable organisation to create shared value aligned with our mandate of generating sustainable returns over the long term.

The Sustainability Group comprises the following sub-teams, and partners with the investment group and functional teams to strengthen our sustainability capabilities and ecosystem.

* Sustainability Strategy: advance our strategy and policy towards net zero, nature positive, and inclusive growth and drive institutional and community-related sustainability initiatives
* Sustainable Solutions: drive decarbonisation in portfolio companies and unlock new investment opportunities in Sustainable Living trends by identifying emerging thematics and catalysing innovative solutions
* ESG Investment Management (ESG IM): advance ESG integration across our investment process including portfolio engagement to help strengthen long-term portfolio resiliency and value creation
* Ecosperity: accelerate systems-change by harnessing our Ecosperity platform to drive year-round engagements, thought leadership, and advocacy

###### **Introduction:**

ESG IM partners closely with our global investment teams and portfolio companies to advance ESG practices and sustainable outcomes, directly contributing to Temasek‚Äôs efforts in building a resilient and forward-looking portfolio. This involves:

* In-depth pre-investment due diligence of investment targets to manage ESG risks and identify opportunities for sustainability leadership
* Driving climate transition strategy and progress towards our portfolio 2030 and 2050 emissions reduction goals
* Post-investment engagement with portfolio companies to drive value creation, by providing strategic guidance, reviewing targets and facilitating knowledge exchange
* Developing thematic and sectoral frameworks as part of institutional capability building
* Leveraging ESG data and analytics for portfolio assessment and monitoring to improve resiliency

###### **Job Description:**

* Perform in-depth ESG research to support (1) ESG due diligence on new investment targets, (2) the development / enhancement of internal frameworks and (3) the building of institutional knowledge on the evolving ESG landscape
* Evaluate portfolio companies' sustainability performance by assessing their overall ESG maturity, climate transition readiness, practices on other material topics, and exploring opportunities for ESG value creation
* Contribute to Temasek's climate leadership by analysing carbon emissions performance and trends for Temasek and our portfolio
* Support the development and maintenance of critical dashboards and tools
* Provide flexible support on emerging priorities and ad-hoc projects as needed

**Qualifications/ Capabilities:**
---------------------------------

* Pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree
* Prior experience in ESG and sustainability is preferred but not a must
* Passionate about ESG and sustainability with a strong willingness to learn
* Excellent analytical, data, and communication skills
* Ability to navigate and coordinate across diverse stakeholders, with strong people skills
* Demonstrate understanding of the linkages between ESG and a company‚Äôs business model and operations.

**Application Requirements:**
-----------------------------

* Candidates must submit a resume / CV as well as a short statement (one to two paragraphs) describing their interest and motivation in working with the ESG Investment Management team.

description:
Temasek is a global investment company headquartered in Singapore, with a net portfolio value of S$434 billion (US$324 billion, ‚Ç¨299 billion, ¬£250 billion, and RMB2.35 trillion) as at 31 March 2025. ###### **SUSTAINABILITY GROUP**

At Temasek, sustainability is at the core of everything we do ‚Äì from our mandate to deliver sustainable value over the long term, to our strategy of how we operate as an institution, shape over portfolio, and engage our portfolio companies to build sustainable businesses.

In partnership with various teams across Temasek and our broader ecosystem, the Sustainability Group initiates, develops and implements strategies to build a climate-resilient, net zero portfolio to enable nature positive and inclusive growth; catalyses new business opportunities and solutions that contribute to sustainable development; advances thought leadership and engagement on sustainability topics; and supports our growth as a sustainable organisation to create shared value aligned with our mandate of generating sustainable returns over the long term.

The Sustainability Group comprises of the following sub-teams and partners with the investment group and functional teams to strengthen our sustainability capabilities and ecosystem.

* Sustainability Strategy: advance our strategy and policy towards net zero, nature positive, and inclusive growth and drive institutional and community-related sustainability initiatives.
* Sustainable Solutions: drive decarbonisation in portfolio companies and unlock new investment opportunities in Sustainable Living trends by identifying emerging thematics and catalysing innovative solutions
* ESG Investment Management: advance ESG integration across our investment process including portfolio engagement to help strengthen long-term portfolio resiliency and value creation
* Ecosperity: accelerate systems-change by harnessing our Ecosperity platform to drive year-round engagements, thought leadership, and advocacy

###### **Introduction**

Sustainable Solutions: drive sustainability in portfolio companies (including decarbonisation and water consumption) and unlock new opportunities in Sustainable Living trends by identifying emerging thematics and catalysing innovative solutions  
  
This involves:

* Catalysing decarbonisation solutions that will accelerate the decarbonisation of Temasek‚Äôs portfolio in alignment with Temasek 2030 and 2050 portfolio decarbonisation targets, and
* Focusing on technology sectors that have an outsize impact on Temasek‚Äôs total portfolio emissions, including low-carbon energy solutions ‚Äì such as hydrogen, fusion and fission energy, and advanced geothermal energy ‚Äì advanced biofuels and e-fuels for applications in maritime and aviation, electrification of heavy industry, data centres and cooling efficiency improvements, and water solutions.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

The Sustainable Solutions team seeks interns that are highly passionate about decarbonization, knowledgeable about clean energy and water technologies and/or markets and driven by a strong work ethic. Successful candidates will support this small, nimble team in a variety of job functions and can expect to gain exposure to cutting edge technology development while working with a global set of stakeholders. Responsibilities include:

* Support the team to catalyse solutions to decarbonise the Temasek portfolio in multiple clean energy and water sectors, including deploying capital and solutions. Solutions will largely focus on technology innovation, but may also include ecosystem enabling initiatives, and/or policy and regulation proposals.
* Research and analyse new technology areas focusing on decarbonisation trends, policy and regulatory developments, market and commercial drivers to distil actionable insights for the wider Temasek Ecosystem
* Engage team stakeholders to validate problem statements (as needed)

###### **Requirements**

* Pursuing a degree in science, engineering, business, and finance are highly preferred. Advanced degree candidates are welcome to apply as well
* Knowledgeable about clean energy and water technologies and/or markets, driven by a strong work ethic
* Some familiarity with technoeconomic modelling and financial modelling will be advantageous
* Ability to navigate and coordinate across diverse stakeholders, with strong people skills
* Creative, forward-looking, organised, with good attention to detail, and results-oriented
* Good communicator in both written and oral communication
* Passionate about creating positive, sustainable climate impact

**Application Requirements**
----------------------------

* 1-page cover letter should clearly indicate candidate‚Äôs availability (start and end date). Cover letter must also address the following questions:

* + Why do you want to work in the Sustainability Group at Temasek?
  + How will your existing experience support you in your role here?

title: Senior Manager / Associate Director of Quality Assurance & Service Excellence, Training and Quality Assurance
description:
Manulife is a leading international financial services provider, helping people make decisions easier and lives better. Help shape the future you want to see ‚Äî and discover that better can take you anywhere you want to go.

**Position Responsibilities:**

1. Training Strategy & Program Design and Delivery

* Build a training curriculum for Contact Centre staff, aligned to service standards, customer expectations, and channel behaviors and delivery classroom/virtual training
* Develop learning pathways with clear proficiency milestones
* Integrate QA findings and voice of customer insights into content design to address real performance gaps.

2. Quality Assurance (QA) & Consistency

* Define and maintain soft-skill standards and marking scheme; collaborate with QA to embed them into scorecards and calibration routines.
* Translate QA findings into targeted training sprints and refreshers.
* Create tools and job aids (e.g., phrasing guides, objection-handling matrices, escalation pathways) to drive consistency.

3. Coaching & Mentoring

* Establish a coaching framework and provide one-on-one or small group coaching for Contact Centre staff
* Model best-in-class soft skills‚Äîactive listening, de-escalation, empathy mapping, concise communication, and solution framing.
* Act as a subject matter expert and mentor for Contact Centre team leaders/staff to reinforce soft-skill development

4. Measurement & Reporting

* Develop KPIs to measure training & QA impact on customer satisfaction and service quality.
* Establish KPIs linking training to business outcomes: tNPS, complaint rates, first-contact resolution (FCR), repeat contact, AHT/efficiency balanced with quality, QA soft-skill scores.
* Track participation, certification, post-training assessments, and behavior change.
* Produce regular dashboards for leadership with insights driving from training and QA outcome, analysis trends, identify improvement areas and prioritize recommendations.

5. Stakeholder Partnership & Enablement

* Partner with Contact Centre Team Leads to identify skill gaps and training priorities.
* Work closely with leadership to align training initiatives with strategic objectives and customer experience goals.

6. Innovation & Expansion

* Explore new training technologies and methodologies (e.g., e-learning, microlearning).
* Drive initiatives to expand soft-skill training beyond all Contact Centre staff, ensuring scalability and sustainability.

7. Compliance & Standards

* Ensure all training programs comply with internal policies and industry standards.
* Maintain accurate training records and documentation for audit and compliance purposes.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Communications, or related field; professional certification in Learning & Development (L&D), coaching, or CX is a plus.
* 8+ years in customer service, L&D, CX, QA, or operations, with at least 5+ years designing and delivering soft-skill training at scale.
* Demonstrated success linking training to measurable service outcomes (e.g. tNPS), QA uplift, and complaint reduction.
* Related experience in omnichannel service (voice, chat, email, social) and coaching frameworks in Customer Services of Insurance Industry is preferable.
* Language: Fluent in Cantonese and English; Mandarin an advantage

***When you join our team:***

* We‚Äôll empower you to learn and grow the career you want.
* We‚Äôll recognize and support you in a flexible environment where well-being and inclusion are more than just words.
* As part of our global team, we‚Äôll support you in shaping the future you want to see.

title: Impact Investment and Startup Intern (SG)
description:
About Wu Song Capital

Wu Song Capital is a private investment office that backs promising startups across Asia, blending venture capital with hands-on incubation. In addition to working with startups, we are actively involved in mergers and acquisitions, identifying and structuring strategic deals that drive long-term growth.

Unlike traditional finance roles, our work is fast-paced, immersive, and deeply entrepreneurial. This internship provides exposure to both the investment and operational aspects of building businesses. Interns will work directly with our founder a rare opportunity that comes with high expectations and a steep learning curve.


The Role: More Than Just Finance

As an Impact Investment & Startup Intern, you will be at the frontlines of sourcing and evaluating deals while also gaining firsthand exposure to business operations. This role extends beyond financial analysis; you will actively engage with entrepreneurs, assess market opportunities, and contribute to investment decisions.

We believe that the best investors do not just analyse businesses‚Äîthey build them. That is why interns are required to spend time working on weekends at our founder‚Äôs children‚Äôs charity. This hands-on experience provides a deeper understanding of social impact, an essential consideration in investment strategy.

This role is not confined to an office setting. While interns will work remotely from Singapore, they should be prepared to travel across Asia when opportunities arise. Exposure to different startup ecosystems is an integral part of this internship.


Key Responsibilities

  • Market Research & Due Diligence ‚Äì Analyse industries, review business models, and assess financials to identify viable investment opportunities
  • Scouting & Sourcing ‚Äì Identify high-potential startups and M&A opportunities, conduct outreach, and build relationships with founders
  • Investment Process Support ‚Äì Assist in preparing investment memos, presentations, and internal reports for decision-making
  • Travel & Startup Immersion ‚Äì Work remotely while based in Singapore, with opportunities for travel across Asia for market research and business engagements
  • Hands-On Teaching ‚Äì Participate in our founder‚Äôs children‚Äôs charity on weekends to gain direct exposure to social impact


Who We Are Looking For

This is not a typical finance internship. We seek individuals who are:

Entrepreneurial & Resourceful ‚Äì Passionate about startups, able to take initiative, and comfortable working in unstructured environments

  • Impact-Driven ‚Äì Willing to engage with social initiatives and understand the broader implications of investments
  • Finance-Savvy ‚Äì A background in finance, economics, or business is essential. Prior experience in VC, PE, IB, or consulting is a plus
  • Adaptable & Independent ‚Äì Comfortable working remotely and prepared to travel when necessary
  • Resilient & Hardworking ‚Äì Able to work directly with our founder, meeting high expectations and navigating a demanding learning environment


Internship Details

  • Minimum Commitment: 5 months
  • Internship Period: 16 February 2026 - 16 August 2026
  • Compensation: SGD 800/mo
  • Location: Remote-first (Singapore) + Regional Travel Opportunities
  • Work Expectation: Standard weekdays (3 days) + mandatory weekend work at our founder‚Äôs children‚Äôs charity (2 days)


Application Process

Interested candidates should submit a resume and a brief cover letter addressing the following:

  1. What excites you about impact investing and startups?
  2. What entrepreneurial experience do you have?
  3. Why do you want to work at Wu Song Capital?
  4. What unique skills or experience set you apart from other candidates?
  5. Are you comfortable working remotely, volunteering on weekends, and traveling?
  6. What is your commitment period?
  7. Are you Singaporean or PR? If not, what pass are you on?
  8. What languages are you fluent in?

Shortlisted candidates will receive a case study; those who pass the case study will move on to the interview stage (online).


Due to a high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted (careers@wusongcapital.com) to complete a case study prior to the interview.

Are you a master of craft? Do you thrive in a team that succeeds together, demonstrating integrity and respect while acting responsibly? Do you embrace a growth mindset? We invite you to become a fan of the exceptional.

Mandarin Oriental is the award-winning owner and operator of some of the most luxurious hotels, resorts and residences located in prime destinations around the world, with a strong development pipeline. Increasingly recognised for creating some of the world‚Äôs most sought-after properties, the Group provides legendary service inspired by Asian heritage whilst representing the very cutting-edge of luxury experiences.

The Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong is one of the world‚Äôs great luxury hotels ‚Äî a masterpiece of contemporary design and a cutting-edge, chic five-star gem in the epicentre of one of the most exciting cities in Asia. Only one of the 13 hotels worldwide with Triple Five-Stars across all three categories for hotel, spa and restaurant in Forbes Travel Guide, the Landmark Mandarin Oriental offers state-of-the-art designer guestrooms and suites, and award-winning, innovative Food & Beverage outlets and Spa facilities for the ultimate in relaxation and fitness. With a reputation for unmatched personal service and integrity, we take pride in providing professional training to enrich your experience and skills, as well as the best opportunities for career advancement to the right candidate. The hotel is highly respected as a global pioneer in eco-friendly sustainability and luxury, values integral to the Mandarin Oriental Group.

**About the job**

Based at The Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong within Pastry Kitchen in Hong Kong, the Executive Pastry Chef is responsible for supervision and coordination of the preparation and production of all pastries, chocolates as well as bakery items according to the highest standards, menu planning and cost control. The Executive Pastry Chef reports to Director of Culinary Operation and Food & Beverage.

**As Executive Pastry Chef, you will be responsible for the following duties:**

* Be responsible for the daily basic food preparation in Pastry and for delegating different sections to the Pastry Sous Chef and team
* Work closely with the Chef de Cuisine and other senior managers of the hotel on new concepts and ideas, including conceptualizing spaces or venues and assist in Financial projections as needed
* Maintain good hygiene and cleanliness standards by closely working with Stewarding team and monitoring all HACCP related issues within the department
* Ensure the par stock of mise-en-place is maintained and monitor the par stock of packaging and food items
* Be responsible for the logistics of all food items for festive and special food promotions
* Be responsible and accountable for the departmental operating budget
* Maximize and increase sales and/or yield in revenue centre and improve the efficiency of the operations
* Propose and initiate new services and products for our guests, issue recipe cards and conduct spot check of end products for quality
* Consult clients directly (particularly for catering events) in the creation of menus as required

**As Executive Pastry Chef, we expect from you:**

* 10 years of experience in the pastry operations preferably in luxury hotel
* Acquire work exposure in Asia is an advantage
* Excellent food & beverage and menu planning knowledge
* Creative, multi-tasking and self-motivated
* Strong interpersonal skills and exemplary leadership skills
* Attention to details, well organized and responsible
* Computer proficiency in major software

**Our commitment to you**

* Learning & Development. Your success is our success. We craft unique learning and development programmes for various stages in your career so that you grow, continuously.
* MOstay. When you work as hard as our colleagues do, it‚Äôs important to take time off. As a member of the #MOfamily, you can stay with us wherever you go in the world. The MOstay programme offers complimentary nights and additionally attractive rates on rooms for you and your loved ones.
* Health & Colleague Wellness. Finding the right work-life balance is important. Your wellbeing matters to us. A variety of health benefits and wellness programmes are offered to all our colleagues, globally.
* Retirement Plans. When you show commitment to us, we reciprocate. We offer different retirement plans depending on the length of your service and your role.

**We‚Äôre Fans. Are you?**
