Senior Purchasing Manager
description:
**Additional Information**  
**Job Number**26008114  
**Job Category**Finance & Accounting  
**Location**JW Marriott Hotel Singapore South Beach, 30 Beach Road, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore, 189763  
**Schedule**Full Time  
**Located Remotely?**N  
**Position Type** Management  

**JOB SUMMARY**

Responsible for following established procedures in ordering, receiving, storing, distributing and payment of items. Formulates an approved vendors list encompassing all categories.

  

**CORE WORK ACTIVITIES**

**Managing Work, Projects, Policies, and Standards for Purchasing Across Departments**

* Generates and provides accurate and timely results in the form of reports, presentations, etc.

* Compiles, codes, categorizes, calculates, tabulates, audits, or verifies information or data.

* Assures sanitation compliance.

* Assists Executive Chef in all aspects of purchasing (e.g., Food, Beverage and Controllable) to ensure quality and profitability.

* Orders all food and beverage based on business needs.

* Assists Executive Chef in maintaining/lower budgeted food/controllable costs.

* Delegates and enforces first in/first out inventory rotation for all storeroom products.

* Maintains sanitation and safety standards as specified in the brand guidelines.

* Ensures that proper safeguards are in effect for the security of the food and beverage storeroom assets.

* Enforces item use-up with storeroom personnel and kitchen management to keep inventory at lowest level possible levels.

* Communicates with kitchen, restaurant management and vendors to ensure timing of deliveries satisfies advanced food production needs.

* Checks invoice on goods received against shipment to ensure quantity, quality, weights and purchase specifications are as ordered.

* Uses existing computer programs to perform daily and period end food and beverage costs.

* Maintains inventory controls for proper levels, dating, rotation, requisitions, etc.

* Completes administrative tasks on a timely basis (e.g., C-7s, menu costing, general office duties).

* Completes period end inventory according to Food and Beverage and Accounting standard operation procedures.

* Calculates figures for food and beverage inventory.

* Ensures that price and product availability issues are communicated as needed to the F & B Director and Executive Chef.

* Ensures all LSOP's are adhered to by all employees.

* Receives and inspects all deliveries.

* Maintains an accurate controllable log and beverage perpetual

* Ensures accurate administration of all invoices, and adherence to proper bookkeeping procedures.

**Demonstrating and Applying Accounting Knowledge to Purchasing Operations**

* Demonstrates knowledge of job-relevant issues, products, systems, and processes.

* Uses computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information.

* Uses relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards.

* Keeps up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.

**Supporting Purchasing Operations**

* Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.

* Ensure disciplinary situations are addressed in timely fashion and with consistency.

* Ensures performance reviews are completed on a timely basis for supervisors and non-management employees.

**Maintaining Finance and Accounting Goals**

* Submits reports in a timely manner, ensuring delivery deadlines.

* Ensures profits and losses are documented accurately

* Achieves and exceeds goals including performance goals, budget goals, team goals, etc

* Develops specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.

* Monitors all taxes that apply, ensuring that taxes are current, collected and/or accrued.

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.

* Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

* Interacts with kitchen staff, vendors and Executive Chef.

* Uses existing computer programs effectively to post invoices, update items and costs.

* Attends and participates in all pertinent meetings.

* Provide direction and assistance to other organizational units regarding accounting and budgeting policies and procedures, and efficient control and utilization of financial resources.

* Informs and/or updates the executives, the peers and the subordinates on relevant information in a timely manner.

  

**Managing Discipline Work, Projects, and Policies**

* Coordinates and implements accounting work and projects as assigned.

* Coordinates, implements, and follows up on audits for all areas of property operations.

* Complies with Federal and State laws applying to operations procedures.

* Generates and provides accurate and timely results in the form of reports, presentations, etc.

* Analyzes information and evaluates results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

* Compiles, codes, categorizes, calculates, tabulates, audits, or verifies information or data.

* Balances ledgers.

**Supporting Property Operations**

* Works with operations teams to develop an operational strategy that is aligned with the brand‚Äôs business strategy and leads its execution.

* Reviews comment cards, guest satisfaction results and other data to identify areas of improvement.

* Evaluates if discipline teams are meeting service needs and provides feedback to teams.

* Participates in walk-throughs on property to ensure that all areas are well maintained and preventative maintenance processes are in place.

* Tours building on a regular basis speaking with employees and guests to understand business needs and assess operational opportunities.

* Reviews findings from comment cards and guest satisfaction results with leadership team and ensures appropriate corrective action is taken.

* Works with team to put sustainable work processes and systems in place that support the execution of the strategy.

* Reviews reports and financial statements to determine operations performance against budget.

* Communicates a clear and consistent message regarding departmental goals to produce desired results.

**Managing and Monitoring Activities that Affect the Customer and Guest Experience**

* Provides excellent customer service by being readily available/approachable for all customers and guests.

* Takes proactive approaches when dealing with customers and guest concerns.

* Extends professionalism and courtesy to customers and guests at all times.

* Responds timely to customer service department request.

* Ensures all team members meet or exceed all hospitality requirements.

**Supporting Profitability**

* Supports annual quality audits.

* Reviews financial statements, sales and activity reports, and other performance data to measure productivity and goal achievement and to determine areas needing cost reduction and program improvement.

**Supporting Safety Standards and Work Procedures**

* Implements property emergency plan.

* Provides a safe working environment in compliance with Occupational Safety and Health Administration/MSDS.

* Implements and sustains property accident prevention programs.

* Follows property-specific recovery plans.

**Additional Responsibilities**

* Provides information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.

* Demonstrates self confidence, energy and enthusiasm.

* Manages group or interpersonal conflict.

* Informs and/or updates the executives, the peers and the subordinates on relevant information in a timely manner.

* Manages time and possesses organizational skills.

* Presents ideas, expectations and information in a concise, organized manner.

* Uses problem solving methodology for decision making and follow up.

* Makes calls if necessary.

We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.*

Marriott Hotels strive to elevate the art of hospitality, innovating at every opportunity while keeping the comfort of the oh-so-familiar all around the globe. title: FSO - Risk Consulting - FRM (ESG & Climate Risk) - Experienced Hires - Hong Kong
Senior Facilities Specialist
description:
Summary

The Senior Facilities Specialist is supporting line manager and department head to be responsible for the day-to-day operational excellence of the Singapore headquarters and provides high-level technical and administrative support for the Asia-wide Real Estate and Fit-out portfolio. This role bridges the gap between hands-on facility management and strategic project coordination.This role will also provide administrative support within department of procurement & facilities Management.

What you'll do

Singapore Office Operations & A&A Oversight

* Operational Lead: Execute and oversee the daily 'Full Spectrum' of administrative and facility services in Singapore to ensure a high-standard workplace environment.
* A&A Coordination: Support the AM in managing Alterations & Additions (A&A) works, including supervising contractors on-site and ensuring minimal disruption to office flow.
* Maintenance & MEP: Serve as the first point of contact for technical facility issues; coordinate with Building Management and external vendors for scheduled and corrective maintenance.
* Safety & Compliance: Take a supportive role in local Health and Safety (OSH) checks, ensuring fire safety equipment, first aid kits, and office ergonomics meet local regulations.
* Inventory & Logistics: Manage the end-to-end supply chain for office and pantry inventory, ensuring cost-effective procurement and stock availability.

**Regional Project & Lease Support**

* Project Documentation: Act as the central coordinator for Asia-wide fit-out projects, maintaining project trackers, budget sheets, and tender documentation.
* Lease Portfolio Tracking: Proactively monitor the regional lease calendar for all Asia locations, flagging upcoming renewals or break clauses and preparing the necessary documentation for approval workflows.
* Market Intelligence: Assist in gathering regional data for benchmarking studies, including local vendor rates and market rental comparisons to support strategic decision-making.
* Site Inspections: Support line manager during regional fit-out projects by conducting site audits, taking progress photos, and ensuring contractors adhere to company‚Äôs quality standards.

**Financial Control & Vendor Management**

* Invoice Governance: Conduct rigorous first-level verification of all quotations and invoices against work orders to ensure accuracy and cost-control.
* Tender Support: Assist in the tender process by preparing Request for Proposal (RFP) documents, consolidating vendor bids, and conducting initial price comparisons.
* Performance Evaluation: Monitor vendor performance against SLAs (Service Level Agreements), particularly for outsourced cleaning and specialized technical services.

**Sustainability & Workplace Experience**

* Sustainability Tracking: Monitor and report on local energy, water, and waste data to support company-wide ESG targets.
* Staff Engagement: Act as the primary liaison for employee facility requests, ensuring a quick response time and high internal customer satisfaction.
* Event Logistics: Coordinate the logistical setup for internal office events, town halls, and VIP visits.

**Work on ad-hoc tasks and projects in Procurement & Facilities Management Team**

What you'll need

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Facilities Management, Architecture, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in office leasing, workplace projects, or facilities coordination.
* Familiarity with office project management in Asian countries incl. Singapore, Hongkong and southeast Asian countries.
* Strong analytical and organizational skills, with attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities; able to work across cultures and functions.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and project tracking tools.

What you'll receive

We are dedicated to fostering a family-friendly culture and work environment. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all candidates with the required skills and experience. We enable fair pay within the company by creating non-discriminatory salary systems. Working at Lidl & Kaufland Asia is rewarding, in every sense, because we give you the training to succeed in your role and plenty of opportunities to progress your career here. We are accredited as a Fair and Progressive employer by the Tripartite Alliance for Fair and Progressive Employment Practices (TAFEP).

**Market Leading Remuneration Package:**

* Annual wage supplement and discretionary bonus
* Life Insurance
* Medical Insurance

**Supportive Environment:**

* Out of Office leave for important appointments
* In-house training courses
* Training sponsorship scheme

**Work-life Balance:**

* 5-day week
* Competitive Annual Leave
* Charity, Community and Sporting Events

  

Location

Head Office ‚Äî 19911.0 km
  
30 Pasir Panjang Road 12-31/32 Mapletree Business City  
117440 Singapore

Contract Type

Full Time

Entry Level

Experienced

Facility Management

title: Manager ‚Äì Centre Technical Services
description:
HARBOUR CITY , the flagship property of Wharf Real Estate Investment Company Limited, situated in the commercial hub of Tsim Sha Tsui, boasts 8.4 million square feet of prime commercial space comprising offices, retail shops, serviced apartments, hotels and club, and approximately 2,000 car parking spaces. With its over 450 shops and around 80 restaurants, Harbour City is home to Hong Kong's largest shopping, dining and entertainment centre.
  
  
Manager ‚Äì Centre Technical Services
  
  
A leader role responsible for overseeing the planning and management of all facilities and infrastructure of Harbour City - a sizable commercial complex encompassing shopping mall and Grade A offices.
  
  
Key Responsibilities
  
  
Oversee the Technical Department, covering all aspects of facilities management, risk management, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements to provide a safe, clean, and well-maintained environment for all stakeholders.
  
  
Repair and Maintenance
  
  
Plan, manage, monitor, and control premises maintenance, improvement, addition & alteration, and fit-out projects; review and upgrade technical standards and specifications; oversee tendering and contractor management.
  
  
Lead repairs and maintenance operations, including preventative and corrective maintenance programs, to maximize asset longevity and operational efficiency.
  
  
Procurement / Budget and Expenditure Management
  
  
Proactive management of the entire procurement / outsourcing process with reference to budget, from needs justification, vendor sourcing, quality and quantity rationalization, to receiving management and ongoing contractors monitoring.
  
  
Risk Management and Regulatory Compliance
  
  
Minimize incidents (including health and safety) of all kinds and ensure all regulatory compliance in an efficient manner by policies and systems, stakeholders training and education, and post-mortems.
  
  
Sustainability
  
  
Support the Group in achieving its various sustainability commitments by energy and waste management, environmental protection, and other available means.
  
  
Team Management and Developmen t
  
  
Oversee the department as a whole with reference to business needs, industrial trend, and market change, by ensuring optimal team structure, identifying training needs, and incubating and developing potential staffs.
  
  
Requirements
  
  
University graduate in Building Services Engineering, Facilities Management and Maintenance, or related disciplines.
  
  
At least 15 years of proven management experience in large-scale, multi-functional commercial complexes, with demonstrated leadership skills in a highly disciplined environment.
  
  
Professional knowledge of building systems, risk management, sustainability practices, and regulatory requirements.
  
  
Recognized professional membership of HKIE, CIBSE, IMECHE, HKIS, or equivalent.
  
  
Strong leader committed to continuous improvement, resourceful in problem-solving, and equipped with excellent analytical and people management skills.
  
  
Experience in implementing smart building technologies and digital solutions is a plus.
  
  
High level of integrity, professionalism, and accountability.
  
  
Proficient in spoken and written English and Chinese.
  
  
We offer competitive remuneration package that commensurate with experience and qualifications. Fringe benefits include employer‚Äôs top-up MPF contribution, family medical plan, training sponsorship, employee wellness programs and other benefits.
  
  
Interested parties are invited to send full resume stating contact telephone number, date available, present and expected salary to our recruitment email address.
  
  
(Personal data provided will be used strictly in accordance with the Company‚Äôs personal data policy which is available upon request.)
  
  
Harbour City Estates Limited

title: Regional Director, Bancassurance Distribution, Asia
description:
**Regional Director, Bancassurance Distribution, Asia**

**Ageas** is a listed international insurance Group with a heritage spanning 200 years.

It offers Retail and Business customers Life and Non-Life insurance products designed to suit their specific needs today and tomorrow and is also engaged in reinsurance activities.

As one of Europe's larger insurance companies Ageas concentrates its activities in Europe and Asia which together make up the major part of the global insurance market. It operates successful insurance businesses in Belgium, the UK, France, Portugal, Turkey, China, Malaysia, India, Thailand, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Singapore, and the Philippines through a combination of wholly owned subsidiaries and long-term partnerships with strong financial institutions and key distributors.

In most markets, Ageas ranks among the market leaders in the countries in which it operates. It represents a staff force of about 44,000 people and reported annual inflows close to EUR 18.5 billion in 2024 (all figures at 100%).

Shape your Career with Ageas

We‚Äôre currently looking for a high calibre professional to join Ageas Asia as **Regional Director, Bancassurance Distribution, Asia**, based in our Hong Kong Regional Office.

The job holder will be reporting hierarchically to Regional Director, Agency and Partnership Distribution, Asia.

In this role you‚Äôre expected to:

Join the esteemed Commercial Team at Ageas Regional Office (RO) in Hong Kong. Our team is dedicated to delivering value-added skills and services to Ageas Group operating companies across Asia. The primary goal of the Commercial Team is to enhance and sustain the relevance of Ageas Group initiatives for our Asian Operating Companies (OpCos), including both controlled entities and joint venture partners.  
  
In this role within the Commercial Team, the successful candidate will assume the role as the Regional Director, Bancassurance Distribution ‚Äì Asia, which is a senior leadership role within the broader Distribution function, which encompasses Agency and Partnership Distribution across the region. While the role has primary accountability for the strategic direction, performance, and sustainability of the bancassurance channel, the incumbent operates as part of an integrated distribution leadership team and is expected to leverage d expert resources to deliver results.  
  
The role acts as a senior representative of Ageas to joint venture partners and bank stakeholders, providing strategic leadership, commercial expertise, and influence to drive top-line growth, profitability, and long-term value creation. A strong strategic mindset, data-driven decision making, and advanced digital and AI capability are critical to success in this role, enabling proactive management, innovation, and productivity enhancement across the bancassurance portfolio.

As a successful candidate you‚Äôd ideally have the following skills and exposure:

**Academic Requirements:**

  

* University degree in Business, Finance, Economics, or a related discipline.

**Knowledge, Skills & Experience:**

  

* Minimum 15 years‚Äô experience in insurance, bancassurance or financial services distribution, including senior leadership exposure.
* Proven ability to set and execute regional distribution strategies within complex, multi-market environments.
* Strong understanding of training architectures, recruitment models and sales capability development, with experience leveraging centres of expertise.
* Demonstrated experience in compensation and incentive design for sales-driven organisations.
* Advanced digital literacy, including dashboard design, performance analytics and CRM usage.
* Working knowledge of AI tools and applications, with a demonstrated ability to apply them to drive innovation and productivity.
* Exceptional influencing, negotiation and relationship-building skills across cultures and senior stakeholder groups.
* Extensive experience working across Asian markets.
* Willingness to travel is required.

**Other Qualifications:**

  

* Experience in life insurance sales (as an advisor) is a highly desirable trait.

Ageas values your talent and knows how to reward it. We offer you an attractive salary and fringe benefits. You will work in a stimulating international environment with numerous opportunities for personal development. You will work independently within a global dynamic team in agile ways (start-up spirit).

Take the next step in your career, apply for this role at Ageas today

Click on the ‚Äú‚Äù button to submit your application.

Application through internal referral

If you would like to refer any qualified individuals who are interested in this position, please advise them to click on the ‚Äú‚Äù button to submit his/her application. Referees should indicate the name and department of the referrer on their resumes. Shortlisted candidates would be notified for an interview.

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

Ageas is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Inclusion and Diversity are an essential part of Ageas‚Äô values and company culture. We foster a working environment where everyone feels they belong, collaborates to achieve our common ambitions, and is recognized for their contribution. Ageas encourages its people to think and act differently, to speak up, to be themselves and to contribute their individual skills. Ageas strives to create a truly inclusive company ‚Äì attracting the most talented people and offering them an environment where they can grow their full potential. For Ageas, diversity and inclusion is a business imperative, providing us with the foundation to achieve sustainable business results across different markets.

title: Electrical & Electronics Engineer
description:
Wetec is a leading solution provider specializing in measurement and monitoring systems for various sectors including Hydropower Dams, MRT, Railways, Structural Buildings, Waste Water Plants, Groundwater, Monuments, Highways, Tunnels, Bridges, Landslides, Underground locations, Airports, Harbours, Renewable Energy Farms, Mines, and Climate Change. We also focus on Water, Soil, Crops, Climate, Environmental, Waste, and Physical Surveys. Our aim is to be your total solution partner, sharing knowledge and expertise to select the best products for your applications, besides supplying and distributing scientific instruments.

As an E&E Engineer at Wetec Pte Ltd, you will support our technical team in the setup, testing, and maintenance of instrumentation and monitoring systems across water, environmental and geotechnical applications. You will gain hands-on experience working with real instruments, sensors, field equipment, and data-acquisition platforms, supporting both in-house and on-site project activities.

Key Responsibilities:

* Provide on-site technical support, including maintenance, servicing and repair of equipment and systems.
* Assist with installation, setup and commissioning of instruments at customer sites.
* Conduct product demonstrations, system testing and basic user training.
* Review technical specifications, drawings and pre-wiring details to support project preparation.
* Understand customer application workflows to deliver timely and effective support.
* Collaborate with the service team to ensure smooth project execution and customer satisfaction.

Candidate Requirements

* Bachelor in in Electrical & Electronic Engineering or Computer Engineering
* Responsible, willing to learn, comfortable with hands-on technical tasks
* Strong interest in field service, troubleshooting and customer interaction.
* Good communication, problem-solving and learning attitude.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $4,000.00 - $4,500.00 per month

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Manager, Resource & Power Division
description:
[What the role is]

The Resource and Carbon Division (RCD) works as a team with internal stakeholders (e.g. Industry Groups) and external stakeholders (e.g. private companies and other government agencies) to develop policies and products that promote competitive and sustainable use of key resources for industrial activities in Singapore. This will be in domains such as land, electricity, water, renewable electricity, environment and greenhouse gas emissions.  
The division is responsible for developing policies and frameworks that optimise the value we get out of Singapore‚Äôs scarce resources, manage resource trade-offs across industry sub-sectors, galvanize climate action within the industry, and undertake long-term resource planning for industry.  
In the course of your work, you will have the opportunity to understand the resource needs of industry and to develop the appropriate solutions to ensure Singapore industry‚Äôs long-term competitiveness. You will also be able to cultivate and maintain close ties with decision makers and influencers in government, and to engage companies and private sector solutions providers to promote resource efficiency and emissions reduction projects.

[What you will be working on]

In this role, your responsibilities will include the following aspects:

* Develop and refine power/renewable energy demand projections for industrial sectors based on pipeline investments and business expansion plans.
* Work with other government agencies on infrastructure planning and policy development/implementation to avail sufficient power/renewable energy capacity for industrial sectors, in line with economic growth priorities.

* Develop, manage and review incentives and other tools to support business needs and Singapore‚Äôs resource policies

* Prepare comprehensive and succinct policy papers and presentations to management and government stakeholders
* Assess resource profiles of key companies‚Äîincluding energy, land, and other infrastructure needs‚Äîbased on investment plans or operational changes.

* Develop communication lines to businesses on Singapore‚Äôs resource policies

To meet the challenges of this role, you will have to:

* Have a keen interest in policy formulation, with the willingness to be hands-on to implement policy changes and projects
* Be able to engage companies in the manufacturing and exportable services sectors, industrial real estate developers and/or energy services providers in both 1-1 and 1-to-many settings
* Be able to understand and assess Singapore‚Äôs needs and develop the right solutions

[What we are looking for]

* Degree in Economics, Science, Engineering or other relevant disciplines
* At least 6-8 years of experience in a similar or relevant role
* An interest in policy development, with the willingness to be hands-on to implement policy changes
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate and present to a non-technical audience
* Strong analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information and provide recommendations through creative & logical thinking
* Good stakeholder management and client engagement skills to effectively work with internal and external stakeholders
* A good team player who is well organised, patient and persistent, and willing to consider new ideas
* Self-motivated and positive attitude, with excellent work ethic
* Singaporean

title: Computer Engineer
description:
Wetec is a leading solution provider specializing in measurement and monitoring systems for various sectors including Hydropower Dams, MRT, Railways, Structural Buildings, Waste Water Plants, Groundwater, Monuments, Highways, Tunnels, Bridges, Landslides, Underground locations, Airports, Harbours, Renewable Energy Farms, Mines, and Climate Change. We also focus on Water, Soil, Crops, Climate, Environmental, Waste, and Physical Surveys. Our aim is to be your total solution partner, sharing knowledge and expertise to select the best products for your applications, besides supplying and distributing scientific instruments.

We are looking for a Computer Engineer to help bridge the gap between hardware and software. You will assist in building scalable applications that talk to physical IoT devices, working across the entire stack from sensor data to user dashboards.

Key Responsibilities

  • IoT Integration: Assist in connecting data loggers and sensors to our platform using industrial protocols (Modbus, RS-485, MQTT, etc.).
  • Full-Stack Development: Help build and maintain web interfaces (React/Vue) and backend services (Python/Node.js).
  • API & Data: Support the creation of RESTful APIs (FastAPI/Express) and manage data across SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Collaboration: Work alongside senior developers and stakeholders to troubleshoot, refactor code, and improve system performance.
  • Version Control: Maintain clean, organized code using Git.

What You‚Äôll Learn / Required Skills

  • Exposure to modern frameworks like React, Vue.js, FastAPI, or Express.
  • Hands-on experience with IoT communication standards (Serial, Modbus, MQTT).
  • Knowledge of database management (PostgreSQL, MongoDB).
  • Foundational understanding of Python or JavaScript.

Qualifications:

Bachelor in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Mechatronics Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering (EE), etc

title: Ent. and Bus. App. Sr Assoc. Cnslt.
description:
Location

Bangalore, IN

Category

Other

  

Roles and responsibilities:

* Work closely with Product Owners and Practice Managers to receive detailed business/user requirement specifications that identify the goals of the program
* Assist with the preparation of a technical requirements document, including systems and flowcharts that diagrammatically show how the information will flow through the computer and its peripheral or related equipment after the planned change
* Analyze business requirements and ensure that the designed solution meets those requirements
* Perform proof of concept if required
* Transform the detailed requirements into a complete, detailed systems design document that focuses on how to deliver the required functionality
* Convert the design into a complete information system. This includes acquiring and installing the systems environment, creating and testing databases, preparing test case procedures, preparing test files, coding, compiling, refining programs, and performing test readiness review
* Convert the design into a complete information system. This includes acquiring and installing the systems environment, creating and testing databases, preparing test case procedures, preparing test files, coding, compiling, refining programs, and performing test readiness review
* Ensure that throughout the development phase, the process is documented including the development procedures for application use and security
* Actively engage with Product Owners and Practice Managers during testing for UAT Clearance
* Assist with the resolution of any problems identified in the integration and test phases
* Examine any program errors in logic and data and make the necessary recommendations to correct the program as required and/or escalate the problem accordingly
* Perform deployment of the code to Prod environment and provide post deployment support
* Support all the code sets and implementations that have been implemented in production in accordance with defined Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for the business
* Write and distribute the task descriptions in a production environment to operate and maintain the solution that has been designed and implemented
* Assist with post-implementation process reviews
* Adhere to Sprint plan
* Documentation and communication of changes made to the system.

Job Requirements:

* Expert in Service Now ITSM, ESG, NowAssist and associated modules.
* Knowledge on multi-technology application design best practices which enable them to act as trusted advisors to internal clients on optimal application designs
* Ability to take holistic views of application environments, including hardware platforms, applications, databases, operating systems, and storage
* Ability to work with abstract concepts and have sound problem solving and analytical skills
* Strong people interaction and collaboration capability
* Deep technical understanding of development and platform engineering
* Excellent client-centricity with the ability to focus on business outcomes
* Highly Organized and planned individual
* Self-starter and self-managed
* Strategic ability to define the technical direction in the portfolio of products including technical strategies and plans and execution plans
* Strong stakeholder and relationship management
* Excellent communication skills to effectively interact with a variety of stakeholders, including the technical teams and clients
* Ability to demonstrate impeccable attention to detail and work well within a team environment
* Good knowledge of project management principles, SCRUM, KANBAN to ensure that projects with clients are executed accordingly
* Ability to continuously contribute to the improvement of internal effectiveness by contributing to the improvement of current methodologies, processes, and tools

title: Deputy Manager (Corporate Service)
description:
The Hong Kong Red Cross was established in 1950. We belong to the World's largest humanitarian network and provide impartial and quality care to protect life and health, and to enhance the capacity of vulnerable people to live a safe and dignified life. Our services include disaster relief, special education, volunteer service, first aid and health training, and blood transfusion. http://www.redcross.org.hk
  
  
**Job Purpose:**  
This position is to be responsible for the ESG and green initiatives of the Agency, collaborating with internal stakeholders to provide support related to Corporate Service functions in emergency operations for the development of sustainable organization and partnership engagement. S/he shall also be responsible to organize hospitality visits and support the Head of Corporate Service and Senior Manager (Corporate Service) to ensure implementation and execution of action plans in a quality, efficient and cost-effective manner.
  
  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
To formulate and implement workflow, guidelines, and code of practices for the development of sustainable organisation, taking references from the principles of Green Response of the IFRC and other National Societies, NGOs and Corporates.
  
  
To lead the implementation of sustainability development initiatives e.g. preparation of Stakeholder Engagement Survey, ESG report, conduct carbon audits and prepare reports, organize ESG forum, participate in ESG sharing.
  
  
To take lead and work with Green Group members and service unit representatives to formulate the year plan, prepare and monitor the budget, execute green initiatives to induce and enhance better engagement of colleagues, foster green culture of the Agency to reduce carbon footprint by setting KPIs.
  
  
To assist Senior Manager to formulate and implement guidelines and work manual, compilation and preparation of related reports and presentations, provide administrative and service support for Corporate Service functions to ensure sustainable operations and quality service.
  
  
To act as the focal person for hospitality visits, plan for visit itinerary, prepare visit materials, collaborate with different service units to arrange briefing to enhance the visitors with Red Cross knowledge and HKRC services.
  
  
**To assist Head of Corporate Service / Senior Manager to:** (a) organise and co-ordinate Agency major initiatives e.g. prepare and manage budget for the initiatives to ensure smooth running; (b) develop partnership engagement e.g. identify potential partnering organisation, networking, consolidate information and update database.
  
  
**Requirements:**  
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Environmental Science, Management or related discipline
  
  
At least 5 years relevant working experience, including 3 years‚Äô experience in ESG or management field
  
  
Sound ESG Knowledge and solid experience in initiating Green projects, Carbon Audit, ESG reporting
  
  
Excellent interpersonal communication skills, well organised with analytical-mind, responsible, proactive, detailed minded and able to work under tight schedule.
  
  
Independent, self-motivated and client oriented
  
  
Knowledge of operation environment and culture of nonprofit organizations
  
  
Flexible personality, initiative with mind-set for improving service quality, analytical thinking
  
  
Sound project management and people management skills
  
  
Excellent command of both written and oral English, Chinese/Cantonese/ Putonghua
  
  
Immediate available is preferred
  
  
**Fringe Benefits:**  
Fringe benefits including generous annual leave, marriage leave, compassionate leave, caring leave, medical and dental benefits (including dependents), Employer MPF voluntary contribution, and a discretionary incentive payment (where applicable) will be offered to the right candidates.
  
  
**Contract Period:** 2 years
  
  
**Work Schedule:** Mondays to Fridays (44 hours per week)
  
  
Interested candidates are invited to submit an online application, by clicking the "Apply" button on or before 8 February 2026 .
  
  
Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the Agency‚Äôs data protection policy for recruitment purposes only. Applicants not contacted within 4 weeks may consider their applications unsuccessful, and all related information will be retained in our files for 6 months.
  
  
Full-time,Contract

title: Procurement Manager APAC
description:
**Position Title: Procurement Manager ‚Äì APAC (OPEX / MRO, Data Centers)**

**Location: Singapore**

**Your role**

The Procurement Manager ‚Äì APAC is responsible for leading and executing **regional OPEX and MRO procurement** strategies across data center operations. This role ensures cost efficiency, supply continuity, supplier performance, and compliance while supporting mission-critical data center reliability and uptime.

The role partners closely with **Operations, Engineering, Finance, Legal, ESG, and HSSE teams** to manage service contracts, spare parts, maintenance vendors, and operational suppliers across multiple APAC markets.

**What you‚Äôll do**

1. Regional OPEX & MRO Procurement

* Own and manage APAC-wide OPEX and MRO categories, including but not limited to:
* Electrical & mechanical maintenance services
* UPS, batteries, generators, switchgear, transformers MRO
* Critical spare parts and consumables
* Facilities maintenance, FM services, and specialist contractors
* Develop and execute category strategies to optimize cost, performance, and risk.
* Drive supplier consolidation and standardization across regions where feasible.

2. Strategic Sourcing & Tender Management

* Lead RFx activities (RFI, RFP, RFQ), including scope definition, commercial strategy, bid evaluation, negotiation, and award recommendations.
* Ensure sourcing activities align with spend thresholds, approval authorities, and procurement policies.
* Partner with Operations and Engineering to ensure scopes of work (SOWs) are technically robust and operationally fit-for-purpose.

3. Contract & Supplier Management

* Manage MSAs, service contracts, SLAs, and pricing agreements for OPEX and MRO suppliers.
* Lead contract renewals, renegotiations, and performance reviews to ensure value delivery.
* Establish and manage supplier KPIs, including cost, quality, response time, safety, and compliance.
* Support supplier risk management, including business continuity, spare availability, and critical supplier dependency.

4. Cost Management & Value Creation

* Deliver measurable cost savings and cost avoidance through strategic sourcing, negotiation, and demand management.
* Track, validate, and report savings in line with the company‚Äôs cost-saving playbook and governance framework.
* Support budgeting, forecasting, and cost transparency for regional OPEX spend.

5. Stakeholder Engagement

* Act as the primary procurement business partner for Data Center Operations and Engineering teams across APAC.
* Support operations-led projects by providing procurement guidance, commercial expertise, and award governance.
* Collaborate with Finance on budget control, accruals, and financial compliance.

6. Governance, Compliance & ESG

* Ensure procurement activities comply with internal policies, delegation of authority, and applicable local regulations.
* Support supplier audits, ethical sourcing, and ESG initiatives, including modern slavery, labor standards, and HSSE compliance.
* Maintain accurate procurement documentation and audit trails.

**What you‚Äôll need**

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, Business, or related discipline.
* 8 years of procurement experience, with strong exposure to OPEX and MRO categories.
* Proven experience supporting data centers, mission-critical facilities, industrial plants, or infrastructure environments.
* Strong experience managing regional APAC suppliers and contracts across multiple countries.
* Solid knowledge of RFx processes, contract negotiation, and supplier management.
* Preferred

  + Experience in UPS, generators, electrical systems, cooling systems, or critical infrastructure MRO.
  + Exposure to data center operations or hyperscale / colocation environments.
  + Professional certifications (e.g., CIPS, CPSM, PMP) are an advantage.
* Skills & Competencies

  + Strong commercial and negotiation skills
  + Ability to work with technical stakeholders and interpret engineering requirements
  + Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills
  + Data-driven mindset with strong cost and performance analytics capability
  + Ability to operate in a fast-paced, multi-country environment
  + High level of integrity, governance awareness, and risk management

**A bit about us**

Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL¬Æ, the company‚Äôs global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx¬Æ) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 25+ countries on six continents.

**A bit about our team**

Our Operations team keeps our customers‚Äô infrastructure running safely and securely. We get plenty of opportunities to take on a variety of tasks and develop our technical skills. From overseeing electrical power to cooling and fire suppression systems, our team plays a vital role in making sure everything in our data centers operates as it should.

**What we can offer you**

Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers.

Join us and you‚Äôll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, you‚Äôll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We‚Äôll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us.

Apply today, take charge of your career and grow your talents with us.

**Our Compensation Philosophy**

Digital Realty offers its employees a highly competitive compensation package, excellent benefits, and an environment that recognizes and rewards your contributions. Central to our compensation philosophy is rewarding our employees for achieving the values and objectives aligned to the company's overall goals and values.
company_description: Our purpose at Digital Realty is ‚ÄúTo bring companies and data together, in bold new ways, to power the innovation determining our future.‚Äù

title: PRODUCT PF SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT
description:
**Excited to grow your career?**

BBVA is a global company with more than 160 years of history that operates in more than 25 countries where we serve more than 80 million customers. We are more than 121,000 professionals working in multidisciplinary teams with profiles as diverse as financiers, legal experts, data scientists, developers, engineers and designers.

**About the job:**

We are seeking a highly experienced professional to join our Structured Finance team as a Senior Vice President or Executive Director. In this role, you will be responsible for originating, structuring, and executing Project Finance transactions with a primary focus on the energy, infrastructure, and TMT sectors. The position is based in Hong Kong, where you will play a key part in expanding our portfolio in the Asia-Pacific region, working closely with clients, internal stakeholders and external partners to deliver tailored financing solutions. This position offers the opportunity to lead complex deals in a fast-paced market, contributing to the bank‚Äôs strategic objectives in sustainable and innovative financing.

Key Responsibilities:

* Origination and Business Development : identify and pursue new business opportunities in Project Finance within energy, infrastructure and TMT. Build and maintain relationships with key clients, such as developers, operators, investors and government entities, to generate a robust pipeline of transactions.
* Transaction Execution : lead the end-to-end execution of deals, from initial structuring and due diligence to negotiation, documentation, and closing. Preparation of credit papers, collaborating with risk, legal, tax and compliance teams to ensure efficient processes.
* Market Research and Strategy : monitor market trends, regulatory developments, and competitive landscapes in energy, infrastructure, and TMT industries. Provide insights and recommendations to senior management on potential opportunities and risks in the Asia-Pacific region.
* Client Relationship Management : act as a trusted advisor to clients, offering customized financing solutions that align with their strategic goals. Foster long-term partnerships to drive repeat business and referrals.
* Team Collaboration and Leadership : mentor junior team members, contribute to cross-functional projects, and support the overall growth of the Project Finance business. Ensure adherence to the bank‚Äôs policies, ESG principles, and international standards.
* Risk Management : assess credit, operational, and market risks associated with project finance transactions, implementing appropriate risk mitigation strategies to protect the bank‚Äôs interests.

Qualification & Experience

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, Engineering or related disciplines; advanced degrees (eg. MBA, CFA, etc) or professional qualifications are highly desirable.
* 7 to 12+ years of working experience in Project Finance or related roles with banking or advisory firms.

Knowledge & Skills

* Strong understanding of the APAC Project Finance market and industry best practices, with specific experience in the energy, infrastructure and TMT sectors
* Strong expertise in deal structuring, financial modelling, credit analysis.
* Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship building abilities.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines
* Willingness to travel within the Asia-Pacific region and occasionally to Europe.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and AI analytical tools

Language

* Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish or Mandarin (or other Asian languages) will be viewed favourably.

### ***Job Posting***

### ***BBVA Hong Kong will conduct a background check on you in accordance with the Mandatory Reference Checking (MRC) Scheme regulated by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). Should any discrepancy identified or deemed unsatisfactory to us, we reserve the rights to terminate your employment in such case. (*** ***FAQs for In-Scope Individual*** ***:*** ***https://www.hkab.org.hk/files/page/page-content/79/FAQs\\_for\\_In-Scope\\_Individuals\\_(24\\_July\\_2025)-1753348029.pdf*** ***)***

**Skills:**

Communication, Negotiation, Relationship Building
company_description: BBVA is a global company with over 160 years of history present in 25 countries with over 81 million customers. We are more than 113,000 professionals working in multidisciplinary and diverse teams.

title: PRODUCT PF EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR
description:
**Excited to grow your career?**

BBVA is a global company with more than 160 years of history that operates in more than 25 countries where we serve more than 80 million customers. We are more than 121,000 professionals working in multidisciplinary teams with profiles as diverse as financiers, legal experts, data scientists, developers, engineers and designers.

**About the job:**

We are seeking a highly motivated professional to join our Structured Finance team as a Senior Vice President or Executive Director. In this role, you will support the origination, structuring and execution of Asset Finance transactions, with a primary focus on aircraft and vessels. The position will be based in either Singapore, Hong Kong or Tokyo where you will contribute to expanding our activities in the Asia-Pacific region, working closely with clients, internal stakeholders and external partners to deliver tailored financing solutions. This position offers the opportunity to lead complex deals in a fast-paced market, contributing to the bank‚Äôs strategic objectives in sustainable and innovative asset financing.

Key Responsibilities:

* Origination and Business Development : identify and pursue new business opportunities in aircraft and vessel financing, including leasing, secured lending, and structured finance deals. Build and maintain relationships with key clients, such as airlines, shipping companies, lessors, and investors, to develop a pipeline of transactions.
* Transaction Execution : lead the end-to-end execution of deals, from initial structuring and due diligence to negotiation, documentation, and closing. Collaborate with legal, risk, compliance, and credit teams to ensure efficient processes while mitigating risk.
* Market Research and Strategy : monitor market trends, regulatory developments, and competitive landscapes in the aviation and maritime industries. Provide insights and recommendations to senior management on potential opportunities and risks in the sector.
* Client Relationship Management : act as a trusted advisor to clients, offering customized financing solutions that align with their strategic goals. Foster long-term partnerships to drive repeat business and referrals.
* Team Collaboration and Leadership : mentor junior team members, contribute to cross-functional projects, and support the overall growth of the Asset Finance business. Ensure adherence to the bank‚Äôs policies, ESG principles, and international standards in all transactions.
* Risk Management : assess credit, operational, and market risks associated with asset finance deals, implementing appropriate mitigation strategies to protect the bank‚Äôs interests.

Qualification & Experience

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, or Economics or related disciplines; advanced degrees (eg. MBA, CFA, etc) or professional qualifications are highly desirable.
* 7 to 12+ years of relevant experience in Asset Finance or related roles with banking, leasing, or advisory firms.

Knowledge & Skills

* Proven track record in originating and executing transactions specifically in aircraft and/or vessel financing.
* Familiarity with international financing regulations, including those relevant to aviation (eg. Cape Town Convention) and the maritime sectors.
* Additional experience in Project Finance (e.g., power, infrastructure, or TMT) or specialized Structured Finance products is highly desirable.
* Strong expertise in deal structuring, financial modelling, credit analysis.
* Excellent negotiation, communication, and relationship building abilities.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines
* Willingness to travel within the Asia-Pacific region and occasionally to Europe.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and AI analytical tools

Language

* Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish or Japanese (or other Asian languages) will be viewed favourably.

### ***BBVA Hong Kong will conduct a background check on you in accordance with the Mandatory Reference Checking (MRC) Scheme regulated by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). Should any discrepancy identified or deemed unsatisfactory to us, we reserve the rights to terminate your employment in such case. title: ÂÄâÂãôÊñáÂì° (‰∏äÊ∞¥)
description:
PARKnSHOP Supermarket is part of AS Watson Group, the world‚Äôs largest international health and beauty retailer operating over 17,000 stores across 12 retail brands in 31 markets, with 130,000 people globally.
  
  
In the fiscal year 2024, AS Watson Group reported revenue of over US$24 billion. The company's technology-enabled O+O (Offline plus Online) platforms serve over 6 billion shoppers annually, seamlessly integrating physical and digital retail experiences.
  
  
Founded in 1972, PARKnSHOP, under the AS Watson Group is the largest offline and online (O+O) supermarket chain in Hong Kong and one of the most trusted brands among local consumers. With over 240 stores across Hong Kong and Macau, PARKnSHOP operates several well-known retail brands, including FUSION, TASTE, TASTE x FRESH, FOOD PARC, and GREAT FOOD HALL.
  
  
As Hong Kong‚Äôs most forward-thinking food and lifestyle supermarket, PARKnSHOP fully embodies its brand promise‚Äî"BEST , EASY, VALUE." The company continuously develops innovative, exclusive products to provide a diverse range of high-quality goods and a convenient shopping experience. It prioritizes freshness, safety, and hygiene while introducing creative store concepts and engaging promotions to cater to various customer needs.
  
  
Additionally, PARKnSHOP leads the industry in promoting sustainability, embedding eco-conscious practices into store design and daily operations while encouraging customers to support environmental initiatives and give back to the community.
  
  
PARKnSHOP continues to evolve alongside market trends. In 2007, it pioneered the "MoneyBack" loyalty program and, in recent years, has enhanced the O+O shopping experience with the introduction of PNS online shopping platforms (PNS.hk and the PNS mobile app). Renowned for its visionary retail strategies, PARKnSHOP has garnered widespread recognition and numerous industry awards, solidifying its leadership in the sector.

title: Commercial Marketing Manager, Asia Pacific
description:
**About the Role**
------------------

Role: Commercial Marketing Manager, Asia Pacific (1-year contract)

**Main Responsibilities**  

* Accountable for the commercial marketing performance of the APAC region (LFL sales and gross profit) ‚Äì deliver stretch EBITDA target and the customer proposition in our restaurants ensuring we are truly ‚ÄúThe best part of the journey‚Äù for our customers
* Drive commercial activity plan for the region (commercial initiatives, marketing activities including but not limited to loyalty programs, social media, digital etc.)
* Responsible for strategies and development regarding range, price, promotions, LTO‚Äôs, visual merchandising brand identity, brand guidelines and innovation.
* Commercial evaluation of initiatives with support from Analytics team

- Review and provide guidance - report results to monitor performance; assess whether forecast has been achieved and EBITDA can be banked; and course correct where necessary  

* Price strategies and architectures
* Commercial space planning & space management

Category & Channel Management  

* Commercial customer journey strategies and optimization through in & out of restaurant touch points
* rive improvement in customer satisfaction results across various mediums
* Brand planning and proposition management (brand guidelines, concept descriptions, audits etc.)

- Brand relationship management (local / 3rd party / international) - Liaise with key stakeholders to ensure successful implementations and support contacts with clients/brand owners etc

Concept design & refresh  

* Support local country teams with new openings including pre-opening plans ‚Äì creation and delivery of new concepts/service initiatives and manage the commercial set up for new openings including range, pricing, POS, merchandising, space management and planograms

Commercial sustainability  

* Support brand & supplier negotiations such as beverages, food distribution
* Ownership and management of 3rd Party Brand relationships where appropriate
* Advise the business of emerging trends and opportunities in customer experience, collate case studies, sharing and promoting the adoption of best practices across the APAC region
* Leadership, coaching and development of country marketing teams

**Person Specification**

* Proven experience developing and delivering commercial and marketing plans, leveraging all commercial levers (price, range, display and space, upselling, margin, and category optimisation) to achieve results
* Track record of delivering profit targets and working successfully in a sales environment
* Prior experience in the food & beverage or retail industry within the country
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to drive decision‚Äëmaking based on evidence rather than intuition
* Ability to extract business insights from analysis and present findings and recommendations persuasively
* Demonstrated capability to develop innovative ideas to drive both top‚Äëline and bottom‚Äëline growth, with a test‚Äëlearn‚Äërefine approach to operationalization
* Experience managing and influencing senior stakeholders
* Proficiency in English
* Experience managing client relationships effectively
* Excellent knowledge of external trends in the food & beverage and/or grocery industry
* Solid understanding of the impact of external factors on growth, including competition and seasonality
* Good grasp of operational realities within business units

title: Natural Climate Solutions Analyst, Asia Pacific
description:
**Natural Climate Solutions Analyst, Asia Pacific**

Conservation International protects nature for the benefit of humanity. Through science, policy, fieldwork, and finance, we spotlight and secure the most important places in nature for the climate, biodiversity, and for people. With offices in 30 countries and projects in more than 100 countries, Conservation International partners with governments, companies, civil society, Indigenous peoples, and local communities to help people and nature thrive together.

**POSITION SUMMARY - This position is based in Singapore**

CI is a global leader in Natural Climate Solutions (NCS). As demand grows for high-quality conservation projects that can access voluntary and compliance carbon markets, CI is expanding its carbon project portfolio and its technical assistance to carbon policy initiatives.  
The NFG Global Carbon Team provides technical and financial support for NCS project origination, scoping, and development. As part of this team, the Asia Pacific Carbon Team supports CI field programs and partners across the region with carbon project development, implementation, and enabling-conditions work. The team also manages the Technical Assistance Facility (TAF), a multi-donor mechanism that provides early-stage technical support and targeted investments to advance NCS project development and strengthen the foundational conditions required for high-quality carbon projects.

The Asia Pacific Carbon Team is seeking a Natural Climate Solutions Analyst to work with the Director of Climate Projects on the scoping, feasibility, development, and implementation of carbon projects across the Asia-Pacific region. The role provides technical and project management support across the carbon project cycle, including delivery of project rapid assessments, feasibility studies, Project Design Documents, and Monitoring Reports, and supports policy-related analysis where relevant to NCS and jurisdictional REDD+ nesting.

The Analyst oversees small to moderate projects and components of larger ones, leading planning, implementation, tracking, and reporting. The role is non-supervisory but may lead small ad-hoc teams and provide technical guidance while working independently and collaboratively. This role involves regional travel and requires the ability to work effectively across diverse cultures, languages, and socioeconomic contexts.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

Key Responsibilities

* Working closely with the Portfolio and Technical Teams, provide technical and coordination support during the early development stage of carbon projects, including conducting research to inform portfolio strategies, evaluating potential project opportunities, assessing suitable NCS standards and methodologies, supporting feasibility assessments, and ensuring alignment with CI‚Äôs strategic objectives.
* Provide technical assistance and coordination support for partners implementing carbon projects across the region, including review and assessment of materials submitted for TAF consideration.
* Research emerging standards, methodologies, and approaches in the voluntary and compliance carbon markets to support capacity development, knowledge sharing, and project implementation.
* Support the efficient and timely delivery of project outputs‚Äîincluding Project Rapid Assessments (PRA), Project Idea Notes (PIN), Project Description Documents (PDD), and Monitoring Reports (MR)‚Äîthrough research, technical review, quality control, editing, and formatting, as needed.
* Work with the Director of Climate Projects, Senior Director of Asia Pacific NCS, regional Deal Leads, and technical partners to support the development of workplans and budgets for carbon project development activities.
* Support coordination with project stakeholders to ensure activities comply with voluntary/compliance standards and CI‚Äôs climate, biodiversity, social, financial, and governance safeguards.
* Develop and maintain collaborative relationships with governments, NGOs, scientists, partners, and local communities to support NCS-related knowledge sharing and capacity building.
* Gather, organize, and share project information, action plans, and deliverables with internal and external stakeholders. Support project bids and proposal development as assigned.
* Ensure partner and donor requirements are reflected in project deliverables and support review of outputs for alignment with agreements.
* Serve as a project information resource, supporting effective communication and information flow among partners and stakeholders.
* Support the implementation of carbon project activities by assisting with planning, logistics, tracking of progress, documentation, and follow-up actions.
* Support monitoring of project progress and provide technical input to improve project management and implementation.
* Help identify capacity-building needs and support actions that address technical or operational gaps. Contribute to identifying tools, resources, and training required for project success.
* Support preparation of reporting summaries and project narratives and coordinate with headquarters and program finance and operations staff on project financial reporting.

Additional responsibilities

* Support the Center for Policy and Incentives with research and analysis that inform the design of policy frameworks relevant to NCS, including REDD+ nesting frameworks and enabling conditions.
* Coordinate with other groups within NFG‚Äîincluding CI Ventures, Long-term Finance, and Advisory Services‚Äîto identify funding opportunities, support the development of finance mechanisms, and contribute to financial modeling and analysis to assess project economics.
* Prepare confidential investment-related materials for third-party investors under advisory services agreements or as part of co-investment opportunities in high-quality projects.
* Support select NCS initiatives related to biodiversity credits and freshwater outcomes, ensuring alignment with CI‚Äôs broader conservation finance objectives.

People and Resource Management Responsibilities

* Does not have direct supervisory authority but provides feedback on team members and/or contract/partner staff and support personnel performance.
* Act as a technical or subject matter expert to peers and other staff.
* Manages an individual budget, but decisions that bind or commit CI are approved by the immediate supervisor.
* Responsible for managing some public or private funds, monitoring results, and recommending follow-up action. Reviews for understanding and compliance with donor agreements.

**WORKING CONDITIONS**

* This is a full-time position
* This position is based in Singapore, where CI‚Äôs NFG Asia team and the International Blue Carbon Institute is headquartered.
* Periodic travel to project site and other office locations (up to 35%).
* Comfortable working outdoors for extended periods.
* Ability to work outside the normal work schedule to meet project deadlines.
* This position follows a hybrid work structure, working some days from the office and some days remotely. Guidance will be shared during the interview process.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

**Required**

* Bachelor's degree in conservation science, natural resource management, climate change, or other relevant fields.
* 4 to 6 years of work experience in topics related to international conservation, climate change, forest carbon, and/or blue carbon.
* Experience in voluntary NCS carbon project feasibility, development, and implementation.
* Familiarity with voluntary market standards and NCS carbon methodologies.
* Strong technical and analytical skills.
* Strong organization and time management skills.
* Ability to diagnose problems and identify solutions.
* Team player and able to work effectively with diverse work groups in a multicultural environment.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in written and spoken English.
* Ability to work well under pressure, multitask, set priorities, and deliver quality results.
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and under general supervision.

**Preferred**

* Masters degree
* Ability to function well in a multicultural, diverse, and fast-paced work team environment.
* Comfortable managing multiple duties and adapting to changing priorities.
* Ability to work under general supervision and take initiative to solve problems under supervisor's direction.
* Familiar and comfortable with Microsoft Office.

**To apply for this position, please submit a resume and cover letter.**

**See all Conservation International Career Opportunities** **HERE**

**Conservation International is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals. We believe in hiring based on merit and qualifications, ensuring a fair and inclusive hiring process for everyone.**

title: Demand and Supply Planner, Asia Pacific (Korean Speaking)
description:
**Ready to bring passion into your career?**

  

Clarins Group is a trusted French family-owned company, a leader in skincare and make-up, operating in more than 150 countries.

  

We are looking for a **Demand and Supply Planner, Asia Pacific.**

**About the Job**

The Demand and Supply Planner is the business partner for the General Manager on all Planning matters. He/She is responsible for coordinating the forecasting for the assigned market through gathering and critiquing of data from Sales/Commercial and Marketing teams.

The Demand and Supply Planner leads the market S&OP process with the GM, ensuring forecasts are accurate, gaps vs. budget are addressed, and sound business decisions are made.

He/She translates demand into supply needs, works with the regional inventory team to secure allocation, manages supply for launches, promotions, and core SKUs, and mitigates potential risks.

  

**Demand Planning**

* Develop rolling demand forecasts at market, channel, line range, and SKU levels, using statistical models, sales input, and market trends.
* Build product sales forecasts across the lifecycle (launches, mature, phase-out, discontinuation). Drive effective planning for new launches and re-launches to optimize product availability and align with business strategy.
* Manage promotions, delistings, and phase-in/phase-out processes in close collaboration with Sales, Marketing, and Supply Planning to secure high service levels.
* Contribute to the product ABCD analysis, driving continuous product catalogue harmonization to fulfil both business needs and in alignment with Regional / Global directions.
* Animate the monthly best estimates using the orders on hand considering internal stocks availability and at the customer level, where applicable.
* Evaluate the impact of future products events (launch/offers) on future sales volumes.
* Monitor forecast accuracy, bias, and highlight gaps versus targets.
* Lead monthly Demand Review as part of S&OP process.

  

**Supply Planning**

* Manage supply planning for the assigned market.
* Translate market demand into supply requirements, ensuring product availability while minimizing excess/obsolete stock.
* Identify top deviation gaps and provide risk assessments and mitigation activities.
* Identify supply management bottlenecks, define solutions and to communicate the opportunity cost of bottlenecks and drives improvements to solve them.
* Follow up and manage inventory shortages / excesses, with Marketing team through arbitration/ allocation. Optimize the inventory depletion (sales, staff sales, returns & disposal‚Ä¶)

* Monitor and manage inventory shelf-life / expiry dates minimizing write-offs whilst improving processes to avoid obsolescence.

* Check and update the stock parameters (safety stock, lead time, etc).

  

**Monthly KPI and** **Reporting****:**

* Develop and generate monthly Forecast Accuracy & Fill Rate report.
* Identify root cause and develop action plans with other functions in the assigned market to deliver supply chain KPIs.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Act as key interface between local market and regional/global planning teams.
* Partner with Supply Chain Operations team to ensure timely deliveries and resolve supply chain disruptions.
* Provide insights for Sales/Commercial and Marketing teams on supply feasibility for campaigns and promotions.
* Support business planning cycles (budget, strategic plan).

  

Other responsibilities may be added to the above, which are consistent with the title **Demand and Supply Planner**

  

**About you:**

**Education/Degree or equivalent**

* Bachelor's Degree or combination of college education and related work experience may be used as a substitute.

  

**Background including total years of experience:**

* At least 3 to 5 years of relevant working experience.
* In-depth understanding of forecasting, demand planning, supply planning, and inventory planning.

  

**Soft and Leadership Skills**

* Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
* Highly organized with attention to detail.
* Adaptation to new concepts and tools.
* Excellent relation skills: listening and communication.
* Consensus building.
* Strategic influencing.
* Ability to generate transversal cooperation and teamwork.
* Succinct mind.
* Rigorous and structured.

  

**Technical Skills**

* Sensitivity to customers‚Äô and business needs in cosmetics, FMCG, or similar industries.
* A good command of the Supply Chain planning, and stock management processes (sales forecast, needs calculation and planning, stock policy and management)
* Master MSOffice (Excel, PowerPoint)
* Master informatics ERP tools (SAP, M3).
* Knowledge of main mathematical algorithm used in sales forecasts and KPIs.

  

**About the benefits:**

* 71 years of expertise in beauty and spa, with the Clarins and myBlend brands
* Unique products and innovative services
* A commitment to Social & Environmental Responsibility embedded in our raison d'√™tre
* A caring and inclusive corporate culture
* Development and training opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* A flexible work environment, with up to 2 days of remote working per week

  

If you have a curious mind, a thirst to go further and the drive to boldly take on new challenges, join us.

  

**About Clarins Group**

A *B-Corp certified* global leading skincare and make-up company, Clarins group is the embodiment of a committed family history, with a fierce passion for innovation and spirit of independence. Our purpose "making life more beautiful, passing on a more beautiful planet," is a core commitment outlined in our by-laws.

Operating in more than 150 countries thanks to our 8,000 employees worldwide, we are now the number one skincare company in Europe and are accelerating our development on all other continents, particularly in Asia and the Americas.

In line with our dual CSR mission of ‚ÄòCaring for people, caring for the planet‚Äô we take pride in offering a rewarding yet challenging work environment where everyone can thrive.

This culture allowed us to achieve the certification of Forbes' World‚Äôs Best Employers 2024, Forbes' World‚Äôs Best Employers 2024 for Women.

  

To learn more about our group and our commitments to people, visit www.groupeclarins.com.

  

**Equal opportunity employer**

We believe in making life more beautiful for our employees and our customers.

  

Inclusion and diversity are firmly grounded in our core values. We strive to achieve inclusiveness, and we foster an equal-opportunity culture where everyone can reach their full potential and do their best

work.

  

We welcome applications from all backgrounds and are a member of the ILO (International Labor Organization) and the Employers Network for Equity and Inclusion (ENEI).
