title: Sustainability Manager International
description:
Job Purpose

The Sustainability Manager, International, leads the development and implementation of sustainability strategies across international markets (EMEA and Asia Pacific), in alignment with the global sustainability strategy and in close collaboration with the global sustainability team.

A glimpse of your daily mission

(1) Leads the effective strategic development, integration, and reporting of sustainability requirements and ambitions within Haworth International, including policies, strategies, and performance objectives. Leads the implementation of Haworth's 2025 sustainability strategy in International together with internal and external stakeholders globally.
(2) Leads implementation of sustainability program and reporting across the entire value chain from sustainable product design, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics, until the management of used products with functional leaders and cross-functional teams in International. Provides expert advice and works actively with cross-functional teams in developing and implementing sustainability plans and initiatives.
a. Drives sustainable product design efforts including product sustainability transparency (data gathering, lifecycle assessments, product declarations) and certification (related to indoor air quality, comprehensive sustainability LEVEL, etc) by internally partnering with Product Line Management, Engineering, and Sourcing.
b. Drives responsible sourcing initiatives including material and supplier transparency, exclusion of banned chemicals, promotion of more sustainable materials and processes, supplier reviews, audits, and development.
c. Drives sustainable operations initiatives including zero waste to landfill, energy reduction, renewable energy, sustainable wood, packaging, and circular services.
d. Leads carbon transparency and accountability initiatives.
e. Encourages people and community initiatives.
(3) Identifies relevant trends, risks, opportunities, and works in partnership with external stakeholders. Maintains networking and research efforts to ensure best practices and innovations in sustainability, regulatory compliance issues, certifications, and trends that impact Haworth as sustainability leader. Actively networks Haworth in organizations promoting sustainability.
(4) Acts as the spokesperson and business partner for sustainability within the EMEA and AP markets. Demonstrates to our customers our ability to inspire on future perspectives. Provides strategic sustainability knowledge and support for large current and potential customers. Provides occasionally sustainability consultancy to Haworth affiliates within the broader Haworth family.
(5) Leads and promotes implementation according to sustainability standards like UN Global Compact, SDGs, GRI, CDP, ESG, ISO 26000, LEED, WELL.
(6) Leads integrated management system certification according to ISO 9001, 14001, 45001 (QEHS) in EMEA, and corporate assessments. Creates and continually updates policies and procedures. Contributes to the organization‚Äôs culture of opportunity and risk management. By deputy leads the environmental management for Haworth in Germany, incl. the PEFC chain of custody.
(7) Leads gathering and provision of environmental, safety and other technical sustainability information for decision-making and continuous improvement. Leads sustainability content and communication materials for global sustainability reporting, corporate assessments such as EcoVadis, existing and potential client information requests, and member engagement.
(8) Provides leadership and expert advice, reviews strengths and opportunities to develop strategies to build best in class frameworks. Promotes a culture of excellence in achieving sustainability objectives throughout the organization by promoting continual use of the policies and procedures, establishing and implementing training programs, by monitoring compliance, and by fostering a sustainability and continuous improvement mindset. Leads sustainability trainings to internal and external stakeholders, develops knowledge and knowhow on sustainability across the organization.
(9) Leads and conducts sustainability and QEHS audits of selected key suppliers in collaboration with sourcing and quality.
(10) Leads direct and indirect Sustainability budget, and teams‚Äô relationships in Haworth International‚Äôs functional and matrix organization.


Your Qualifications

(1) Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent professional qualification in sustainability management, business administration, engineering, environmental management, health & safety, or a related field.
(2) Substantial professional experience (typically 10 years or more) in sustainability, environmental management, or related disciplines, preferably within manufacturing or industrial environments.
(3) Proven leadership experience (approximately 5 years or more), including managing teams and operating effectively in matrix and cross‚Äëfunctional organizational structures.
(4) Demonstrated experience supporting regional or international operations, with a strong track record of developing and implementing sustainability strategies across multiple markets.
(5) Strong technical knowledge and practical experience in sustainability‚Äërelated areas such as:
a. Life‚Äëcycle assessment and materials sustainability
b. Responsible sourcing and chain‚Äëof‚Äëcustody frameworks (e.g. FSC, PEFC)
c. Manufacturing and engineering processes
d. Management systems and standards (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 45001)
e. Sustainable building standards (e.g. LEED, WELL)
(6) Sound understanding and application of relevant legal, regulatory, and policy frameworks related to sustainability, including environment, energy, waste, packaging, chemicals, ethics, and transparency.
(7) Strong stakeholder‚Äëmanagement, communication, and influencing skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse internal and external stakeholders across regions.
(8) Demonstrated project and process management capability, including setting and achieving objectives, managing budgets, tracking key performance indicators, and delivering measurable outcomes.
(9) Experience in auditing or assessment activities related to sustainability, quality, environment, or health & safety (QEHS) is advantageous.
(10) Proficiency in commonly used digital tools and business software relevant to sustainability reporting, analysis, and project management.
(11) Professional proficiency in English and German is required. Knowledge of additional languages is an advantage for regional and international collaboration.

About Us

Haworth is one of the world's largest manufacturers of office furniture, providing solutions for tomorrow's customers worldwide. At the center of our work is the human being: What does a person need to work, what pushes them, motivate them and what makes people feel comfortable at work? Only if we can answer that question, we are able to introduce designs to our customers that will make them achieve their goals. To stay one step ahead, we invest in our own research, have a worldwide network of interesting partners and are part of think tanks around the world who are trying to think ahead. The family-owned company, headquartered in Holland, Michigan/United States, employs more than 8.000 people and is represented in more than 150 countries in Asia, Europe and America with subsidiaries and partners.

title: Associate Director of Human Resources in the Human Resources Office
company: City University of Hong Kong È¶ôÊ∏ØÂüéÂ∏ÇÂ§ßÂ≠∏
description:
Reporting to the Director of Human Resources, the Associate Director plays a pivotal role in shaping HR initiatives to advance the University‚Äôs academic mission, research excellence and operational goals. This role drives comprehensive HR leadership across faculty, research and administrative functions while championing digital innovation, talent sustainability and organisational agility in a dynamic higher education environment.

The Associate Director is expected to work closely with the University leadership to deliver integrated HR strategies encompassing talent acquisition, faculty affairs, total rewards, performance management, learning and development ecosystems and employee experience. In addition to formulating competitive and equitable HR policies, guidelines and programs to attract, develop and retain high-calibre talent, the Associate Director will foster a culture of high performance, inclusion and innovation by leading HR teams, change management efforts and cross-functional projects aligned with institutional priorities.

### **Requirements**

Applicants should possess a Master‚Äôs/Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organisational Psychology or related discipline with proven experience in strategic HR leadership, academic personnel management and strategic transformation in higher education, public sector or large-scale organisations. Other essential qualities include:

* Deep expertise and understanding of regulatory requirements with knowledge of employment-related best practices;

* Outstanding communication skills with strong command of written and spoken English and Chinese (including Putonghua);

* Exceptional leadership acumen, influencing skills and ability to motivate staff, thriving in a fast-paced and matrixed settings;

* Proven track record in stakeholder engagement at C-suite level, building effective and collegial teams; and

* High standards of personal integrity, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.

Familiarity with labour legislations in Chinese Mainland, strong computer proficiency working in an IT-enabled environment, and prior experience in supporting committees will be advantageous.

### **Salary and Conditions of Service**

Remuneration package will be highly competitive, commensurate with qualifications and experience. Appointment will be made on a fixed-term contract; fringe benefits include gratuity, leave, medical and dental schemes.

### **Information and Application**

Further information on the post and the University is available at http://www.cityu.edu.hk, or from the Human Resources Office, City University of Hong Kong, Tat Chee Avenue, Kowloon Tong, Hong Kong [Email : hrojob@cityu.edu.hk/Fax : 2788 1154 or 3442 0311].

To apply, please submit an online application. The closing date is **1 February 2026**. Applications will receive full consideration and only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. The University‚Äôs privacy policy is available on the homepage.

*City University of Hong Kong is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to the principle of diversity. Personal data provided by applicants will be used for recruitment and other employment-related purposes.*

title: PRODUCT PF ASSOCIATE
description:
**Excited to grow your career?**

BBVA is a global company with more than 160 years of history that operates in more than 25 countries where we serve more than 80 million customers. We are more than 121,000 professionals working in multidisciplinary teams with profiles as diverse as financiers, legal experts, data scientists, developers, engineers and designers.

**About the job:**

We are seeking a motivated professional to join our Structured Finance team as an Analyst or Associate. In this role, you will support the origination, structuring and execution of structured finance transactions, incorporating both Project Finance (with a primary focus on energy, infrastructure, and TMT sectors) and Asset Finance (aviation and shipping). The position is based in Hong Kong, where you will contribute to expanding our activities in the Asia-Pacific region, working closely with senior team members, clients, and internal stakeholders to deliver tailored financing solutions. This position offers hands-on experience in complex deals within a fast-paced market, providing a strong foundation for career growth in sustainable and innovative financings.

Key Responsibilities:

* Origination Support : assist in identifying and evaluating new business opportunities in Structured Finance, encompassing Project Finance (energy, infrastructure and TMT) and Asset Finance (aviation and shipping). Help prepare marketing materials and build relationships with clients, lenders and advisors to contribute to a growing pipeline of transactions.
* Transaction Execution Support : participate in the execution of deals, including financial modelling, due diligence, structuring, credit analysis and documentation (terms sheets, commitment letters, credit agreements, etc). Preparation of credit papers, collaborating with risk, legal, tax and compliance teams to ensure efficient processes.
* Market Research and Analysis : conduct research on market trends, regulatory developments, and competitive dynamics in the energy, infrastructure, TMT, aviation and shipping industries. Prepare reports and presentations to support senior management in identifying opportunities and risks in the Asia Pacific region.
* Client Support : assist in managing client relationships by preparing customized financing proposals and materials that align with client objectives. Contribute to fostering long-term partnerships.
* Team Collaboration : work alongside senior team members on cross-functional projects, provide analytical support, and help ensure compliance with the bank‚Äôs policies, ESG principles, and international standards.
* Risk Assessment : support the evaluation of credit, operational, and market risks in Structured Finance transactions, aiding in the development of risk mitigation strategies.

Qualification & Experience

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, Engineering or related disciplines
* 2 to 5 years of working experience in Structured Finance or related roles

Knowledge & Skills

* Good understanding of the APAC Project and Asset finance markets and industry best practices
* Experience in the origination and execution of Structured Finance loan transactions
* Strong credit and risk analysis skills
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively to deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines
* Excellent presentation and analytical skills
* Well-organized and detail-oriented
* Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and AI analytical tools

Language

* Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish or Mandarin (or other Asian languages) will be viewed favourably.

### ***Job Posting***

### ***BBVA Hong Kong will conduct a background check on you in accordance with the Mandatory Reference Checking (MRC) Scheme regulated by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA). Should any discrepancy identified or deemed unsatisfactory to us, we reserve the rights to terminate your employment in such case. (*** ***FAQs for In-Scope Individual*** ***:*** ***https://www.hkab.org.hk/files/page/page-content/79/FAQs\\_for\\_In-Scope\\_Individuals\\_(24\\_July\\_2025)-1753348029.pdf*** ***)***

**Skills:**

Credit Risk Analysis

title: Part-time Research Assistant ‚Äì Department of Social Science
company: THE HANG SENG UNIVERSITY OF HONG KONG
description:
**About the University**

The Hang Seng University of Hong Kong (HSUHK) is a non-profit private liberal-arts-oriented university with six Schools (Business, Communication, Decision Sciences, Humanities and Social Science, Translation and Foreign Languages, and Transdisciplinary Studies), and over 7,000 full-time undergraduate and postgraduate students. With its unique ‚ÄúLiberal + Professional‚Äù education model, HSUHK nurtures young talent with critical thinking, innovative minds, caring attitudes, moral values and social responsibility.

Aspiring to be a leading private university in the region, HSUHK prioritises stellar undergraduate education, top-quality faculty members, award-winning green campus facilities, innovative degree programmes, a unique residential college system that combines living and learning, interactive small-class teaching, close student-teacher relationships, impactful research, and excellent student development and support services.

HSUHK also ranked 7th (overall) in the ASEAN+ region, the 1st in the Greater China region, the 1st in Employability, the 3rd in Research and the 5th in Community Engagement as per the 2023 AppliedHE ASEAN+ private university ranking by the Singapore-based AppliedHE. Additionally, HSUHK was ranked among the top 200 worldwide on ‚ÄúQuality Education‚Äù and ‚ÄúDecent Work and Economic Growth‚Äù in the Times Higher Education University Impact Rankings 2021.

HSUHK has earned international recognition across multiple prestigious ranking exercises. In the AppliedHE‚Äôs ALL ASIA Private University Ranking 2026, it secured 7th place in the Greater China region. It also ranked 22nd in Social Sciences and Humanities and 33rd in Economics and Finance among China‚Äôs top universities in the Research.com Top Universities and Top Scientists Rankings 2025. The MSc in Global Supply Chain Management programme achieved 84th place globally in the QS International Trade Rankings 2025. Additionally, HSUHK‚Äôs School of Business obtained AACSB International accreditation, a mark of excellence held by only 6% of the world‚Äôs leading business schools.

The University now invites application for the following position to work in the Research Project ‚ÄúGlobal Energy Transition in the Uncertain Age of Climate Change Governance‚Äù, funded by the Research Grants Council:

**Part-time Research Assistant ‚Äì Department of Social Science**  
**(Ref: PTRA (SSC ‚Äì UGC/IIDS14/H04/25) 2026-01-23)**

**Responsibilities**

* manage the Call for Papers process, including tracking abstracts, consolidating submissions, and maintaining organised records;
* conduct background research to support keynote preparation;
* assist with the preparation of project and conference materials, reports, and documentation;
* support event logistic and coordination, such as scheduling sessions, arranging venues or virtual platforms, and completing assigned tasks; and
* assist with administrative tasks, including managing emails, handling registrations, and tracking expenses.

**Applicants Should**

* preferably possess a master‚Äôs degree with at least 1 year of working experience in event, conference, or academic-related event coordination;
* have strong organisational and administrative skills, attention to details and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently;
* have a strong command of both written and spoken English and Chinese; and
* be passionate about organising events.

..................................................................................................................................................................

Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Interested applicant should visit this link https://recruit.hsu.edu.hk/ and apply on or before **8 February 2026**. The University reserves the right not to fill the position in this exercise.

Applicants who are not invited to an interview within three months may consider their applications unsuccessful. All information received will be treated in strict confidence, and the data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. The Personal Information Collection Statement will be provided upon request.

*The Hang Seng University of Hong Kong, incorporated in Hong Kong with limited liability by guarantee, is an equal opportunity employer.*

Apply Now!

title: SHEQ Officer
description:
### **How you can make your mark**

Make your mark by ensuring safe, compliant and efficient offshore operations. In this role, you act as the vital link between our vessels and the office, overseeing safety and coordinating logistical activities to support uninterrupted operations. You ensure full compliance with applicable regulations and maintain vessel documentation to the highest standards. As a trusted backup officer, you are ready to support crane barges offshore when required.

By actively contributing to our organization‚Äôs quality, safety and environmental management system, you play a key role in our culture of continuous improvement. Within your scope of responsibility, you consistently apply company policies and procedures to safeguard people, assets and the environment.

**Your responsibilities as a SHEQ Officer:**

* Manage and maintain vessel documentation, certification, inventory, crew training matrix and safety communications for all owned and chartered vessels.
* Provide operational and safety support to vessels through regular onboard visits, assisting with maintenance routines, audits, surveys, and compliance.
* Support safe lifting operations by contributing to risk assessments (RA), JHA and procedures, and by tracking the status and certification of lifting gear.
* Coordinate vessel logistics and planning, including scheduling, job numbers, vessel movements, yard entry permit/ permit to work (PTW) and tug arrangements in liaison with relevant stakeholders.
* Support the Logistics Manager and collaborate with SHE‚ÄëQ on safety initiatives, training, vessel safety surveillance check/ periodic vessel safety inspection visits and continuous improvement in line with NINA principles.
* Implement and enforce company HSE policies, procedures, and safety management systems onboard vessels and at worksite and offshore.

**Your qualities**

You can make your mark as a SHEQ Officer if you have:

* A diploma or certification related to Marine Studies, Engineering, Occupational Safety & Health, or any relevant field. *Candidates with Deck/Engine Certificate of Competency will have an added advantage.*
* Safety or risk‚Äëmanagement related training (e.g., bizSAFE, NEBOSH, ISO-related courses).  
  *If you do not have these yet, you must be willing to attend training sponsored or arranged by the company.*

* Experience working onboard marine vessels, crane barges, or similar environments is beneficial but not required.
* New entrants with strong interest in marine operations and safety are encouraged to apply.

* Awareness of IMO conventions (e.g., SOLAS, MLC, ISPS, MARPOL) is helpful. *Training will be provided for candidates without prior knowledge.*
* Basic understanding of Safety Management Systems‚Äîor willingness to learn how they are implemented and used within a company.
* Good communication skills, teamwork, and proactive attitude towards safety.

### **We offer**

**What you can expect**

* Career opportunities: We challenge you every day to get better. Together we realize your full personal and professional career by creating development opportunities.
* Warm welcome: We warmly welcome our new colleagues, so they feel at home as soon as possible. During your online onboarding program, we give you all the ins and outs of Boskalis!
* Career development: Plenty of opportunities to realize your full potential. Challenge yourself with (online) courses in our Asian Lift/ Boskalis academy.

**Extra information**

* Your team: You are part of a team of Logistics (SHEQ) team based in Singapore.
* Full/part-time job: The function of SHE officer is a fulltime position.
* Procedure: All you need to do to apply for a job is to complete the online application form and send it to us along with your CV and cover letter. As soon as you have sent your application, you will receive a confirmation email. Depending on the job, we will invite you for two or more interviews via Microsoft Teams or at our office. If both sides are happy to proceed after interviews, we will make you an offer to join Boskalis . After successfully completing all the steps in the procedure, we warmly welcome you to our organization.

### **About Boskalis**

Working at Boskalis is about creating new horizons and sustainable solutions. In a world where population growth, an increase of global trade, demand for (new) energy and climate change are driving forces, we challenge you to make your mark in finding innovative and relevant solutions for complex infrastructural and marine projects.

Within a vibrant company culture, you will be working as part of a diverse, international team of experts. We offer you the opportunity to realize your full personal potential and expand your professional career by creating new horizons. Together!

### **Interested?**

We‚Äôll be happy to answer your questions about the position of SHEQ Officer. Please contact Catherine Buenaagua, corporate recruiter via our careers page.

**Interested?** Please apply by filling in your details and by uploading your cover letter and CV on our careers site.

***Disclaimer for recruitment and selection agencies***

*We appreciate your interest in our vacancies and understand that your candidate might be enthusiastic about this exciting opportunity. However, our recruitment process is not structured this way, at Boskalis we handle recruitment ourselves. Therefore we do not accept unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment agencies. Any submission will be treated as a direct application.*

*Please note: Boskalis never requests a financial contribution to arrange visas or other documents related to a job vacancy. Be wary of individuals who pretend to be our recruiters and do ask for such contributions.*

title: Manager M&A and CVC
description:
At Belimo, we shape the future of building technology through innovation, sustainability, and a strong company culture.
  
  
As Manager M&A and CVC, you will play a key role in driving Belimo‚Äôs growth by identifying strategic opportunities, executing M&A transactions, and fostering innovation through Corporate Venture Capital investments. In this global role, you will combine strategic thinking with hands-on execution ‚Äî from screening and evaluating potential targets to leading financial modelling, due diligence, and integration planning. Working closely with senior leadership and cross-functional teams, you will help ensure that each transaction and investment creates lasting value for Belimo and strengthens our position as a trusted industry leader. Your office will be in Hong Kong and you will report directly to the Head M&A and CVC in Switzerland.
  
  
What You'll Do
  
Systematically seek out potential M&A and CVC targets in line with Belimo's strategy by monitoring industry trends, market developments, and competitor activities, maintaining a funnel of potential targets and evaluate opportunistic M&A and CVC situations, with a focus on the region Asia Pacific
  
Prepare internal approval documentation, owning the financial modelling, evaluate and quantify synergies, transaction and integration costs
  
Lead the due diligence process and coordinating the functional workstreams and external advisors, ensuring due diligence findings are addressed appropriately, and achieving signing and closing
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop integration plans to ensure a seamless integration, supporting the integration project management office
  
Monitor and manage the company's portfolio of CVC investments, track performance and provide regular reports to stakeholders
  
Who You Are
  
Master degree in business, finance, IT, engineering or a related field. A professional degree - like CFA or CPA - is a plus
  
Several years of experience with M&A and/or CVC transactions, financial modeling, due diligence, legal documentation, separation and integration
  
Collaborative and trustworthy personality with high integrity
  
Analytical, structured, and fact-based problem-solving skills
  
Strong English proficiency required
  
Strong project management skills and the ability to work independently
  
Who We Are
  
  
At Belimo, we take pride in making our company a rewarding place to work. Our leaders are value-driven and encourage new ideas in their teams around the world. Through our passion, our employees are not only creating amazing products, they are revolutionizing the HVAC industry. Investing in our people is at the heart of Belimo's approach to engaging diverse creative talent to grow an industry-leading company. The success of our corporate brand is based on the expertise and commitment of each individual.
company_description: Belimo is the global market leader in the development, production, and sales of field devices for the energy-efficient control of HVAC systems. We employ approx. 2,000 people in over 80 countries.

title: Assistant Manager - Global Operations Standards
description:
Assistant Manager - Global Operations Standards (Ref: 2600003M)

**Responsibilities**

* Implement strategic actions for the development of Global Operations Standards (GOS) to promote MTR‚Äôs brand promises for adaptation in all global operations hubs in driving continuous improvement, excellence and sustainability in the transport industry
* Develop, implement and monitor Global Operations Standards Institute (GOSI) collaboration, oversee knowledge management and sharing platforms for facilitating effective knowledge management of railway operations across Hong Kong Transport Services, Chinese Mainland and all overseas hubs
* Plan, organize and conduct regular meetings/workshops/visits with Hong Kong Transport Services Business Unit, Chinese Mainland and all overseas hubs for reviewing and assuring observance of GOS
* Identify, distil and deliver knowledge pertinent to railway benchmarking, relevant studies and reports to facilitate adoption of best practices, disseminate benchmarking reports to line managers as appropriate
* Manage the GOSI professional training and qualification programmes and coordinate the professional development and coaching projects among Operations & Maintenance (O&M) hubs
* Implement the research and development of the GOS assessment framework which could identify improvement opportunities and facilitate the effective implementation of GOS
* Support communication with internal stakeholders and collaboration with external stakeholders in promoting benchmarking and GOSI initiatives

**Requirements**

* Degree in Management / Engineering / Science or a related discipline
* A minimum of 5 years‚Äô relevant experience, of which 1 year should be at supervisory level
* Good understanding of railway engineering and operations management systems
* Familiarization of training & development and/or standards development framework
* Proficiency in both written and spoken English & Chinese (including Cantonese & Mandarin)

**Applications**

You are invited to apply online via http://www.mtr.com.hk/mtr\\_job\\_en or send in your CV stating the position (with reference number) you are applying for by mail to Human Resource Management Department, MTR Corporation, G.P.O. Box 9916, Hong Kong on or before **6 February 2026**.

For other job openings, please visit MTR Corporation‚Äôs website for more details.

All information provided by applicants will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purpose only. All personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for 12 months for future recruitment purpose and will then be destroyed.

title: Volunteer Manager
description:
Passionate about making a difference? Lead impactful initiatives, build community partnerships, and create meaningful connections. Be the driving force behind volunteer engagement, CSR events, and community outreach!

**What difference can you make?**

Inspire and engage a vibrant volunteer network.  
Build lasting partnerships with corporate and community stakeholders.  
Lead dynamic outreach and volunteer appreciation events.  
Shape impactful volunteer engagement programmes with your creativity and vision.

**What will you need to thrive in the role?**

title: Senior Executive ‚Äì Communications
description:
**Ready to bring passion into your career?**

Clarins Group is a trusted French family-owned company, a leader in skincare and make-up, operating in more than 150 countries.

We are looking for a **Senior Executive ‚Äì Communications.**

**About the Job**

Reporting to the Associate Brand Director, the Senior Executive, Communications is responsible for driving the brand‚Äôs visibility, desirability, and reputation in Singapore. The role leads the planning, execution, and amplification of communication initiatives that strengthen engagement across media, influencers, makeup artists (MUAs), customers, stakeholders, and the wider public.

This role collaborates closely with internal Marketing teams (including Marketing & Trade, SEA Media, eCommerce & CRM) to integrate communication strategies into all launches and campaigns. Externally, the role manages key partners across PR, social media, media agencies, and influencers to ensure cohesive, high-performing communication activities that maximize brand awareness, earned impact, and content quality.

  

**Mission 1:** **Digital Marketing and Advertising**

* Support the Associate Brand Director and collaborate with the SEA Media Manager on full-funnel media planning for Singapore, ensuring strong support for omni-channel franchise launches and brand-building initiatives.
* Liaise with creative agencies to prepare and adapt assets for media buys across platforms such as Instagram, Facebook, Google Display Network, YouTube, and emerging channels.
* Ensure all communication assets fulfil brand guidelines, storytelling objectives, and platform requirements.

  

**Mission 2:****Social Media Management**

* Lead the social media agency to plan, create, and manage social content in alignment with the Marketing Calendar for Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and other relevant social media platforms.
* Develop in-house content (e.g., reels, short-form videos, behind-the-scenes content) as needed to support brand storytelling and agility.
* Strategize monthly franchise content plans aimed at driving awareness, enhancing brand affinity, and acquiring new followers.
* Monitor fan growth, engagement, and retention to meet KPIs and optimize performance.
* Analyse content and platform insights through digital dashboards and tools to refine strategy and inform action plans.
* Coach and mentor the Marketing Executive to ensure strong execution and development of social media capabilities.

  

**Mission 3: Public Relations and Influencer Marketing**

* Communicante launch calendars and work with PR agencies to plan and execute press strategies that enhance brand reputation and expand reach.
* Track and monitor MIV achievements, ensuring sufficient activation volume, relevance, and quality of PR & KOL efforts to meet KPIs.
* Collaborate with PR agencies to draft compelling media releases for product launches, brand initiatives, CSR stories, and corporate updates.
* Pitch proactively for digital, social, and print coverage that strengthens the brand narrative and secures earned media opportunities.
* Conceptualize creative press kits, curate targeted seeding lists, and oversee the execution of all product launch seeding programs.
* Manage media requests, spa and product needs, and maintain updated media relations databases.
* Oversee end-to-end management of in-house paid influencer campaigns, from briefing and negotiation to content review and performance tracking.
* Build and nurture close relationships with key media, influencers, and KOLs to drive advocacy and organic coverage.
* Guide the Marketing Executive to ensure timely execution of press kits, seeding logistics, and reporting

  

**Mission 4: Competitive Intelligence**

* Support the Associate Brand Director in driving agency partners toward operational excellence, creativity, and innovation in communication delivery.
* Review monthly agency reports for internal and global reporting, ensuring insights and learnings are translated into actionable next steps.
* Lead campaign briefings, track performance results, and ensure agencies deliver on KPIs and timelines.
* Participate in annual planning and evaluation with agency partners to support evolving business goals and future growth.

  

**Mission 5 : Administrative duties**

* Manage Workday and expenses tracking with accuracy and timely submissions.
* Maintain and update expense Work-In-Progress (WIP) files alongside the Associate Brand Director to ensure budget visibility and compliance.
* Support internal documentation, reporting, and ad-hoc administrative needs tied to the communications function.

  

**About you:**

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or a related field.
* 4‚Äì6 years of experience in PR, communications, influencer marketing, digital media, or social media management‚Äîideally within beauty, lifestyle, luxury, or FMCG industries.
* Strong understanding of media landscapes, influencer ecosystems, and local social media trends.
* Experience managing agencies and external partners with strong project management discipline.
* Strong writing skills with the ability to craft compelling narratives across channels.
* Data-driven mindset with proficiency in content analytics and social performance tools.
* Creative, resourceful, and detail-oriented, with strong stakeholder management capabilities.
* Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

  

**About the benefits:**

* 72 years of expertise in beauty and spa, with the Clarins and myBlend brands
* Unique products and innovative services
* A commitment to Social & Environmental Responsibility embedded in our raison d'√™tre
* A caring and inclusive corporate culture
* Development and training opportunities
* Attractive compensation and benefits
* A flexible work environment, with up to 1 day of remote working per week

  

If you have a curious mind, a thirst to go further and the drive to boldly take on new challenges, join us.

  

**About Clarins Group**

A *B-Corp certified* global leading skincare and make-up company, Clarins group is the embodiment of a committed family history, with a fierce passion for innovation and spirit of independence. Our purpose "making life more beautiful, passing on a more beautiful planet," is a core commitment outlined in our by-laws.

Operating in more than 150 countries thanks to our 8,000 employees worldwide, we are now the number one skincare company in Europe and are accelerating our development on all other continents, particularly in Asia and the Americas.

In line with our dual CSR mission of ‚ÄòCaring for people, caring for the planet‚Äô we take pride in offering a rewarding yet challenging work environment where everyone can thrive.

This culture allowed us to achieve the certification of Forbes' World‚Äôs Best Employers 2024, Forbes' World‚Äôs Best Employers 2024 for Women.

  

To learn more about our group and our commitments to people, visit www.groupeclarins.com.

  

**Equal opportunity employer**

We believe in making life more beautiful for our employees and our customers.

  

Inclusion and diversity are firmly grounded in our core values. We strive to achieve inclusiveness, and we foster an equal-opportunity culture where everyone can reach their full potential and do their best

work.

  

We welcome applications from all backgrounds and are a member of the ILO (International Labor Organization) and the Employers Network for Equity and Inclusion (ENEI).

title: Private Equity Investment Analyst/Associate
description:
This opportunity is ideal for a high‚Äëperforming investment banking analyst who wants to transition from transaction support to true ownership investing.

As a Private Equity Investment Associate, you will move beyond ‚Äúexecution only‚Äù work and gain direct exposure to how professional investors think, decide and create value over time. You will be embedded in live deals, contributing to investment theses, shaping valuation judgments, and seeing how commercial and strategic decisions impact long‚Äëterm outcomes.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Conduct market research, industry analysis, and due diligence on potential investment opportunities.
* Build and maintain financial models to evaluate investment performance and returns.
* Prepare investment memos, presentations, and reports for internal committees and external stakeholders.
* Monitor portfolio companies, track performance metrics, and assist in value creation initiatives.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
* Over 2 years of hands-on deal execution experience in investment banking.
* Strong financial modeling, valuation, and analytical skills.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, Mandarin/Cantonese.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
* Commercial mindset with interest in long‚Äëterm investing

If you are interested in exploring more of this role or other potential opportunities, let's connect today via WhatsApp or WeChat: **+852 5424 6512.**

Candidates not selected for this position may be considered for other opportunities that better align with their experience.

All personal data collected will be used exclusively for recruitment purposes and managed in strict compliance with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance.

title: Manager/ Associate Manager (CSR), Corporate Communications
company: HONG KONG INSTITUTE OF CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS
description:
**The Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants** is recognized globally as the pre-eminent
  
body of top-tier accountants that leads and serves businesses and the public interest of Hong Kong. At
  
the Institute, we say a CPA is a "success ingredient" in a career, in the business world, and in society as
  
a whole. In building a strong accounting profession, the Institute helps to establish and continuously
  
enhance Hong Kong's reputation as a world-class financial centre.

**MANAGER/ASSOCIATE MANAGER (CSR), CORPORATE COMMUNICATIONS**  
**[Ref: M/AM(CSR)-CC]**

**Role Overview**

We are inviting a high-calibre professional to join us as **Manager/Associate Manager (CSR), Corporate**

**Communications** to spearhead the formation and growth of our dedicated volunteer team and CSR

initiatives, mobilizing our members to drive impactful community service and engagement activities.

**Roles and Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement a comprehensive charity and CSR strategy aligned with corporate objectives.

* Lead end-to-end project management for large-scale community events, flagship service days, and

the annual appreciation ceremony

* Architect the recruitment, onboarding, and retention strategy to scale the volunteer team.

* Oversee database management to track service hours, skills, and engagement levels, ensuring

optimal resource allocation and effective matching of volunteers to community initiatives.

* Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including NGO partners, schools,

government bodies, professional organizations and business community. Act as the primary liaison

to identify collaboration opportunities that align with the Institute‚Äôs values and strategic goals.

* Develop and maintain an impact measurement framework to quantify the social value of HKICPA‚Äôs

CSR efforts. Manage the volunteer recognition system, including digital certification, to acknowledge
  
member contributions effectively.

* Develop engaging multimedia content to effectively communicate CSR initiatives and their impact to

internal and external audiences, contributing to the Institute‚Äôs broader branding strategy.

* Manage the annual CSR budget, ensuring effective utilization of funds and compliance with

procurement policies.

* Assist in other corporate events and community outreach initiatives as assigned.

* Perform any other duties as assigned by supervisor.

**Qualifications and Required Attributes**

* Degree holder preferably in Marketing, Communications, Social Sciences, Business Management or

related discipline.

* Minimum 6 - 8 years of relevant experience in CSR, corporate philanthropy, NGO management, or

volunteer management. Candidates with less experience may be considered for the Assistant

Manager position.

* Strong network within the NGO and charity sector.

* Proven track record in designing and managing large-scale volunteer programmes or community

projects; experience in impact reporting and ESG metrics is preferred.

* Experience with professional body volunteering or membership organizations is an advantage.

* Strong project management skills with the ability to handle complex logistics, risk assessments, and

multi-stakeholder relationships

* Excellent command of written and spoken English and Chinese (Cantonese and Putonghua).

* Proficient in MS Office applications; familiarity with CRM or volunteer management databases is an

advantage.

* Passionate about community service, self-motivated, and capable of working independently under

pressure to meet tight deadlines.

* Flexible and willing to work outside regular office hours for community events and volunteer

activities as required.

Applications should be marked "**Confidential**" quoting the reference **[Ref: M/AM(CSR)-CC]** with full
  
details of education, work experience, present and expected salaries, contact telephone number and
  
earliest date available. Please apply in writing to the **Head of Human Resources, Hong Kong**  
**Institute of Certified Public Accountants, 37/F, Wu Chung House, 213 Queen‚Äôs Road East, Wan**  
**Chai, Hong Kong or by email to hr@hkicpa.org.hk**.  
  
  
  
*Personal data provided will be used for recruitment purpose only.*  
*For more information, please visit our website at www.hkicpa.org.hk.*

title: Manager / Senior Manager (Sustainability)
description:
About ALPS

ALPS - a subsidiary of SingHealth, was set up in 2018 as part of Ministry of Health‚Äôs (MOH) strategic thrust in delivering value-based supply chain solutions to public healthcare.


As the public healthcare supply chain agency, we design and execute a national level end-to-end supply chain blueprint in partnership with 27 Public Healthcare Institutions (PHIs) in Singapore.


Our employees are key to our excellence ‚Äì the heartbeat in sustaining our mission, developing new capabilities and re-engineering processes to future-proof Singapore‚Äôs healthcare supply chain landscape ‚Äì making it more sustainable and resilient.


About The Role


We are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team in the public healthcare sector as a Sustainability Lead. This role will be instrumental in advancing our organization's commitment to sustainability by leading initiatives in green procurement, conducting lifecycle carbon assessments (LCA), decarbonizing clinical practices, and leveraging behavioral science to drive environmentally responsible procurement outcomes.


Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement strategies for integrating environmental considerations into procurement processes, ensuring the selection of sustainable products and services.
  • Collaborate with vendors and suppliers to identify and source environmentally friendly alternatives to current procurement practices.
  • Monitor and evaluate procurement activities to measure progress towards net zero goals and identify areas for improvement.
  • Conduct comprehensive LCAs to analyze the environmental impact of products and processes throughout their lifecycle within the healthcare system.
  • Utilize LCA findings to inform decision-making, identify opportunities for carbon reduction, and optimize resource utilization.
  • Work cross-functionally with various departments to integrate LCA data into procurement decisions and clinical practices.
  • Lead initiatives to reduce carbon emissions associated with clinical operations, including energy consumption, waste management, and transportation.
  • Collaborate with healthcare professionals to implement sustainable practices and technologies that minimize environmental impact while maintaining quality patient care.
  • Provide guidance and support for the adoption of green technologies and practices in clinical settings.
  • Apply principles of behavioral science to influence stakeholders' attitudes and behaviors towards environmentally sustainable practices.
  • Design and implement educational programs, training sessions, and communication campaigns to promote awareness and engagement in green procurement and sustainability initiatives.
  • Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of behavioral interventions, adjusting strategies as needed to achieve desired outcomes.

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in environmental science, sustainability, public health, health economics, pharmaceutical or related field (Master's degree preferred).
  • Experience in procurement, sustainability, or healthcare management, with a focus on environmental sustainability preferred.
  • Knowledge of lifecycle assessment methodologies and carbon accounting principles.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and communicate findings effectively.
  • Familiarity with behavioral science theories and techniques for influencing organizational behavior.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration, and project management skills.
  • Passion for environmental sustainability and a commitment to promoting positive change within the healthcare sector.

By submitting any application or resume to us, you will be deemed to have agreed and consented to us collecting, using, retaining and disclosing your information to potential hiring managers for their consideration. All information will be treated with highest confidentiality.


An exciting career awaits you at ALPS. Join us to embark on a meaning career that brings value and impact to the population. Apply now if that sounds like something you would like to be a part of.


Only shortlisted candidates would be notified.

title: Sustainability Data Analyst Intern
description:
**Title:** Sustainability Data Analyst Intern

**Location:** Singapore

Join a **growing and global team** focused on **measuring climate risks** and bringing new data and rating services to investors. As climate **physical and transition risks** increasingly impact investors‚Äô portfolios and corporate balance sheets, the need for **high-quality climate risk data and assessment tools** is rising.

EDHEC Climate Institute is looking for a **Sustainability Data Analyst Intern** to support our team in **collecting, processing, and analysing sustainability-related data** for infrastructure assets. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data extraction, carbon emissions analysis, and geospatial analysis.

Beyond core data processing tasks, the internship can be tailored to the candidate‚Äôs interests and expertise. This could include **research projects and case studies** on climate risk assessment and financial materiality analysis, allowing you to contribute meaningfully while expanding your expertise.

**Duration:** 3 to 6 months

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Data Collection & Cleaning:** Verify, clean, and structure sustainability- and climate-related data from reports and other sources.
* **Data Quality & Accuracy Checks:** Conduct detailed data validation and consistency checks to ensure high data quality across datasets.
* **Accuracy Verification:** Ensure the precision of extracted data, including asset attributes and boundaries.
* **Geospatial Analysis:** Use tools such as QGIS or ArcGIS to extract, review, and analyse asset boundaries and spatial data.
* **Knowledge Management & Documentation:** Support the setup and maintenance of team documentation, including Notion workspaces, internal wikis, and process guides to improve data workflows and knowledge sharing.

**Ideal Candidate**

We are looking for candidates who:

* Have a strong interest in sustainability, climate risks, and environmental data.
* Have some experience and/or a strong interest in climate-related research or data work.
* Are highly detail-oriented, with a strong eye for identifying data inconsistencies and errors.
* Are organised and methodical, with an interest in improving processes and documentation.
* At least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical curriculum such as computer science, finance, economics, or physics
* Can work independently, take ownership of tasks, and are eager to learn new skills.
* Preferably have basic proficiency in Python for data processing or analysis.
* **Preferably** have prior exposure to geospatial data and tools such as QGIS or ArcGIS.
* **Preferably** have experience setting up or maintaining documentation tools (e.g. Notion, Confluence, or internal wikis).

**What You‚Äôll Gain**

* Practical experience in sustainability data analysis and climate risk research.
* Hands-on exposure to geospatial analysis and real-world asset data.
* Experience working with data quality assurance and internal knowledge systems.
* A flexible internship experience tailored to your skills, interests, and performance.
* The opportunity to contribute meaningfully to a mission-driven and growing team.

  

**Interested?** Apply now by sending your resume (pdf format) and a brief statement of interest.

*Please note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 21 days, please assume your application has not been successful on this occasion.*

title: Project Officer (Strategic Collaboration)
description:
Centre for Climate Change and Environmental Health (CCEH) is a multidisciplinary research centre dedicated to understanding and mitigating the impacts of climate change on the environment and human health. The key objective is to investigate the driving mechanisms and develop effective solutions to safeguard ecosystem and human health in Southeast Asia. CCEH brings together leading experts in climate science, environmental engineering, and public health to tackle the region‚Äôs most pressing climate‚Äìhealth challenges through cutting-edge research, advanced modelling, and interdisciplinary collaboration. Through its integrative approach, CCEH aims to translate scientific insights into actionable strategies that promote sustainability, resilience, and well-being for current and future generations.

For more details, please view https://www.ntu.edu.sg/cceh.

We are looking for a Project Officer to support and coordinate a strategic collaboration between the Centre for Climate Change and Environmental Health (CCEH) and the WHO Asia Centre for Environment and Health (WHO ACE), including conference organization, report development, capacity-building activities, and administrative support for establishing a WHO Collaborating Centre at CCEH. The role will focus on planning and managing major CCEH-WHO joint events, coordinating multi-stakeholder scientific and policy reports, organizing regional training activities, supporting the WHO multi-city study, and ensuring smooth execution of tasks related to the WHO Collaborating Centre application.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate major CCEH-WHO meetings, including logistics, agenda preparation, communications, and follow-up documentation.

  • Assist in organizing regional capacity-building and training activities, including workshops and technical sessions tied to the major meetings.

  • Provide project management support, including communication with partners, timeline tracking, and preparation of supporting materials.

  • Facilitate communication and coordination among CCEH teams, WHO ACE staff, and external collaborators.

  • Provide administrative and operational support to ensure the smooth execution of all CCEH-WHO collaboration activities.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Public Health, Environmental Science, Geography, Public Policy, or related field.

  • At least 1-3 years of relevant experience in project coordination, event management, research administration, or working with government/international organizations.

  • Familiarity with environmental health, air quality, climate change, or public health-related projects will be an advantage.

  • Good written and oral communication skills to prepare reports, meeting notes, and professional correspondence for multi-stakeholder audiences.

  • Proficiency in common office software (e.g., MS Office, Excel, PowerPoint); experience with data compilation or document management is a plus.

  • Competent in soft skills such as information organization, document preparation, and professional communication with diverse partners.

We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Compliance & ESG Executive
description:
Job Purpose

The Compliance & ESG Executive supports the Compliance & ESG Manager in coordinating and maintaining the company‚Äôs Quality, Environmental, Health and Safety (QEHS)management systems and ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) initiatives. The role focuses on day‚Äëto‚Äëday coordination, data collection, documentation, and follow‚Äëup of compliance and sustainability activities, ensuring that operational departments fulfil their responsibilities under the established frameworks. The position assists in audits, reporting, and awareness programmes to help strengthen operational compliance, sustainability performance, and stakeholder engagement.

Key Responsibilities

QEHS Management Systems

  • Assist in maintaining QEHS management system documentation (policies, procedures, forms, and records), ensuring documents are current, properly filed, and accessible to process owners.‚Äã¬†¬†¬†
  • Support the planning and execution of internal QEHS audits by preparing audit checklists, coordinating schedules, gathering evidence, and documenting findings.
  • Follow up with departments on agreed corrective and preventive actions, update tracking logs, and prepare status summaries for Compliance & ESG Manager.
  • Help compile QEHS performance data and incident statistics for management review meetings and external certification audits.

ESG and Sustainability

  • Coordinate the collection of ESG and sustainability data (e.g. energy, water, waste, emissions, social and governance indicators) from relevant departments, and perform basic checks for completeness and accuracy.‚Äã
  • Assist in preparing sections of the annual Sustainability Report, including data tables, charts, and simple narrative descriptions as guided by Compliance & ESG Manager.
  • Support the monitoring of progress against ESG and sustainability targets by updating tracking sheets and dashboards and flagging delays or gaps to the Manager.
  • Help organise and promote corporate sustainability programmes such as carbon emissions tracking exercises, waste reduction campaigns, resource efficiency initiatives, and staff engagement activities.‚Äã

Compliance and Continuous Improvement

  • Maintain compliance registers, training records, and action‚Äëtracking logs related to QEHS and ESG requirements.
  • Assist in monitoring changes in regulatory, industry, and certification requirements by gathering circulars, guidelines, and external updates and summarising key points for the Manager.
  • Support and, where assigned,¬†conduct¬†compliance and sustainability awareness activities (e.g. toolbox talks, briefings, posters, intranet content) in line with materials and guidance provided by the Compliance & ESG Manager.
  • Provide administrative and coordination support for external audits, inspections, and certifications, including liaison with auditors and preparation of required documents.

Qualifications & Requirements

  • Diploma or Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Environmental Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or related field.
  • 2‚Äì3 years of relevant experience in QEHS, compliance, sustainability, or administrative roles; fresh graduates with strong interest in ESG and compliance may be considered.
  • Basic understanding of ISO management systems (9001, 14001, 45001) or willingness to learn through on‚Äëthe‚Äëjob training and courses.‚Äã¬†¬†¬†
  • Interest in ESG reporting, sustainability data management, and related frameworks (e.g. GRI, ISSB, national guidelines) is an advantage.‚Äã
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) with strong attention to detail in data entry and documentation.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with operations and support functions.
  • Organised, proactive, and willing to learn, with a positive attitude towards continuous improvement and sustainability.

title: ESG Program Manager (Bank) (JT)
description:
Job Title: ESG Program Manager (intermediate)

(Job code: MAX 4882)

(Work location: Central)

Job description

Overall View

The Programme Manager will oversee the delivery of the Bank‚Äôs ESG Ready Programme, a holistic programme to help clients build capacity and capabilities in sustainability.

In this role, the Programme Manager will be responsible for attracting and retaining participants to the programme, seeing them through their completion of the programme.

This will entail creating content as well as organising events and workshops to create thought leadership and disseminate information on sustainability to benefit an SME audience.

The Programme Manager will serve as the primary point of contact and account manager to a cohort of participating SMEs, assisting them in understanding the programme objectives and goals in participating in the programme, guiding enterprises on the registration process and addressing queries on the programme.

The Programme Manager will also serve as liaison with various programme partners, ensuring that they provide the necessary services to clients embarking on the programme. Furthermore, theProgramme Manager will be responsible for administrative claims with Enterprise Singapore.

Responsibilities

The primary role of the Programme Manager is to drive the execution of the Bank‚Äôs ESG Ready Programme.

In this role, responsibilities will include:

1.¬†¬†Leading client engagements and account management of a cohort of participating SMEs relating programme enrolment, administration, and claims for enterprises.

2.¬†¬†Creating guidelines, checklists, policies, procedures, and other related programme content, to align with best practices and frameworks.

3.¬†¬†¬†¬†Drafting content for programme publicity, success cases, insights on ESG- related topics.

4.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Organising events and workshops to attract and educate participants on ESG-related topics.

5.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Liaising with government agencies and partners to facilitate meetings, consultation sessions, workshops, and clinics for enterprises

6.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Leveraging Bank‚Äôs in-house masterclasses, toolkits & resources, strategic frameworks, coupled with Enterprise Singapore's ESP panel and relevant SkillsFuture Singapore resources & training programmes, to create impactful training & ESG solutions.

7.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Managing and fostering relationships with multiple stakeholders in the network to ensure effective and sustainable implementation.

8.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Supporting on administrative claims and processing of grants with Enterprise Singapore.

9.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Tracking and measurement of participant‚Äôs progress and performance.

Job Requirements

1.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Bachelor‚Äôs Degree with a focus in business and sustainability, such as sustainable business, environmental management, environmental studies or geography, engineering, or sciences.

2.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Relevant work experience in areas of ESG reporting, training & strategy development.

3.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Knowledge or prior experience working with SMEs/trade associations/chambers of commerce/ government agencies.

4.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Demonstrated knowledge of industry regulations and requirements for sustainability, such as environmental law andreporting frameworks.

5.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Prior experience in running workshops, training events, producing training publications.

6.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience in customer service, account management, or training administration is a plus.

7.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong communication, writing, analytical research, and organizational skills.

8.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong interpersonal skills and able to network and communicate with clients from different sectors, particularly from SMEs.

This job advertisement is posted by:

Tan Geok Khim (Deng Yuqin) (R22107857)
