title: Senior Project Executive
description:
About the Governance and Sustainable Development Department

ASEF‚Äôs Governance and Sustainable Development Department aims to provide and communicate quality, actionable inputs for the policy dialogue between Asia and Europe in thematic areas of Governance, Economy, Public Health and Sustainable Development.

Our goals are:

  • Regularly monitoring and analysing developments in Asia-Europe relations to identify issues where ASEF can provide an added value
  • Designing and implementing programmes responsive to the identified needs of Asia-Europe relations
  • Transforming the outcomes of programmes into inputs actionable for Asia-Europe policy dialogue
  • Delivering and implementing a communication strategy for the dissemination and advocacy in the thematic areas covered by the Department

Our current thematic areas of work include:

  • Governance
  • Economy
  • Sustainable Development
  • Public Health

About the Position

The Governance and Sustainable Development Department is looking for a team member to support the implementation of the Sustainable Development and Economy project portfolio. The new hires work will be under the supervision of the Department Director and Project Lead respectively. The appointment is on a one-year open contract basis, with an initial three-month probation period.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist the Department Director/Project Lead in conceptualizing, designing and developing programs, conferences, workshops, training and other activities for the Department
  • Implement assigned activities/projects of the department independently, including all administrative, logistics and budgetary aspects (including financial claims, travel and reimbursements) and coordinate publicity efforts for the project in collaboration with the communication department and/or external partner organizations.
  • Prepare materials for external engagement and internal approval procedures/ communication, including presentations and documents, meeting notes and minutes and narrative, financial and communication reports to stakeholders
  • Co-administrate the budget related to the Sustainable Development and Economy portfolio projects activities
  • Motivate and guide junior team members through effective delegation and proactive communication
  • Promote strong networks and good relationships with partner institutions
  • Maintain project-related databases of contacts
  • Assist in other strategic ASEF-wide initiatives and projects and other administrative and financial tasks that may be assigned by the Director

Qualifications & Experience

  • National of ASEM
  • Graduate in a relevant field of study (economics, law, politics/IR, environmental science), post-graduate degree preferred
  • Minimum 6 ‚Äì 10 years of relevant work experience
  • Experience in project and events management is an advantage
  • Experience in sustainable development/climate change is an advantage
  • Experience in living overseas and/or working in a multicultural environment

Key Competencies

  • Demonstrated knowledge and interest in multilateralism, international organisations, current geopolitics, international trade, Asia-Europe relations and/or sustainable development, green transition and climate change
  • Cultural sensitivity and demonstrated ability to work in a multicultural team environment
  • Flexible, comfortable with change, and open to assuming any additional responsibilities outside of core duties
  • Strong organisational skills, attention to detail and the ability to effectively communicate with individuals from diverse professional and social backgrounds
  • Proficiency in both written and spoken English, and working knowledge of other ASEM languages is an advantage
  • Ability to proofread and edit, write short articles, speeches project proposals/reports etc.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office. Proficiency in other relevant IT programmes is a plus
  • Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision.
  • Demonstrate professionalism in day-to-day work

How to Apply

To apply for this position, please submit the following documents via this¬†link¬†by 31 January 2026.

The following documents need to be uploaded to the online application:

  • Motivation letter (no more than 500 words) detailing the qualities and contributions that you can bring to ASEF
  • Curriculum vitae (CV) with your contact details, highlighting your education, work experiences and other qualifications related to the job requirements
  • Contact details of 2 referees who can comment about your recent work in a professional capacity; please mention the capacity in which you know them.

As we may receive a large number of applications, we seek your understanding that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted via e-mail.

ASEF is an employer who does not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on gender, sexual orientation, disability, age, colour, ethnicity/race, national origin (ancestry), religion (creed), marital status or pregnancy.

ASEF promotes hybrid work arrangement.

title: IT Support Specialist
description:
At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We‚Äôre not just designers. We‚Äôre tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems. Whether you‚Äôre into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there‚Äôs something here for everyone.

Our depth of expertise spans disciplines‚Äîfrom aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we‚Äôre refreshing a retailer‚Äôs brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.

Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.

As the world‚Äôs largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.

Your Role

As an IT Support Specialist, you will provide the dual role of first-line response to end user incidents received via service desk requests and office operational requirements, as well as partner with the business as the IT subject matter expert and liaison with the regional and global Hub IT teams.

You will generally focus on the day-to-day support of the Singapore and Sydney office, as well as nascent offices such as Bangkok, working in collaboration and communication with the larger distributed team of support staff across the region and globe. You will also provide advice and hands-on activity as required in collaboration with the regional and global Hub IT teams, in matters such as storage, network, information exchange, productivity tools such as O365, and cyber security.

This position requires a self-starter and a skilled communicator (written and verbal) who can effectively project and time manage, prioritizing both support tasks and SME activity in a dynamic team.‚ÄØ The individual within this team needs to have a high sense of ownership, collaboration, and excellent customer service.‚ÄØ This position is focused on rapid service, timely technical support and highest quality of customer satisfaction, with a friendly and helpful attitude. Successful specialists are open, empathetic, and can apply a broad range of basic technology knowledge.

What You Will Do

  • Effectively communicate and work with team members from general end users to high level managers and Principals
  • Determine most effective problem resolution to minimize technical downtime (including network, connection and WIFI issues)
  • Provide first and second level support for Windows and Mac client computers, MS Office 365 applications including Outlook and Teams
  • Provide installation, maintenance and ensure operation of all devices including desktop/laptop computers, printers and peripherals installed within the regional IT infrastructure
  • Provide installation and basic troubleshooting of core 2D and 3D drafting products including Revit, AutoCAD, 3ds Max as well as other graphics design and rendering software such as SketchUp, Rhino, and Adobe Creative Cloud products
  • Support remote users accessing virtual desktop infrastructure and VPN connections
  • Administer user accounts and security controls within Active Directory
  • Image laptops and desktops during initial deployment, maintenance and end of life replacements
  • Comply with vendor specific maintenance and repair procedures
  • Support AV equipment and web conferencing functions
  • Maintain current knowledge of desktop computing technology, applicable software tools and networking technologies used by Gensler. Develop and expand knowledge of these technologies over time
  • Conduct new hire IT orientations to support familiarity with Gensler IT protocols, policies and procedures
  • Develop rapport with staff to understand their technology skills and tailor hands on support accordingly
  • Maintain ethical and professional behavior in dealing with users, department associates, and other departments' personnel. Adhere to all software licensing restrictions
  • Multitask in a fast-paced environment, while maintaining an emphasis on detail and quality
  • Manage all IT assets such as hardware, software licenses, IT service contracts, telecom/internet services, for the office(s).
  • Perform quarterly and yearly budget forecast and tracking for these IT assets.
  • Work with the global Hub IT team to manage and configure server, network and supporting equipment (e.g. UPS, Air conditioning, Fire Suppresion) in the office data center

Your Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field preferred, or equivalent experience or military training
  • 5-7 years of prior related experience, a background in the architecture or engineering industry is a plus
  • Strong knowledge and experience with Windows 10; Microsoft Office 365 (SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Outlook); Mac, Microsoft Active Directory
  • Knowledge of basic networking concepts and desktop troubleshooting
  • Ability to disconnect, lift and move PC's and Monitors (50 lbs) to new desks, maneuver under counters and in tight spots to run cables and wires for PCs
  • Knowledge of iPhone and Android mobile phones
  • Ability to work independently or in a team
  • Must have strong troubleshooting abilities and excellent organizational, time management, and service delivery skills
  • Participate in occasional off-hours and weekend support of system upgrades and initiatives

Qualifications Considered a Plus:

  • CompTIA A+ Certification in desktop support or similar
  • Certification in Cisco, Windows Desktop or Server, Mac, VMWare, ITIL considered a plus
  • Familiarity with using design tools like Adobe Creative Cloud and Autodesk products (ex. Revit, AutoCAD, etc.)
  • Knowledge and experience with Mac OS X in a corporate environment
  • Experience working with geographically diverse operations

Life at Gensler

As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to ‚ÄúWell-being Week,‚Äù our offices reflect our people‚Äôs diverse interests.

We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.

As part of the firm‚Äôs commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Service Manager, Aftersales
description:
**Location:** Hong Kong
  
**Job Details:** Full-time | Onsite
  
**Function:** Aftersales
  
Do you want to develop world-class skills, build a brilliant career, and thrive within a highly supportive team? Join Inchcape Greater China, part of Inchcape‚Äôs global network.
  
You‚Äôll play a key part in growing a global business that‚Äôs transforming our industry, working with the world‚Äôs leading automotive brands, and delivering great experiences for our customers.
  
Our Aftersales team is seeking a Service Manager, Aftersales to join our team in Hong Kong. In this position you will collaborate with a dynamic, diverse team to deliver exceptional service and repairs, bringing your expertise and passion for quality to drive your career forward.
  
  
What you‚Äôll do
  
  
Lead service teams and manage daily operations of service center.
  
  
On-going improve and streamline operation processes.
  
  
Ensure Channel Partner Service Infrastructure and readiness for new product launches.
  
  
Supervise team performance and analyze contractor/ partner performance to ensure the provision of excellent aftersales experience to customer.
  
  
Monitor field issues and report to Function Leader.
  
  
Resolve customer complaints and provide recommendation timely.
  
  
Plan the allocation of resources to maintain high service level and to achieve company objectives.
  
  
Actively involve in staff coaching and development.
  
  
Ensure all branch KPIs to meet AOP target.
  
  
About you
  
  
**To be successful in this role, you will be:**  
Minimum 8 years‚Äô experience in after sales, spare parts & network development in the Automotive Industry with at least 3 years of management experience.
  
  
A Bachelor's Degree in a Technical / Engineering field.
  
  
Strong in both verbal and written communication skills.
  
  
A strong technical background and awareness of relevant local compliance & regulations.
  
  
We offer you
  
  
Benefit from clear career paths, continuous learning opportunities including technical training with Toyota.
  
  
Enjoy extra leave days including a Wellbeing Day, and your birthday off to celebrate on your terms.
  
  
Access comprehensive health and life insurance.
  
  
Enjoy exclusive colleague perks, including discounts on vehicle purchases and more.
  
  
Apply Now
  
Ready to lead communications in a role where your impact is truly felt?
  
Apply today to become a key part of Inchcape‚Äôs transformation journey in Greater China.
  
  
Start your journey
  
If you‚Äôre excited about this role but don‚Äôt meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You might be the perfect fit we‚Äôre looking for. Join our team and become part of a leading global automotive company that is transforming tomorrow, together.
  
Opportunity for everyone
  
At Inchcape, inclusion accelerates our success. We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to thrive. We foster an inclusive culture that reflects the communities we serve, ensuring opportunities for all. Click here to learn more about our commitment to Inclusion and Diversity.
  
About us
  
Inchcape is a leading global automotive distributor and retailer, operating in over 40 markets. With a strong presence in Hong Kong and Macau, we are committed to transforming the customer experience, driving innovation, and shaping the future of mobility. At the heart of our success is our people ‚Äì and clear, compelling communication is key to unlocking their potential.
  
Additional information request
  
Selected candidates will be contacted to initiate our hiring journey. We may request additional information from applicants to better understand your background, qualifications and experience for the role.

title: Global Banking Environmental & Social Due Diligence - Vice President
description:
J.P. Morgan‚Äôs Global Banking Environmental & Social Risk team has a responsibility for reviewing transactions within the Corporate and Investment Bank. With team members based in NYC, London, Bangalore, and Singapore, we offer comprehensive global coverage. The team's mandate is to safeguard the firm‚Äôs reputation by assessing in-scope transactions across a range of financial products, including equity and debt underwriting, loans, credit facilities, M&A activity, and sustainable finance products such as green, social, sustainable, and sustainability-linked loans and bonds. We cover sectors including power, metals and mining, oil and gas, and soft commodities.

As an Environmental & Social Risk Vice President within J.P. Morgan‚Äôs Global Banking Environmental & Social Risk team, you will review transactions within the Corporate and Investment Bank to ensure compliance with the firm‚Äôs Environmental and Social Risk (E&S) Policy Framework. You will partner with bankers, deal teams, and key stakeholders across the Global Banking franchise, providing advisory support and helping safeguard the firm‚Äôs reputation. This role requires a self-starter with strong communication and attention to detail, offering exposure to diverse E&S/ESG risks across multiple asset classes, industries, and geographies, and may involve limited travel.

Job responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Evaluate environmental and social (E&S) requirements for relevant transactions.

‚Ä¢ Analyze the E&S profile and performance of clients.

‚Ä¢ Manage a small team of local and regional specialists.

‚Ä¢ Advise bankers and deal teams, and support clients on E&S/ESG issues.

‚Ä¢ Serve as an E&S subject matter expert and collaborate with internal stakeholders on E&S topics.

‚Ä¢ Enhance training for bankers and deal teams in E&S risk assessment.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the team‚Äôs strategic planning, objectives, and key results.

‚Ä¢ Engage with internal stakeholders to influence the firm‚Äôs broader E&S agenda.

‚Ä¢ Stay informed on environmental issues affecting clients, including forestry, agriculture, climate change, carbon markets, energy efficiency, and renewable energy.

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

‚Ä¢ Minimum 8 years of relevant experience in environmental and social risk/ESG/sustainability

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in environmental studies, sustainability, geography, development economics, finance, or a related field

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of banking products and decision-making processes.

‚Ä¢ Understanding of sustainable finance regulations and market developments.

‚Ä¢ Ability to convey information clearly, accurately, and succinctly, particularly to senior management audiences.

‚Ä¢ Strong client focus and interpersonal skills.

‚Ä¢ Commercial perspective on E&S issues.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work under time pressure with flexibility to manage multiple tasks and adapt to changing priorities.

‚Ä¢ Excellent working knowledge of the Equator Principles, IFC Performance Standards, WB EHS Guidelines, and other industry best practices for environmental and social risk management.

‚Ä¢ Excellent working knowledge of LMA, LSTA, APMLA suite of sustainability principles (e.g., Sustainability Linked Loan Principles), guidance documents, EU Taxonomy, Climate Bonds Initiative Taxonomy, and other industry best practices for ESG.

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

‚Ä¢ Minimum 8 years of relevant experience in environmental and social risk/ESG/sustainability, ideally within financial services, consultancy, or key sectors such as oil and gas, mining, power, and commodities.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Mandarin to communicate with clients in China


To apply for this position, please use the following URL:

https://ars2.equest.com/?response_id=abbf28d24b04adbcc368dec9eb8eb824

title: Principal Research Fellow (Ocean Law and Policy)
description:
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal

Your application will be processed only if you apply via¬† NUS Career Portal

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Description

The Centre for International Law (CIL) is inviting applications for the position of Principal Research Fellow for a term of three (3) years, with the possibility of renewal based on performance and organizational needs. Candidates should possess a PhD in fields related to the law of the sea, international shipping regulation, or oceans law and policy. A minimum of six (6)¬†years of postdoctoral research experience in these areas is essential, along with a strong track record and international recognition in research, as well as demonstrated ability to develop and lead robust research initiatives for CIL‚Äôs Oceans Law and Policy Team. Start dates are flexible.

Candidates with a keen interest and expertise in the international regulation of shipping, as well as familiarity with the International Maritime Organization and its interaction with the 1982 UN Convention on the Law of the Sea (UNCLOS) are¬†encouraged to apply. The CIL Oceans Law and Policy Team is particularly interested in candidates with knowledge and interest in the international legal framework governing shipping with a focus on marine environmental governance, international climate change governance and autonomous ships. Those with relevant working experience in an academic research institute, international organization or government agency are highly valued.

The Principal Research Fellow will¬† be responsible for driving research, events and training and capacity building initiatives for the CIL Oceans Law and Policy Team; supervising and mentoring junior researchers; and taking¬†the lead on administrative responsibilities. The Senior Principal Research Fellow is also expected to conduct independent research and publish in various forums.

Minimum Requirements

  • PhD degree related to the law of the sea and/or in international regulations of shipping and/or related fields;
  • More than 6 years of¬†postdoctoral research experience in law of the sea, international regulation of shipping and/or oceans law and policy;
  • An excellent track record with a solid international reputation in research, with indications of¬†potential for long -term sustainability;
  • Experience in leading or directing research projects or programmes as well as leading a team;
  • A consistent record of service with evidence of leadership to the candidate‚Äôs university and country, profession, and the international academic community;
  • Proficiency in English is required.

Application Procedures

Interested applicants are invited to apply online via the NUS Career Portal with the following documents by¬†20¬†July 2025

  • A cover letter outlining¬†their experience, motivation for wanting to join CIL and any particular research interests;
  • A comprehensive curriculum vitae (no more than 3 pages) detailing their educational background¬†and professional¬†experience;
  • A research statement (maximum of 3 pages) highlighting key research achievements, citing up to 5 significant publications, creative work or other scholarly contributions, and explaining their significance;
  • A complete list of publications;
  • Documentation of research impact, such as¬†citation records;
  • Evidence of international recognisation¬†and research awards;
  • Five (5) copies of significant publications;
  • Names and contact information of at least three (3)¬†academic referees

Please be advised that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. For any inquiries, kindly reach out via email to huong.tam@nus.edu.sg.¬†

More Information

About CIL:¬†The Centre for International Law (CIL) was established in 2009 as a university-level research institute at National University of Singapore (NUS). It is located on the Bukit Timah Campus of NUS, together with the Faculty of Law. As a university-level research institute, CIL engages in both legal and multi-disciplinary research on wide variety of international law issues. Its mission is to enable Singapore and the Asia-Pacific region to play a more significant role in the promotion and development of international law. CIL's vision is to become a regional intellectual hub and thought leader for research on and teaching of international law. More on CIL can be found here:¬†https://cil.nus.edu.sg/

About the Oceans Law and Policy Team:¬†Ocean Law & Policy is one of CIL‚Äôs core programme areas and was established over 10 years ago. It is headed by Emeritus Professor Robert Beckman and Assistant Professor Dr Tara Davenport. The Members of CIL‚Äôs Ocean Law & Policy team currently conduct research on a broad range of cutting-edge ocean law and policy issues of interest to Singapore, the region and the international community, including maritime security, marine environment, climate change and law of the sea, biodiversity beyond national jurisdiction, maritime disputes, technology and the law of the sea, deep seabed mining, fisheries and submarine cables. CIL researchers go on to a variety of positions in government, academia and international organizations. For more information on the OLP‚Äôs team‚Äôs research activities, please see¬†https://cil.nus.edu.sg/research/ocean-law-policy/.¬†

title: Associate, Climate Change and Sustainability Services
description:
At EY, you‚Äôll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we‚Äôre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

Join Climate Change and Sustainability Services (CCaSS) and you will be a member of a multidisciplinary team combining Assurance, Tax, Transactions and Advisory experience to help clients understand and manage their climate change issues related to new regulatory requirements, rising stakeholder concerns and opportunities for cost reduction and revenue generation.

You will experience ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching. That‚Äôs how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because your professional development is important to us and we are fully committed to helping you realise your potential.

The opportunity

Climate Change and Sustainability Services (CCaSS) is part our Assurance group which is one of the most trusted, respected and influential organizations in the industry. As part of our team, you will provide peace of mind to clients by using your skills and experience to give companies, investors and regulators confidence in the validity of business-critical information or processes.

Your key responsibilities

You‚Äôll spend most of your time in assisting clients to identify, measure, and manage their business and reporting risks as they transit their organizations in respond to changing government environmental regulations and new trends in sustainability management and reporting. You enjoy actively contributing to the growth and development of the CCaSS practice by taking operational responsibility and accountability for engagement team support and delivery.

Skills and attributes for success

  • Developing and maintaining strong working relationships with key business decision-makers, both internally and externally
  • Communicating EY‚Äôs scope of services and providing guidance in the delivery of Climate Change & Sustainability Services, with an emphasis on complex and/or specialized issues within Assurance and/or technical sustainability reporting and advisory capacities
  • Identifying and communicating trends, developments, and key performance drivers relevant to the client, while demonstrating a deep understanding of the industry and marketplace
  • Supporting client relationships, business development, and account management leadership through the development of thought leadership, client and internal collateral, and training
  • Conducting performance reviews, serve as a positive leader and mentor, and contribute to performance feedback/training
  • Representing the practice in management forums and supporting the rapid, profitable growth of the business
    ¬†

To qualify for the role, you must have

  • A degree, preferably in finance, accounting, sustainability ; a CPA or similar certification
  • At least 3 years of experience in audit or in a large and dynamic organizations
  • Knowledge and interest in sustainability related areas or topics
  • Extensive experience working and leading in a team-based environment
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills
  • Strong project management and personnel management skills
  • Willingness and ability to travel, as necessary
    ¬†

Ideally, you‚Äôll also have

  • Professional presence with the ability to engage management level clients as well as internal leadership stakeholders
  • Ability to analyze complex or unusual issues in the context of client engagements and deliver insightful and pragmatic solutions

title: Electrical & Electronics Engineering
description:
Wetec is a leading solution provider specializing in measurement and monitoring systems for various sectors including Hydropower Dams, MRT, Railways, Structural Buildings, Waste Water Plants, Groundwater, Monuments, Highways, Tunnels, Bridges, Landslides, Underground locations, Airports, Harbours, Renewable Energy Farms, Mines, and Climate Change. We also focus on Water, Soil, Crops, Climate, Environmental, Waste, and Physical Surveys. Our aim is to be your total solution partner, sharing knowledge and expertise to select the best products for your applications, besides supplying and distributing scientific instruments.

We are looking for a talented¬†Electrical and Electronics Engineer (EEE)¬†to join our dynamic engineering team. The ideal candidate has strong electronics engineering fundamentals, hands-on experience with instrumentation systems, and a working knowledge of Python to support automation, data acquisition, and system diagnostics.

  • Implement, and support electrical and electronic systems used in field instrumentation and monitoring.
  • Integrate sensors and data loggers in real-world applications such as climate monitoring stations.
  • Conduct calibration, troubleshooting, and field testing of deployed systems.
  • Assist with monitoring setups and power supply configurations, including solar-powered solutions for remote locations.
  • Data analysis and visualization of sensor output
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams including software, civil engineers.
  • Provide technical support and training to clients on the setup and use of instruments.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering or related field

title: Regional Studio Coordinator
description:
At Gensler,‚ÄØwe design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We‚Äôre not just designers. We‚Äôre tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems.‚ÄØ Whether you‚Äôre into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there‚Äôs something here for everyone.

Our depth of expertise spans disciplines‚Äîfrom aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we‚Äôre refreshing a retailer‚Äôs brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.

Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.

As the world‚Äôs largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.


Your Role

The regional Studio Coordinator partners with regional members to collectively drive the operational success of the APME regional hub studio.‚ÄØThis role sits at the hub of the studio, providing point of contact for internal, external, and firmwide team members. This role partners with the Senior Executive Assistant to ensure alignment between studio operations and executive priorities, contributing to the overall efficiency and success of the regional hub team.


What You Will Do

Administrative Support to Regional Leadership

  • Provide administrative support, including but not limited to calendar management, travel arrangement includes visa arrangement, hotel arrangement and managing expenses reimbursement

  • Handle confidential information with professionalism and discretion

Studio Operations

  • Support internal and external event planning and execution

  • Partner with office administrative team and IT to plan for software and workspace updates and changes
  • Partner with Human Resources on talent related initiatives such as Professional Development Program (PDP) process monitoring and tracking, leave tracking/reconciliation
  • Work with respective departments to support the onboarding of regional team members and provide studio orientation

  • Demonstrate excellent professionalism, trustworthy, integrity

  • Proven attention to detail, with excellent organizational and technical skills
  • Must be able to determine priorities, take ownership of tasks, and exhibit a high level of initiative and follow-through
  • Established success working on multiple tasks/projects at the same time
  • Ability to manage complex situations
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office


Life at Gensler

As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to ‚ÄúWell-being Week,‚Äù our offices reflect our people‚Äôs diverse interests.

We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.

As part of the firm‚Äôs commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Engineering Executive/Manager (Sustainability)
description:
Our client is looking for an Operations Manager/Executive to drive excellence at a premier mixed-use development. Lead operations, tenant relations & asset enhancement for a top developer. To champion the daily operational integrity of our retail and office assets, driving efficiency, compliance, and continuous improvement across all facets of property management.

Responsibilities:

  • Direct daily facilities management, lead a team of technicians, and optimize all maintenance programs for mechanical and electrical (M&E) systems.
  • Manage the entire cycle of tenant engagements, from coordinating fit-outs and handovers to fostering strong, lasting relationships and ensuring a superior experience.
  • Play a key role in asset enhancement initiatives and upgrades, contributing to the property's long-term value and appeal.
  • Serve as the primary liaison with authorities, consultants, and contractors, ensuring all operations adhere to the highest regulatory and safety standards.
  • Refine standard operating procedures (SOPs), manage vendor performance, and handle critical administrative functions including contracts and procurement.

Who We Are Looking For:

  • A proven professional with at least 5 years of experience in facilities or property management, specifically within commercial or retail property environments.
  • A strong technical foundation, with expert knowledge of building M&E systems and maintenance protocols, electrical engineering and/or Sustainability.
  • A natural leader and problem-solver with outstanding communication skills and a hands-on approach.
  • A degree in Estate Management, Building Services, Engineering, or a related field.
  • A proficient user of standard office software, with experience in building management systems being a significant advantage.

For more information about this role please contact Alex Beattie at abeattie@goughrecruitment.com.hk.

Data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. Personal data provided by job applicants will be used strictly in accordance with the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance. We regret that only the shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Sustainability Manager
description:
We are seeking a Sustainability Manager to lead the development and implementation of sustainability strategies across our commercial office and retail portfolio, driving reductions in environmental impact, enhancing operational efficiency, and strengthening tenant and stakeholder engagement.

  • Manage sustainability audits, retro-commissioning, and implementation of renewable energy and low-carbon technologies.
  • Partner with engineering and facilities teams to identify and execute cost-effective sustainability projects.

title: Regional Sustainability Manager, APAC
description:
Job Description

The Regional Sustainability Manager, APAC, will work closely with the management of the local companies and the Heads of Group Sustainability departments to drive our sustainability agenda in APAC.
¬†

Your responsibilities
¬†Coordinate and support the local implementation of NKG‚Äôs global sustainability strategy in our export and import operations in APAC (Vietnam, Indonesia, Papua New Guinea, India, China, South Korea, Australia, and Singapore), in close collaboration with local management, local teams, and Group Sustainability.
¬†

This includes:

  • Overseeing the implementation of our supply chain program NKG Verified: This includes timeline management,¬† training of local teams and internal and external auditors, internal quality control of processes and data, provision of feedback for improvements of processes,

  • Managing the implementation of our global Human Rights Due Diligence system within the local companies.

  • Developing and implementing an environmental management system, including measures to reduce our carbon emissions and improve waste, water, and materials management,

  • Overseeing our sustainability reporting: Further enhancing local reporting structures and processes to achieve alignment with the CSRD. This includes helping colleagues to collect and verify data for the NKG Sustainability Report.

  • Serving as a key user within the region for our supplier management tool.

  • Facilitating knowledge sharing between the local teams in APAC, with Group level and with our global network of sustainability experts.

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sustainability, similar.

  • Fluency in English is essential; knowledge of any additional Asian languages is a plus.

  • Familiarity with coffee certification processes is an advantage.

  • Demonstrates strong personal integrity and a high degree of empathy.

  • Highly resilient and dependable, with proven ability to meet deadlines effectively.

  • Brings a proactive, solution-oriented mindset and pragmatic approach to challenges.

  • Possesses strong intercultural competence and communication skills, fostering positive relationships with stakeholders at all levels.

title: Social Worker (Children's Programme Lead)
description:
Job Title

Programme Lead (Social Worker) ‚Äì THRIVE Academic & Club Explore

Reporting Line

Reports to: Head of Department / Senior Social Worker (as assigned)

Supervises: Programme Assistants (if assigned), Volunteers, Facilitators

Role Purpose

The Programme Lead (Social Worker) is responsible for end-to-end planning, delivery, safeguarding, and evaluation of WSC‚Äôs youth/child development programmes‚Äîspecifically THRIVE Academic and Club Explore. The role ensures high-quality programme outcomes, sound case-informed practice, strong volunteer management, prudent budget administration, and effective partnership with parents.

Key Responsibilities

1) Plan Programmes

  • Lead annual and term-based programme planning (objectives, scope, timelines, staffing, logistics, risk controls).

  • Align programme design to WSC outcomes, child development needs, and family strengthening goals.

  • Develop implementation plans, session schedules, volunteer deployment plans, and contingency plans.

2) Oversee THRIVE Academic & Club Explore

  • Provide overall programme oversight, ensuring consistency, quality assurance, and safeguarding compliance.

  • Coordinate operations across both programmes (venue, attendance, groupings, resources, stakeholder communication).

  • Ensure appropriate staff-to-child/volunteer ratios and duty allocations for each session.

3) Facilitate Programme

  • Facilitate sessions (where required) and lead key touchpoints (orientation, briefings, group transitions, debriefs).

  • Ensure the programme environment is safe, structured, inclusive, and supportive.

  • Manage ground operations during programme days (incident response, behavioural support, escalation where needed).

4) Develop Content

  • Design and curate age-appropriate learning and enrichment content (lesson plans, activities, worksheets, facilitator guides).

  • Maintain content quality and progression (term-by-term structure, differentiated supports, enrichment tracks).

  • Train staff/volunteers on content delivery standards and classroom/group management approaches.

5) Conduct Evaluation

  • Build and maintain an evaluation framework: outputs, outcomes, and participant progress tracking.

  • Conduct pre/post assessments where appropriate (academic, engagement, social-emotional indicators).

  • Produce periodic evaluation reports and recommendations for programme improvements and stakeholder reporting.

6) Manage Programme Budget

  • Plan and administer the programme budget (forecasting, procurement, cost control, reconciliation).

  • Track expenditures, maintain documentation, and ensure value-for-money procurement.

  • Support reporting for grants/funders (where applicable) and contribute to sustainability planning.

7) Manage Volunteers

  • Recruit, screen (as per policy), onboard, train, schedule, and supervise volunteers.

  • Maintain volunteer performance standards, conduct debriefs, and address conduct/performance issues.

  • Develop volunteer retention practices (recognition, progression pathways, feedback loops).

8) Maintain Relationship with Parents

  • Serve as a key point of contact for parents/guardians on programme matters.

  • Conduct parent engagement touchpoints: orientation, consent processes, updates, feedback sessions.

  • Support early identification of needs and appropriate referrals/linkages (within WSC or to partners), in line with social work practice and confidentiality.

Social Work Practice & Safeguarding (Embedded Expectations)

  • Apply social work ethics, confidentiality, and professional boundaries in all interactions.

  • Conduct basic triage and risk screening where relevant, and escalate safeguarding concerns per WSC protocol.

  • Maintain accurate case/programme documentation and incident records.

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)¬†

  • Programme delivery reliability: session completion, punctuality, incident rates, safeguarding compliance.

  • Outcomes: student progress indicators (academic/engagement), attendance retention, parent satisfaction.

  • Volunteer management: recruitment fill-rate, training completion, retention, volunteer satisfaction.

  • Budget performance: variance to budget, timely reconciliation, audit-ready documentation.

  • Continuous improvement: evaluation cycle completion and implemented improvements.

Required Qualifications

  • Degree in Social Work (or equivalent recognised qualification).

  • Registered Social Worker (if applicable/required by your operating context).

  • Minimum 2‚Äì5 years in programme delivery, child/youth work, or community services (adjust to your seniority needs).

Required Competencies & Skills

  • Programme design and delivery (planning, facilitation, operations, risk management).

  • Groupwork and child/youth engagement; behaviour support strategies.

  • Volunteer leadership: coaching, performance management, scheduling, retention.

  • Budget management and basic finance administration.

  • Evaluation and data discipline (assessment tools, reporting, outcome tracking).

  • Stakeholder management: parent engagement, partner coordination, internal collaboration.

  • Strong documentation, case notes/programme records, and compliance mindset.

Working Conditions (Customisable)

  • Evening/weekend work required based on programme schedules.

  • Occasional offsite activities/events.

  • Must comply with WSC safeguarding requirements and relevant checks.

title: Consultant (Sustainability)
description:
Job Description

We are seeking a committed Sustainability Practitioner to lead and support sustainability reporting initiatives across financial institutions and other industry sectors. This role requires bridging technical expertise in sustainability with financial sector knowledge to ensure compliance with evolving regulatory requirements and to meet the expectations of diverse stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

Sustainability Reporting

  • Develop, manage, and deliver sustainability/ESG reports aligned with leading frameworks (GRI, SASB, ISSB, TCFD, EU Taxonomy).
  • Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements (e.g., MAS, SGX).
  • Collect, validate, and analyze ESG data across operations, investments, and portfolios.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Collaborate with internal teams (risk, compliance, finance, operations) to embed sustainability into reporting processes.
  • Engage with external stakeholders including regulators, auditors, investors, and rating agencies.

Capacity Building

  • Provide training and guidance to internal teams on sustainability reporting standards and best practices.
  • Support the development of internal ESG data management policies and procedures.
  • Conduct public and client training sessions to advance sustainability knowledge through TEMBUSU Academy.

Strategic Advisory

  • Identify opportunities to strengthen sustainability performance and disclosure practices.
  • Advise on emerging trends in sustainable finance, climate risk, and ESG integration.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Accountancy, Environmental Engineering or related fields.
  • 3‚Äì5 years of experience in sustainability reporting, preferably within financial institutions or consulting.
  • Strong knowledge of ESG frameworks (GRI, SASB, ISSB, TCFD) and regulatory requirements.
  • Excellent analytical, writing, and communication skills.
  • Proven ability to manage multiple projects and deliver under tight deadlines.
  • Familiarity with sustainability data platforms and reporting tools is an advantage.

title: Player Development & Impact Manager
description:
Player Development & Impact Manager

FootballPlus
Singapore

FootballPlus is a purpose-driven football organisation using high-quality coaching and structured development systems to transform the lives of young people, especially those from disadvantaged backgrounds. Through our flagship programmes, including Champions Unlimited and STAY IN THE GAME, we work in our academy, schools, and communities to build not just better footballers, but stronger, more confident, and more resilient young people.

We are seeking a Player Development & Impact Manager to lead the holistic development, tracking, and support of players across all FootballPlus programmes.

This role sits at the heart of our mission, connecting on-field football, off-field wellbeing, school engagement, and impact measurement into one integrated youth development system.

The Role

The Player Development & Impact Manager is responsible for ensuring that every child in FootballPlus, whether in our academy, mental-health programmes, or school-based coaching, is properly supported, actively progressing, and meaningfully impacted.

You will be part of a team to oversee the FootballPlus Player Performance & Impact Framework, ensuring that football performance, mental wellbeing, character, and school engagement are tracked, supported, and developed in a coordinated way.

This is both a leadership and delivery role, combining coaching, systems management, stakeholder engagement, and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

1. Player Development & Impact Systems

  • Lead and implement the FootballPlus Player Performance & Impact Matrix across:

    • Champions Unlimited

    • STAY IN THE GAME

    • School-based coaching programmes

  • Develop and maintain Individual Player Development Plans (IPDPs) for academy players and targeted participants

  • Track progress in football, behaviour, wellbeing, and school engagement

  • Identify at-risk players and design appropriate intervention and support plans

2. Programme & Coaching Integration

  • Work with coaching teams to ensure that training content, session design, and behaviour standards align with development goals

  • Provide on-field coaching in academy and school programmes (up to 5 sessions per week)

  • Support STAY IN THE GAME facilitators to integrate mental-health, character, and reflection components into football delivery

3. School, Family & Community Engagement

  • Act as the main liaison between FootballPlus, schools, families, and community partners on player development matters

  • Conduct feedback, review, and progress conversations with parents, teachers, and school leaders

  • Support children facing challenges in behaviour, attendance, or wellbeing, coordinating help where needed

4. Team & Volunteer Leadership

  • Coordinate and support coaches, volunteers, mentors, and facilitators across all FootballPlus programmes

  • Ensure safeguarding, communication, and development standards are consistently applied

  • Provide clarity on roles, expectations, and player development priorities

5. Monitoring, Evaluation & Reporting

  • Produce player progress and programme impact reports for management, funders, and school partners

  • Provide data and insight to strengthen programme design, funding proposals, and reporting

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of FootballPlus‚Äô youth development model

Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

The Player Development & Impact Manager will be evaluated against the following measurable outcomes:

Player Development & Wellbeing

  • ‚â•80% of academy players show measurable improvement in at least 3 of 4 domains (football, behaviour, wellbeing, school engagement) within 12 months

  • ‚â•90% of Champions Unlimited players have up-to-date Individual Player Development Plans (IPDPs)

  • Reduction in behavioural or attendance issues among targeted players by at least 25% year-on-year

Programme Quality & Delivery

  • ‚â•90% of training sessions across programmes delivered in alignment with FootballPlus development standards

  • Positive coach evaluations (average rating ‚â•4/5) on alignment to development framework

  • Successful integration of STAY IN THE GAME curriculum into at least 90% of planned sessions

School & Family Engagement

  • ‚â•85% of families engaged in at least two development touch points per year

  • Positive feedback from school partners (‚â•4/5 satisfaction)

  • Improved attendance, behaviour, or engagement in school for at least 70% of targeted players

Team & Volunteer Management

  • ‚â•90% retention of active coaches and key volunteers

  • All staff and volunteers trained in FootballPlus safeguarding and development protocols

  • Clear role alignment and compliance with programme standards

Monitoring, Reporting & Impact

  • 100% of players included in FootballPlus tracking and reporting system

  • Quarterly impact reports delivered on time to management and funders

  • Evidence-based insights used to improve programmes and secure funding

Who We Are Looking For

You are someone who can stand confidently on the football pitch, in a school meeting, and in front of funders.

You should bring:

  • A background in Sports Science, Sport Management, Youth Development, Education, or a related field

  • A valid football coaching licence (FAS, AFC, UEFA, or equivalent)

  • Experience working with children and youth in football, schools, or development programmes

  • Strong leadership, organisation, and problem-solving skills

  • The ability to manage multiple stakeholders with professionalism and empathy

  • Comfort working with data, frameworks, and development plans

  • A genuine commitment to working with young people from disadvantaged backgrounds

Why Join FootballPlus

You will be helping to build one of Singapore‚Äôs most structured and values-driven football-based youth development systems, with real influence over:

  • How children are supported

  • How impact is measured

  • How football is used as a tool for life transformation

This is a career-defining role for someone who wants to combine high-performance sport, youth development, and social impact in one platform.

title: Manager, Procurement (Sustainability)
company: RESORTS WORLD AT SENTOSA PTE. LTD.
description:
We are seeking a Sustainable Procurement Manager to play a pivotal role in shaping a responsible, future-ready supply chain. You‚Äôll lead initiatives that integrate sustainability into procurement strategies, policies, and processes, aligning with ISO 20400 standards. From driving Scope 3 decarbonization with suppliers to improving ESG performance and embedding sustainability into category playbooks, your work will directly advance our corporate sustainability goals while delivering commercial value. This is an exciting opportunity to influence change, build strategic partnerships, and make a measurable impact on our organization‚Äôs environmental and social footprint.


Job Responsibilities:


1. Sustainable Procurement Policy

  • Maintain the Sustainable Procurement Policy aligned with corporate ESG objectives and industry benchmarks.

2. Category Playbook

  • Create and maintain Category Playbooks incorporating sustainability criteria, risk assessments, and supplier performance benchmarks.
  • Collaborate with category managers to embed sustainability targets in sourcing strategies.

3. Supplier Engagement & Scope 3 Decarbonization

  • Coordinate supplier engagement programs focused on Scope 3 emissions reduction and climate action.
  • Facilitate supplier capacity-building initiatives to improve sustainability performance.

4. ESG Performance Management

  • Lead the assessment and monitoring of supplier ESG performance, including environmental, social, and governance compliance.
  • Collaborate with category managers to embed ESG performance into supplier scorecards and reporting mechanisms to track progress against sustainability KPIs.

5. Sustainability Reporting

  • Collaborate with category managers to prepare annual sustainability reporting on responsible sourcing, ensuring accuracy, transparency, and alignment with corporate ESG commitments and reporting frameworks and standards.

6. Integration into Procurement SOP

  • Embed sustainability requirements into procurement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), ensuring alignment with ISO 20400.
  • Drive continuous improvement and best practices in sustainable sourcing.

7. Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Work closely with internal stakeholders (Procurement, Sustainability and other Business Units) to align objectives and strategies.
  • Participate in industry forums and sustainability networks.

8. Strategic Procurement & Vendor Management

  • Lead end-to-end procurement (RFI/RFQ/RFP) for technology solutions and services, including sourcing, negotiation, commercial analysis and award recommendations
  • Negotiate commercial terms to ensure value-for-money and cost efficiency
  • Ensure compliance with corporate procurement policies and processes
  • Drive procurement activities to meet company and team-level KPIs

Job Requirements:


Required Qualifications

  • Degree/Diploma in Supply Chain, Procurement, Sustainability, or related field
  • Proven experience in procurement with a strong focus on sustainability and ESG.
  • Knowledge of Scope 3 emissions, ISO 20400, and sustainable supply chain practices preferred.
  • Experience in using Ariba or SAP would be an advantage
  • Proficiency with MS Word & MS Excel

Skills

  • Strong analytical, negotiation, and stakeholder engagement skills.
  • Ability to influence and drive changes across complex supply chains.
  • Team player who is self-motivated, proactive, detail-oriented, adaptable and able to multi-task

title: Head of Real Estate Services
description:
**Some careers have more impact than others**

If you‚Äôre looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join Hang Seng and discover how valued you‚Äôll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, Hang Seng offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

**Hang Seng Real Estate Services**

Hang Seng‚Äôs Real Estate Services is a team of professionals managing 300+ properties in Hong Kong for our staff and customers. Whether it is a customer entering a branch, or staff collaborating in the office, we can make their experience a positive one.  
Working closely with the business partners and external vendors, the team covers a wide range of real estate services functions including planning, acquisition, design, construction/fitting out, asset management, facilities management and administration of Hang Seng‚Äôs operational and investment real estate portfolio. The team also provides collateral appraisal services to internal business users and asset management services to external customers.  
Should you join our Real Estate Services function, you will be working with a highly talented, motivated and experienced team in a dynamic environment, where you will have opportunities to excel and develop yourselves professionally, as well as contribute to the success of the bank .

We are currently seeking a high caliber professional to join our team as **Head of Real Estate Services**, reporting to Chief Operating Officer.

**Principal responsibilities**

* Drive the implementation of the Group‚Äôs strategic objectives through customer driven delivery of real estate services and continuous performance improvement
* Provide strategic leadership in managing the real estate portfolio to achieve cost efficiency and excellence
* Deliver a full range of Facilities, Property and Project Management services, across a diverse portfolio throughout real estate property management lifecycle.
* Deliver the innovative and forward-thinking initiatives relating to the portfolio and which support the business needs across Portfolio Optimisation, Workplace and Facilities Management Solutions, Retail Solutions, Sustainability, Critical Facilities and Risk Management.
* Maximize the return of the Bank‚Äôs investment properties
* Optimize the Bank‚Äôs property portfolio and expenses including rental, rates, management fee, repairs and maintenance
* Work with the business partners on outlet location strategy

**Requirements**

* Qualifications in real estate related subjects or business, economics, finance, project management with a recognized professional qualification such as Member of the Hong Kong Institute of Surveyors (‚ÄúMHKIS‚Äù) or equivalent; attain / maintain a valid Estate Agent‚Äôs (Individual) license will be an advantage
* A comprehensive understanding of a broad range of real estate activities and issues in the context of Bank and industry practices
* Proven experience of leasing (as both landlord and tenant), acquisition, disposal, tenancy/asset management, estate management of large scale of real estate portfolio for both self-occupation and investment purposes
* Proven experience on how major corporates operate, the key challenges faced in the operating environment and the impact on real estate requirements and decision making

* Proven track record in leading and implementing strategic complicated assignments within different environments
* Proven ability to lead and motivate a large range of stakeholders and external consultants/contractors to drive best performance
* Great sense of ownership and servicing mindset to ensure efficient and effective customer service processes

**You‚Äôll achieve more when you join Hang Seng Bank Limited.**  
  
**www.hangseng.com/careers**  
  
**https://www.linkedin.com/company/hang-seng-bank**

Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services. We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages.  
  
Issued by Hang Seng Bank Limited

  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives simultaneously
  • Candidates who are Energy Auditors, and / or with hands-on experience and knowledge in ACMV/BAS systems are preferred;
  • Possess robust analytical expertise and problem-solving abilities, adept at identifying and tackling complex issues from multiple angles and crafting inventive solutions;
  • Ability to anticipate and prepare for the future, based on trends and insights. Collaborating with partners to plan and navigate complex and uncertain situations

title: Partner - Merger & Acquisition, Transaction Advisory
description:
As part of our continued growth and innovation of our Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) service, ERM is seeking a motivated Partner (Transaction Advisory), who is interested in participating & leading in a variety of projects covering the full spectrum of ERM‚Äôs services to be based in Singapore, where we are growing as a regional hub in APAC.


This is an excellent career opportunity to work with an expert global consulting company, which aims to lead the field in sustainability consulting. We are working on challenging environmental projects for large industrial, financial and global clients. Access to ERM's worldwide network of ESG, HSE, Environmental & Social (E&S) and Technical experts provide the knowledge sharing of best practices across the industry and ongoing learning opportunities for everyone. As part of Singapore office‚Äôs regional finance sector offering, this role will also offer opportunities to gain experience and lead projects around sustainable finance and carbon markets.

ERM understands that every M&A deal presents a unique set of risks and liabilities, which require rapid and rigorous quantification as part of the transaction process. For over 25 years, we have been providing critical, confidential, and time-sensitive advice on environmental risks to assist companies execute their most important transactions. ERM‚Äôs M&A Transaction Advisory services provide unrivalled global capabilities and in-depth understanding across the financial, commercial, industrial, and extractive sectors.


This is a Partner opportunity. Our partnership model is a significant differentiator for ERM in that it presents an almost unique opportunity for leading consultants in a truly global firm to own and contribute to the direction and success of the company. Our partnership model offers unparalleled opportunities for leaders with ambition, vision and proven expertise, providing meaningful equity ownership with significant financial and intangible rewards.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

Primary focus will be on client-facing, client account development, sales, and delivery of the full spectrum of ERM‚Äôs consulting services to deliver strategic value to our clients. In particular, you will play a key role in growing ERM‚Äôs M&A Solutions across its broad portfolio of service offerings:

  • ESG, HSE, E&S and / or Technical due diligence for Mergers & Acquisitions and project financing
  • Carbon and energy due diligence
  • Post-merger integration
  • Management system gap analysis and benchmarking
  • Sustainability assessments
  • Deal negotiation support

Actively develop commercial strategies to pursue and win new business opportunities that result in significant revenue growth with target clients aligned with ERM‚Äôs global strategy.

  • Provide business value selling at the top levels of client organizations, raising the profile of ERM‚Äôs capabilities within key client organizations, to identify and shape clients‚Äô needs for ERM services
  • Develop new client relationships and expand existing relationships by delivering strategic consulting advice, excellent value, and quality service
  • Maintain pulse on industry business deals and prioritize sales efforts toward high-potential, top opportunities
  • Manage capture efforts utilizing technical understanding to develop proposals, including written content, pricing, presentations, and contracting
  • Lead complex ESG, HSE, E&S and / or Technical due diligence consulting engagements involving multi-site portfolios and multi-person project teams locally, nationally, and globally
  • Provide advice to clients on integrating ESG considerations into M&A transactions, including compliance with international standards like Equator Principles
  • Build, grow, and manage a high-performance team, serving as a leader and mentor to consultants. Identify emerging talent and work with them to reach their full potential; ensure rising stars are nurtured, developed and given new areas of responsibility
  • Support the growth and development of ERM‚Äôs global M&A solutions and actively collaborate with colleagues across the globe. Drive innovation within the business to stay ahead of client needs and to differentiate ERM in the market
  • Work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment to build ERM‚Äôs global business, as well as to lead client and technical teams
  • Meet business financial targets, overall project budget and schedule, client satisfaction/expectations, and internal and contract requirements

Job Requirements and Skills

To apply for this role at ERM, you should provide evidence / demonstrate the following essential skills, and desirable skills / attributes where possible.

  • MSc in engineering, environmental or other science, or related discipline; professional registration preferred
  • Minimum 15+ years‚Äô progressive experience, ideally within consultancy setting, with relevant project exposure in EHS, ESG, E&S and / or Technical Due Diligence, particularly in context of private equity and development finance institution (DFI) on both buyer and seller-side transactions
  • Well-versed in environmental risk, environmental compliance, health & safety compliance, technical risks and / or remediation liabilities as they relate to transaction agreements
  • Experience with site visits, site inspections and technical discussions, relating to points such as asset integrity, operational performance, management systems or business plans is an added advantage
  • In-depth understanding of the M&A industry in Singapore and the region, and the companies operating in these sectors, including existing relationships with corporate executives, attorneys, investment bankers, and/or private equity that can be leveraged into new business
  • Business acumen to understand business risk and challenges and recognize corporate opportunities
  • Demonstrable track record in delivering multimillion dollar sales results annually, including successfully winning large and strategic portfolios
  • Effective and empathetic leader with strong communication skills (both written and spoken) and a proven ability to coordinate and lead teams

title: Sustainability Analyst
description:
Sustainability Analyst

Role and introduction

CSRWorks International is a sustainability consulting, assurance, and training firm headquartered in Singapore, working with clients across Asia-Pacific, Europe, and the United States. We support organisations on sustainability strategy, reporting, climate action, sustainability ratings, and assurance.

We are hiring entry-level Sustainability Analysts to join our consulting team. This role is ideal for fresh graduates and post-graduates who want to build strong, practical skills and a long-term career in sustainability consulting.

You will work on real client projects from day one, contribute to professional deliverables, and learn directly from experienced practitioners. CSRWorks is a Certified Great Place to Work¬Æ.

Responsibilities

  • Support sustainability consulting engagements across reporting, climate and carbon management, sustainability ratings, and assurance

  • Research sustainability standards, regulations, and best practices

  • Collect, validate, and analyse data for client disclosures and assessments

  • Draft sections of sustainability reports, presentations, and client materials

  • Support project coordination, quality reviews, and timelines

  • Collaborate with team members across projects and geographies

Requirements

We are looking for motivated candidates with strong fundamentals and a willingness to learn.

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant discipline

  • Strong interest in sustainability, climate change, or corporate responsibility

  • Good research, analytical, and writing skills

  • Ability to structure information clearly and communicate insights through written and presentation materials

  • Attention to detail and comfort working with structured data

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

  • Comfortable using digital tools; familiarity with responsible use of AI is an advantage; programming skills will be an added advantage

  • Comfort working with numbers; basic statistical or data modelling skills are an advantage

  • Ability to manage multiple tasks and work to deadlines

  • Willingness to work with clients and teams across different time zones when required

  • Prior internships or academic projects in sustainability are a plus, but not essential

What we offer

  • Competitive salary with a performance-linked bonus

  • Hands-on learning, mentoring, and continuous development

  • Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid and work-from-home options

  • Medical, healthcare, and wellness benefits

  • Generous leave policies and a supportive work environment

  • Exposure to international, multi-cultural client engagements

Interviews

Shortlisted candidates may go through an interview and a short written or analytical exercise. We value curiosity, clarity of thought, and learning ability over prior experience.

How to apply

Please send your CV and a short cover note explaining your interest in sustainability and CSRWorks International to hr@csrworks.com, with the subject line: Application ‚Äì Sustainability Analyst

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Deputy Director / Senior Manager, Sustainability (Packaging & Circular Economy)
description:
Lead the Charge for a Circular Singapore: Deputy Director, Sustainability (Packaging & Circular Economy)

Are you a visionary sustainability advocate with a passion for redesigning the future of packaging?

The Singapore Environment Council (SEC) is looking for a strategic, high-impact Deputy Director/Senior Manager to lead our flagship initiatives in packaging waste reduction and circular economy. As a key leader within our Sustainability department, you will bridge the gap between national policy and industry innovation, driving systemic change across Singapore‚Äôs packaging value chain.

The Opportunity

In this pivotal role, you won't just talk about sustainability‚Äîyou will build the frameworks that make it possible. Reporting to the Director of Sustainability, you will lead a multidisciplinary team to influence how packaging is designed, used, and recovered in Singapore.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership: Lead the development and delivery of large-scale sustainability programmes focused on packaging design, reduction, and circularity.

Policy Advocacy: Conduct high-level research on international best practices to develop policy recommendations and position papers for government and industry partners.

Stakeholder Synergy: Build and maintain influential partnerships with packaging producers, brand owners, retailers, and trade associations to align industry action with national waste goals.

Innovation & Frameworks: Oversee pilot initiatives and develop technical toolkits, including life-cycle assessments and Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) frameworks.

What We Are Looking For

Proven Impact: You have at least 5 to 10 years of relevant experience, with a significant portion dedicated to advocating for sustainable packaging within an NGO or public-interest environment.

Technical Authority: You possess a deep understanding of packaging life-cycle management, circular economy principles, and environmental legislation like the Resource Sustainability Act.

Collaborative Influencer: You have a track record of engaging with government agencies, statutory boards, and trade associations to drive cross-sector solutions.

Academic Foundation: A Degree in Environmental Engineering, Science, Public Policy, or Sustainability is required.

Mission-Driven: You are genuinely passionate about driving collaborative solutions for a greener, zero-waste future.

Why Join SEC?

The Singapore Environment Council is at the forefront of environmental advocacy. This role offers the unique opportunity to shape national conversations, mentor a dedicated team, and leave a lasting mark on Singapore‚Äôs environmental landscape.

Ready to lead the change? Submit your application today and help us redefine the future of resources in Singapore.
