title: Social Worker
company: SOUTH CENTRAL COMMUNITY FAMILY SERVICE CENTRE LIMITED
description:
Job Overview:


The Social Worker plays a vital role in a dynamic Social Work Team that facilitates positive change and improves the lives of individuals, families, and communities facing social challenges. This is achieved through a community-centric approach and the delivery of targeted interventions, including but not limited to social work services, home ownership support, education support, livelihood development, and community development. The ultimate aim is to empower communities to break the cycle of poverty and achieve sustainable progress.


Working collaboratively with community members and ecosystem partners, the Social Worker supports socially disadvantaged, low-income families and individuals in realising their aspirations. He/She will maintain a high standard of professionalism and be accountable to the service user, the community, and the organisation, to ensure that intervention plans are developed and implemented with sound professional judgment and high ethical standards.


If you are a social worker who has a passion for communities and social mobility, we invite you to have a chat with us!


Responsibilities:


To deliver Community Centric Social Work Practice which includes the following 5 domains:

1. FSC Code of Social Work Practice

  • Manage cases according to the FSC CSWP guidelines and timelines, which includes conducting sessions in agencies, home visits, case conferences and other methods of engagement with service users
  • Handle Information and Referral duties, including conducting Enquiries and Intake Assessments
  • Maintain accurate and confidential casework records to document interventions, assessments and case plans (e.g. Assessment and Case Plans, Case Session Recordings, Contact Logs), on the required platforms such as SSNet and CaseConnect
  • To intervene in safety and risk concerns, developing safety plans and making risk assessments, to improve the family‚Äôs functioning towards stability

2. Empowering Casework

  • Identify assets in services users and community members, so as to mobilize them to contribute to community well-being
  • Engage the community members and facilitate support and connections to improve the well-being of service users
  • Work with SCC Community Workers in a team approach, in order to improve the well-being of service users

3. Community Building

  • Conduct community conversations, group work and other community engagement activities to build associations and connections within the community.
  • Grow and sustain community associations that can contribute to the community
  • Work with, guide and mentor community connectors to be able to build become facilitators and contributors to community well-being.

4. Activating Potential and Pathways

  • Holding asset-building and aspirational development conversations with service users to activate their potential for social mobility
  • Referrals to other internal and external enablers and initiatives that can facilitate asset-building for social mobility
  • Connect families with available resources such as ComLink+ Progress Packages, to encourage social mobility

5. Advancing Social Mobility

  • Supporting families‚Äô social mobility journey by continued engagement of service users and coordinating with other internal and external stakeholders to maintain progress towards social mobility goals
  • Develop asset-building or social action projects where necessary


Requirements:

  • Believe that people and communities have intrinsic strengths and resources that can be harnessed for the betterment of family and community life
  • Passion for engaging with communities and social mobility work
  • Knowledge and experience with social work interventions and social policies, and interest in community development work will be an added advantage
  • Ability to work collaboratively as a team to enable greater synergy in the work
  • Degree or Post Graduate Diploma in Social Work or related disciplines from recognised universities
  • Strong analytical, writing, communication, and interpersonal skills
  • Fresh graduates are welcome to apply

Note:

  • By submitting your resume or by disclosing your personal data in connection with your job application, you are deemed to have consented to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data for use in accordance with our Privacy Policy - https://sccfsc.sg/pages/privacy-policy-2025
  • If you wish to withdraw your consent, please write to dpo@sccfsc.org.sg and we will respond accordingly.
  • All job applications will be processed with strict confidence and only shortlisted candidate will be contacted

title: GRIT: Global Corporate Banking, Process Automation Analyst, GWB Sustainability Office
description:
Why Join


Be a driving force in OCBC‚Äôs commitment to a sustainable future. As a Process Automation Analyst within Global Corporate Banking‚Äôs Sustainability Office, you‚Äôll directly contribute to streamlining our environmental, social, and governance (ESG) reporting. You‚Äôll gain valuable experience in automation, data analysis, and sustainability practices, playing a key role in demonstrating our leadership and transparency.


How you succeed


Embrace a proactive and analytical approach. You‚Äôll need to quickly learn our sustainability data processes and identify opportunities for automation. A strong attention to detail and a willingness to independently develop and maintain solutions will be crucial. Success means delivering efficient, accurate, and insightful reporting that supports our sustainability goals.


What you do
Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing and maintaining Excel macros and scripts to automate recurring sustainability reporting tasks.
  • Assisting in building dashboards and templates for tracking key sustainability metrics.
  • Contributing to the streamlining of internal processes related to data collection, validation, and analysis.
  • Identifying and implementing innovative solutions to enhance reporting efficiency and accuracy.
  • Collaborating with team members to ensure data integrity and consistency.
  • Supporting ad-hoc data requests related to sustainability reporting.

Who you work with


Global Corporate Banking takes a partnership approach to helping large companies achieve their potential. Working internationally, across multiple industries, our teams grow their industry-specific expertise delivering business-building services, financing, cash management, trade, and Treasury solutions. Right now, we‚Äôre actively evolving our digital and sustainability model ‚Äì and you‚Äôll be a part of that.


Who you are

  • A recent graduate from a Polytechnic or University with a diploma or degree in the relevant field.
  • Highly proficient in VBA/macros.
  • Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Demonstrate meticulous attention to detail and the ability to work independently.
  • Open to learning and applying new technologies, such as Python or Power BI (a plus).

Learning Objectives
This programme will provide you with:

  • Hands-on experience in process automation techniques using VBA and potentially Python/Power BI.
  • Exposure to sustainability reporting frameworks and data management best practices.
  • Opportunities to develop your analytical and problem-solving skills in a real-world business context.
  • Insights into the role of sustainability within a leading financial institution.

Who we are


As Singapore‚Äôs longest established bank, we have been dedicated to enabling individuals and businesses to achieve their aspirations since 1932. How? By taking the time to truly understand people. From there, we provide support, services, solutions, and career paths that meet their individual needs and desires.


Today, we‚Äôre on a journey of transformation. Leveraging technology and creativity to become a future-ready learning organisation. But for all that change, our strategic ambition is consistently clear and bold, which is to be Asia‚Äôs leading financial services partner for a sustainable future.


We invite you to build the bank of the future. Innovate the way we deliver financial services. Work in friendly, supportive teams. Build lasting value in your community. Help people grow their assets, business, and investments. Take your learning as far as you can. Or simply enjoy a vibrant, future-ready career. Your Opportunity Starts Here.


What we offer


Competitive base salary. A suite of holistic, flexible benefits to suit every lifestyle. Community initiatives. Industry-leading learning and professional development opportunities. Equal opportunity. Fair employment. Selection based on ability and fit with our culture and values. Your wellbeing, growth and aspirations are every bit as cared for as the needs of our customers.

title: AVP, HR & Business Partnering - Singapore
description:
**About IIX**

Impact Investment Exchange (IIX) is a **pioneer in impact investing**, dedicated to reshaping finance for sustainable development. Over the past 15+ years, IIX has built the sustainable investing market through:

* **Capital Mobilization** ‚Äì Including the **Women's Livelihood Bond‚Ñ¢ Series** (6 listed bonds and growing).
* **Enterprise Technical Assistance** ‚Äì Supporting impact enterprises across Asia, Africa, and the Pacific.
* **Data & Impact Measurement** ‚Äì Leveraging **IIX Values‚Ñ¢**, an impact verification tech solution.
* **Global Advocacy & Innovation** ‚Äì Such as the **Orange Movement‚Ñ¢**, which integrates gender equality and climate action in financial markets.

**Our Impact:**

‚úÖ **Mobilized nearly $500M** in private-sector capital  
‚úÖ **Positively impacted over 160 million lives**  
‚úÖ **Avoided over 1.9 million metric tons of carbon**  
‚úÖ **Collected over 90,000+ data points** on sustainable MSMEs

In 2024, IIX launched **IIX Intelligence‚Ñ¢**, a global data hub evaluating gender diversity, ESG, and climate action among MSMEs. Our work has been recognized by accolades such as the **Oslo Business for Peace Award** and the **UN Global Climate Action Award**.

www.iixglobal.com (http://www.iixglobal.com/)

  

**About the Role**

  

The AVP, HR & Business Partnering is responsible for aligning business objectives with employees and management in designated business units. The role serves as a consultant in the assigned business units on human resource-related issues. The successful AVP, HR & Business Partnering acts as a strategic partner, employee champion and change agent. The role proactively delivers the HR related people targets aligned with business imperatives.

  

**Responsibilities:**

**Strategic Partnership:**

* Acts as a strategic partner and trusted advisor to the business unit in delivering people strategies and goals.
* Develops and implements HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business imperatives.

**Employee Relations:**

* Ensures HR policies, procedures, and programs are properly implemented and documented
* Manages and resolves complex employee relations issues, conducts thorough and objective investigations as necessary.
* Provides clear guidelines and works closely with line managers on any HR matter (e.g., coaching, counseling, performance review, career development, disciplinary actions).

**Talent Management and People Development:**

* Works with other functions in HR on individual and team development plan.
* Partners with the Business Unit Heads on workforce management, building strong talent bench and succession plan.
* Creates programs on high performing teams and employee retention programs

**Organizational Development:**

* Works with business units to identify and implement organizational development and employee engagement initiatives.
* Facilitates change management initiatives and ensures smooth transitions of change in the organization, effectively communicates and implements necessary changes.

**Recruitment and Onboarding:**

* Leads the talent acquisition initiatives and ensures timely onboarding of qualified candidates.
* Oversees and supports the onboarding process and ensures new hires are integrated smoothly into the company.
* This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing organization at the forefront of the impact investment industry. You will have the chance to make a significant impact, shaping the direction of our HR function and contributing to the success of our business.

**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field; Master's degree is an advantage.
* 8+ years combined experience in HRBP and Talent Acquisition roles.
* Demonstrates experience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, within the finance or tech industries and start up spaceindustries is an advantage.
* Strong understanding of employment laws and regulations across Asia Pacific, with a track record of ensuring compliance.
* Proven track record in designing or facilitating People Development frameworks, such as mentorship programs, competency mapping, or leadership training.
* Strong foundational knowledge of Compensation & Benefits principles, including salary grading, incentive schemes, and benefits administration.
* Proven ability to develop and implement HR strategies that support business objectives and drive results.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

**Why Join IIX?**

Hands-on exposure to impact investing and sustainable finance  
Opportunity to drive global change in gender equality and climate action  
Fast-track professional growth with training, mentorship, and leadership opportunities  
Work with leading institutions ‚Äì from UN agencies to top financial institutions

**At IIX, we look for individuals who are:**

‚úî Passionate ‚Äì Dedicated to impact investing and social finance  
‚úî Resilient ‚Äì Able to navigate challenges in emerging markets  
‚úî Equitable ‚Äì Committed to maximizing measurable social and financial impact  
‚úî Maverick ‚Äì Independent, innovative, and bold in their approach

**Application Process**

Submit your cover letter & resume  
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.  
Your personal data will be used strictly for recruitment purposes.

IIX is an equal-opportunity employer.

**Submission:** Please submit a cover letter and a resume. A test on technical knowledge will also be required if you are shortlisted or you can provide your work samples. Qualified candidates will be considered and contacted by a member of the IIX team for interviews and to discuss your skills, interests and experiences.

title: Technical Designer - Senior
description:
Job Description

At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We‚Äôre not just designers. We‚Äôre tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems. Whether you‚Äôre into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there‚Äôs something here for everyone.

Our depth of expertise spans disciplines‚Äîfrom aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we‚Äôre refreshing a retailer‚Äôs brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.

Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.

As the world‚Äôs largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.

Your Role

As a Gensler¬†Senior Technical Designer, you will work with design team to produce projects that are of technical excellence. You‚Äôre a fit for this role if you have experience in construction documentation, are proficient in Revit, and enjoy working with a team of highly creative, collaborative team dedicated to innovation problem solving and design excellence.

¬†What You Will Do

  • Provide expertise by reviewing and providing technical viewpoint/advice on all local construction documents to ensure compliance with firm-wide standards, building systems, codes and regulatory requirements.

  • Support and set the project up for technical excellence and success project delivery.

  • Responsible for setting up and managing the technical standards and submission processes and documentations.

  • Track circular updates from the authorities and provide awareness to the office on recent changes in statutory guidelines or COPs as part of the continuous professional development.

  • Possess extensive code knowledge and able to address and solves related questions from various stakeholders.

  • Reviews feedback from client interviews to determine technical requirements for the design and may attend some client interviews.

  • Lead the work in the preparation, reviewing and documentation of architectural/technical documents for submission, tender and construction purposes.

  • Produce accurate technical and contract documentation for construction of project.

  • Participate in construction administration, evaluate bids, conduct site visits, address technical issues, and maintain quality control during construction.

  • Work with consultants, contractors, fabricators, specification writers, and regulatory agencies to meet overall project objectives.

  • Contribute to office activities, initiatives, and learning programs.

  • Be an advocate for Gensler sustainability commitments internally and externally.

  • Make sustainability an integral part of every project.

  • Define project sustainability targets in collaboration with the client and the project team at the start of each project.

  • Understand clients ESG goals and work with project teams towards achieving them.

  • Support and encourage team members to pursue sustainability learning.

  • The Firm may vary these duties and responsibilities as necessary to meet its business requirements.

Your Qualifications

Required

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in Architecture

  • At least 15+ years of project experience, preferably in Critical Facilities projects (i.e. data centers, command and control centers, high-performance computing, etc.) or similarly complex projects that may include science laboratories/ national laboratories, high-tech manufacturing light- industrial/ manufacturing, healthcare, aviation & transportation, etc.).

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills that work well in an interdisciplinary, fast-paced environment

  • Strong time management and organizational skills are imperative to juggle multiple tasks, clients and resources

  • Must be a motivated self-starter with excellent communication skills and the ability to problem solve both individually and as a part of a project team

  • Must have the ability to maintain existing client relationships and build new client relationships through successful project delivery

  • Strong leadership, organizational, communication and relationship management skills

  • Extensive experience in construction document preparation, including detailing and field observation.

  • Knowledge of building materials, specifications and construction techniques specific to core and shell architecture is required.

  • Strong Revit skills, Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator), Microsoft Office experience desired. AutoCAD, Sketchup, Rhino, Enscape, VRay are also beneficial.

Life at Gensler

As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to ‚ÄúWell-being Week,‚Äù our offices reflect our people‚Äôs diverse interests.

We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.

As part of the firm‚Äôs commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Brand/Graphic Designer - Mid Level
description:
At Gensler,¬†we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We‚Äôre not just designers. We‚Äôre tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems.¬† Whether you‚Äôre into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there‚Äôs something here for everyone.

Our depth of expertise spans disciplines‚Äîfrom aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we‚Äôre refreshing a retailer‚Äôs brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.

Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.

As the world‚Äôs largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030. ¬†

Your Role

As a Brand/Graphic Designer, you must love to push new ideas, be passionate about design and get excited about working on diverse projects with extremely talented creative leaders and teams. You will leverage your passion and expertise as a Brand/Graphic Designer to drive the design of our project forward and enhance the human experience of the spaces and structures we design.

As part of the Brand team, your role will be both hands-on ‚Äì injecting progressive, strategic design-thinking into the work - as well as higher level oversight to guide the approach and execution as you partner with Gensler practice areas including architecture, interiors, brand, digital, and consulting to ensure design is thoughtfully considered and integrated within the overall design vision.

You should be ready to present work to client stakeholders and represent our firm‚Äôs culture & principles. Additionally, you will provide direction and leadership to junior staff working on their project teams, scope design phases of projects accurately and efficiently, and attend pitches and industry events as required.

What You Will Do

  • Interpret client briefs and translate them into strategic, storytelling-driven design solutions that elevate brand identity.

  • Transform concepts into visually engaging narratives across multiple mediums, ensuring alignment with brand strategy and project objectives.

  • Create and refine brand assets including logos, typography, color palettes, and comprehensive brand guidelines.

  • Facilitate and lead design conversations for brand assignments, partnering closely with strategy, architecture, and interior teams to deliver integrated solutions.

  • Prepare and present design concepts and creative materials through compelling stories and well-crafted presentations.

  • Contribute to RFP responses, account growth initiatives, and advancement of the brand practice area.

  • Stay ahead of design trends, tools, and best practices to bring fresh, innovative ideas to projects.

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to clients on all creative and brand-related endeavors.

  • Develop, motivate, and mentor junior designers, fostering a culture of creativity and excellence.

  • Support project sustainability targets throughout project phases and actively engage in delivering them. Coordinate sustainability targets with project consultants and engineers.

  • Implement sustainable design strategies in every project stage and investigate solutions to sustainable design challenges.

  • Work collaboratively with the team to optimize sustainability performance through design iterations and research.

  • Lead climate focused analysis and studies for each project.

Your Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in graphic design, industrial design, environmental design, architecture, visual communication or related field

  • Minimum 8 years‚Äô professional experience in environmental graphic design, print/digital design, or similar studio experience

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills that work well in an interdisciplinary, fast-paced environment

  • Strong time management and organizational skills are imperative to juggle multiple tasks, clients and resources

  • Advanced storytelling and conceptual thinking skills.

  • Strong leadership and ability to manage complex projects.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills for client engagement.

  • Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop) and MS Office and proficiency in SketchUp or other 3D modelling programs a plus

  • Working knowledge of motion graphics software, digital video editing, or other skills related to designing for and creating dynamic content a plus

  • Knowledge in sustainable design principles required.

  • LEED, WELL, Fitwel, LFA, Greenmark or other rating systems accreditation preferable.

  • Previous experience in sustainable design projects preferable. Especially built projects with LEED, Living Building Challenge, WELL Building Standard, Fitwel and /or Net Zero Building certification.

  • Demonstrate a collaborative and integrated approach towards achieving high sustainability project goals.

To be considered, please submit portfolio and/or work samples in PDF format.

Life at Gensler

As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to ‚ÄúWell-being Week,‚Äù our offices reflect our people‚Äôs diverse interests.

We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.

As part of the firm‚Äôs commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Research Associate/Fellow/Senior RF (Centre for Sustainable Medicine)
description:
Interested applicants are invited to apply directly at the NUS Career Portal

Your application will be processed only if you apply via NUS Career Portal

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.


Job Description

Climate change is the defining challenge of our time, shaping the health of populations for generations to come. The National University of Singapore is tackling this crisis through its Centre for Sustainable Medicine (CoSM), working to accelerate the transition to low-carbon, climate-resilient health systems.

Purpose of the Post
We invite applications for a motivated Research Associate, Research Fellow, or Senior Research Fellow to play a central role in the education, research, and operational delivery of CoSM at the National University of Singapore.

The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating the delivery of our education programmes, managing cross-functional workstreams that enable effective research and education programme execution across the Centre, and contributing to the translation of research into policy and practice.

The successful candidate will oversee a small team and shape how sustainable healthcare is taught, implemented, and scaled across Singapore and the Asia-Pacific.

Key Responsibilities and Roles include:

  1. Research and education programme leadershipUndertake research related to sustainable healthcare education, system transformation, among others, contributing to the Centre‚Äôs broader research agendaCoodinate and deliver CoSM‚Äôs education portfolio, including the MSc and Executive Fellowship in Sustainable Healthcare, undergraduate courses, and in-hospital clinical educationOversee core academic activities such as timetabling, faculty and guest lecturer coordination, student engagement, and reportingContribute to curriculum development and delivery of teaching across multiple formats (e.g. lectures, workshops, online modules), with a focus on climate and health, and health system sustainabilitySupervise and mentor a small cross-functional team working across research and education delivery, ensuring alignment with the Centre‚Äôs strategic priorities
  2. Operations and programme coordinationCoordinate operational processes that underpin the successful implementation of the Centre‚Äôs research and education programmes and initiatives, including:Managing financial and procurement processes, including budgeting, expense monitoring, raising purchase orders, vendor onboarding, and invoice processingOverseeing full cycle grant management, from coordination of funding proposals to ensuring timely reporting and effective administrationSupporting human resource processes in collaboration with Centre leadership, including recruitment and onboarding, and facilitating formation of new research and delivery teams as the Centre scales its workStrengthen internal delivery systems, including knowledge management structures, workflow documentation, SOPs, and digital tools that enhance programme quality and coordination
  3. Research translation and impactContribute to academic publications, technical reports, policy briefs, and thought pieces that extend the reach and application of the Centre‚Äôs researchSupport the translation of research outputs into frameworks, tools, and communications for decision-makers in government, healthcare institutions, and international organisationsHelp ensure research activities are aligned with CoSM‚Äôs broader strategy and impact goals

Qualifications

The applicant must:
a)

For Research Associate: Hold a master‚Äôs degree in any discipline. A background in medicine, public policy, public health, sustainability and environmental sciences, or education is advantageous.

For Research Fellow and Senior Research Fellow: Hold a PhD in a relevant field such as medicine, public policy, public health, sustainability and environmental sciences, or education. Postdoctoral experience is advantageous.

b) Have at least 5 years of working experience, including project management and team leadership.

c) Demonstrate experience in coordinating or managing multi-partner and complex programmes, with a strong ability to align various objectives and workstreams.

d) Exhibit excellent communication skills and be capable of managing a wide range of stakeholders, including academics, practitioners, and policymakers.

e) Be resourceful, organised, adaptable, and comfortable navigating institutional processes in support of programme delivery.

The ideal applicant should also:
a) Have experience in curriculum development or teaching at the university or professional level.

b) Have a track record in applied research, policy translation, sustainability communications, ideally within the healthcare, public health, or environmental sectors.

c) Have experience working and familiarity with operational processes in academic institutions, government, international organisations, or healthcare institutions.

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate‚Äôs qualifications and experience. Informal enquiries are welcome and should be made through email¬†(joincosm@nus.edu.sg).

Formal application: Please submit your application, indicating current/expected salary, supported by a detailed CV (including personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications/oral presentations and full contacts of three (3) referees to the NUS Career Portal. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: Service Sustainability Manager
description:
Job Summary

The Service Sustainability Manager plays a critical role in ensuring the reliable performance of bbp‚Äôs energy management solutions and delivering high standards of customer satisfaction. This role oversees service operations, ensures compliance with engineering best practices, drives maintenance excellence, and supports commercial growth through close collaboration with internal teams and clients.


Key Responsibilities

1. Operational Excellence & Technical Oversight

  • Manage and monitor the performance of bbp and client systems to ensure ongoing energy savings and contract compliance.
  • Provide expert technical support for escalated customer issues and coordinate resolution efforts across internal and external teams.
  • Approve critical repair and maintenance works, ensuring alignment with engineering standards.
  • Conduct site visits to troubleshoot persistent or high-impact issues and lead the development of resolution plans.
  • Collaborate with the Data Analytics team to improve automation of performance tracking, fault detection, and reporting.

2. Emergency & Crisis Management

  • Lead response efforts to emergency situations, including diagnosis and recovery planning.
  • Investigate critical field issues and performance deviations, conduct root cause analysis, and escalate when necessary.
  • Ensure business continuity through effective resolution of system failures or disruptions.

3. Maintenance Strategy & Execution

  • Plan and oversee preventive, corrective, and predictive maintenance activities to preserve system performance.
  • Optimize maintenance schedules to minimize downtime and ensure cost-efficiency.
  • Provide technical guidance on maintenance standards and resource planning.
  • Enforce strict adherence to health and safety regulations across both internal and subcontractor teams.

4. Team Development & Leadership

  • Lead and mentor a team of Service Sustainability Engineers.
  • Oversee talent acquisition, training, and capability development aligned with bbp‚Äôs service strategy.
  • Foster a high-performance culture rooted in collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.

5. Customer Engagement, Service Management & Continuous Improvement

  • Act as a Customer Relationship Ambassador to enhance customer satisfaction and ensure smooth service delivery.
  • Monitor and follow up on customer feedback, issues, and service requests.
  • Drive timely responses and resolution from relevant stakeholders.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and internal departments.
  • Design and execute customer engagement strategies aimed at enhancing service value and experience.

Qualifications

  • Degree or Diploma in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, or related field.
  • Certification in Refrigeration, Air-conditioning, or Energy Management is advantageous.
  • Singapore Certified Energy Manager (SCEM) certification is a plus.
  • Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience in energy management, with strong field exposure to HVAC systems (e.g., chillers, AHUs).
  • Hands-on experience with customer engagement, service management and/or mechanical, electrical, and control systems preferred.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office and analytical tools.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a data-driven mindset.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; trusted advisor to clients.
  • Able to manage multiple projects and thrive in a dynamic environment.
  • Willing to travel and engage in fieldwork as needed.
